7af3230 : Tidy up determination of the PLAT_ macros a bit.
d2aac89 : initUnwindContext: put back into the loop, some initialisations for ARM which were originally in the loop but inadvertantly got lifted out during recent merging. This appears to make stack unwinding work again on ARM-Linux.
9365e3f : Unbreak stack unwinding on x86-linux and amd64-linux following merge of ARM CFI unwinding in r10986.
445dbef : Generate a couple more ARM specific offsets; also R1 on ppc32/64.
3026f71 : Make the Dwarf3 CFI stack unwinding machinery work on arm-linux too. This is a first step towards making not be completely x86/amd64-linux specific, and so replaces some x86/amd64-specific stuff with more general constructions:
4cb6bf7 : Make Callgrind, DRD and Ptrcheck build on arm-linux.
3e21612 : Don't use -Wdeclaration-after-statement. We long since abandoned any pretense of being buildable with gcc prior to 3.0, hence there's no point in having this flag.
67b38c3 : n-break build on x86-darwin following r10982.

116458b : Changes: - Made sure that C++ compilers do not complain about the header files include/pub_tool_libcassert.h and include/pub_tool_basics.h. - Added the source file none/tests/valgrind_cpp_test.cpp. This source file is compiled together with the regression tests in order to verify that Valgrind's public header files compile cleanly with a C++ compiler. These modifications are based on a patch provided by Konstantin Serebryany.
e1c1a24 : Handle adjtimex being called in adjtime mode correctly. Closes #219538. Validate the constant field with ADJ_TAI is used in an adjtimex call.
92df0ea : Document the 'cc' parameter for OSet creation.
afdb011 : Callgrind: fix bug 217849: Switch to running thread in CLG_(post_signal)

e32a3b0 : Double the size of some table to do with reading CIEs.
8688a72 : Testing hacklet, to fill the vex tmp allocation area before each translation, with 0x00 or 0xFF or whatever.
f41999a : Cope with prelink splitting the bss section of an ELF file into separate dynbss and bss sections by merging them back together again.
41f4c85 : It seems whoever wrote the preadv and pwritev system calls in the kernel decided it would be fun to make them always take the low word of the offset argument before the high word regardless of the endianism of the system... Consistency - they've heard of it...
d864cad : Add some newlines to make signal debugging messages more readable.
db5907d : Track vex r1930 (Change the IR representation of load linked and store conditional.) Completes the fix of #215771.
e768e92 : Change the IR representation of load linked and store conditional. They are now moved out into their own new IRStmt kind (IRStmt_LLSC), and are not treated merely as variants of standard loads (IRExpr_Load) or store (IRStmt_Store). This is necessary because load linked is a load with a side effect (lodging a reservation), hence it cannot be an IRExpr since IRExprs denote side-effect free value computations.
0ca89e0 : Fix type in r10951. Not sure why this didn't cause a compilation error, but least on ppc32-linux it didn't.
710f7cb : Add support for accept4 system call based on patch from Dodji Seketeli. Part fix for #215973.
acb7c34 : Wire up vhangup system call on amd64/ppc32/ppc64 linux platforms. Patch from Dodji Seketeli. Part fix for #215973.
d709b1d : Add support for fallocate system call on 32 bit (x86/ppc32) linux systems based on patch from Dodji Seketeli. Part fix for #215973.
c0fe32a : Clean up support for sync_file_range system call and add second version used by ppc platforms based on patch from Dodji Seketeli. Part fix for #215973.
ca78724 : Rename LOHI64 to MERGE64 and make it work correctly on big endian platforms. Also add MERGE64_FIRST and MERGE64_SECOND macros to help produce the right argument names in error messages on big/little endian platforms.
b34f5af : Split long lines.
e6784f5 : Added to repository.
9ceaa97 : Re-enable old support for adjtimex system call based on patch from Dodji Seketeli. Part fix for #215973.

f43793a : Handle the dup3 system call. Closes #215448.
95e154c : Use a shorter instruction encoding for "mov $smallish positive int, %reg". Reduces generated code size by about 1% for Memcheck.
3b09235 : Specialise "S after 32-bit SUB/CMP"; improves performance by about 2% for Memcheck running bzip2.

753ab9d : Correctly handle MPI_STATUS{ES}_IGNORE as valid values for MPI_Status* arguments (as opposed to segfaulting :-)

bbcf0e2 : If a signal arrives when a thread which has just finished executing a system call is between the blksys_committed and blksys_finished markers in the system call routine then the post handler for the system call was failing to run.
d264514 : Add support for ELF indirect functions. These are symbols of type STT_GNU_IFUNC which, instead of pointing directly at the function, point at a routine which will return the address of the real function. Redirection of indirect functions is handled by valgrind as follows:

a654706 : Removed the restriction that the size argument of drd_pre_mem_read_asciiz() should be less than 4096 bytes. This function is called a.o. for the path argument of the open() system call. This path can be longer than 4096 bytes. Should fix bug #211941.

9bb8119 : Unmap the vdso as well as suppressing it by dropping the auxv entry as on some systems the vdso will be at a random address and can conflict with things like wine that need to tightly control where things are mapped.

1ffe69e : Comment that we never actually expect to see the string ]]> in a generated suppression, and hence the problem of having to split it into multiple CDATA blocks is moot.
f585e48 : Increase the maximum size of the conflict cache even more, to 30 million.
e77c724 : Minor changes w.r.t. --read-var-info=, threading support, and supported glibc versions.
3d49844 : Update the Helgrind manual for 3.5.0.
f56d255 : ppc32-linux: di_notify_mmap: accept data sections mapped rwx as well as ones mapped rw-. Fixes #190820. Really, this logic is still pretty ropey; we could do a lot better here.
f95c30b : tweak 32/64-bit darwin stuff
3b7f39b : Fix the access_extended wrapper, which was rather broken. That's what I get for not testing properly. Added a regtest for it too. Fixes bug 200760 (again, properly this time).
de78f9a : Followup to r10822: send the CDATA text to the XML channel, not the text one. Duh.
c25bcb4 : Fix "make check" on Darwin.
7ca100d : Fix a couple of errors in the revised XML generation that were spotted by Ashley Pittman:
588adef : When generating XML output for suppressions, print the suppression both wrapped up in XML tags (as before) but also in plain text in a sequence of CDATA blocks. Normally only one, but in the worst case the raw data will have ]]> in it, in which case it needs to be split across two CDATA blocks.

6afc6b5 : Updated Subversion ignore list.
34f980e : More expected output updates because of r10783.
bcc8449 : Modified annotate_ignore_rw test such that it now verifies that ANNOTATE_IGNORE_READS_AND_WRITES_END() really works.
3a1b9a2 : Add a crappy wrapper for access_extended(), one of the more ridiculous syscalls I've had the displeasure of encountering. Due to its ridiculousness, the wrapper misses a PRE_MEM_WRITE check and so can result in false positives. The POST_MEM_WRITE update is present, though, so it shouldn't cause subsequent problems. Fixes bug 200760.

230c8f0 : tweak
97db761 : Various option-related tweaks:
2ec2b72 : This wasn't supposed to be part of r10701.
7316df2 : Various manual fix-ups: - Use "heap blocks" rather than "malloc'd blocks" as heap blocks covers calloc, realloc, new, new[], memalign, etc.
99319b3 : This should have been removed in r10699.
f3977a3 : Don't wrap the "Command:" line, as doing so makes cutting-and-pasting the command difficult. Also, when wrapping I was failing to factor in the escape chars needed for chars like ' '; now I don't need to. And this means the 'long-command' test is no longer necessary. In other words, favour utility and simplicity over aesthetics.
07de5dd : Ignore structure members with no location - thiscan happen with static const members in C++ code which are compile time constants that do no exist in the class. They're not of any interest to us so we ignore them.
de1b03d : Patch to remember/restore CFA state on DW_CFA_{remember,restore}_state. In addition to that it fixes a bug in restore_ctx handling, where it was restoring the state from the same stack level in restore_ctx context as is current in ctx, which is wrong, the CIE likely has no DW_CFA_remember_state at all, while the FDE could have one. (Jakub Jelinek). This is #200029, patch in comment #2.
d801177 : Use Dwarf3 section version numbers as specified in Appendix F of the Dwarf3 standard. (Jakub Jelinek). This is #200029, patch in comment #1.
7225992 : Handle some more DW_TAG_subrange_type cases which Fedora 11's gcc 4.4.0 seems to generate.
d55f0d9 : With the recent VG_(message) change, VALGRIND_{PRINTF,PRINTF_BACKTRACE,INTERNAL_PRINTF} were no longer appending newlines. This meant that --trace-malloc=yes spewed everything onto a single line, among other things.
cb5d697 : Minor improvements to printing w.r.t. sync checking / resyncing.
a9269e3 : Add /Applications to the list of directories in which not to try to auto-run dsymutil.
0c58a74 : Forgot to add these in r10690.
f8a11cf : In the "Command:" line in the preamble, escape special chars such as ' ' and '\\'.

b57e693 : Reinstating a heavily modified version of r10402. This is to do with #190429.
f386139 : Change name of H1 history flag from --history-level=partial (which I can never remember) to --history-level=approx.
2d2ea2f : Attend to space leaks, to the extent that I can.
8ab2c13 : Small improvements, including some commenting, for the H1 history mechanism.
0e08b10 : Restored two of the suppression patterns removed in the previous commit.
9e4554c : Cleaned up DRD's Linux suppression patterns: - Grouped the three suppression patterns for ld into a single suppression pattern. - Assigned more descriptive names to the suppression patterns. - Improved suppression pattern documentation. - Removed suppression patterns that were added before VEX supported atomic instructions and that are no longer necessary with the current version of VEX.
950d29a : Reverted to r10509.
dbaced0 : Added an output variant for the pth_cancel_locked regression test. Apparently when canceling a thread waiting inside pthread_cond_wait() on Linux the specified mutex is left unlocked while on Darwin the mutex specified in the pthread_cond_wait() call is reacquired before the thread is terminated.
94fb8d2 : Report mutex errors for each different mutex even if the call stacks are identical.
4f66a77 : Builds again on Darwin.
791a0c6 : Implemented a more systematic approach for intercepting POSIX threads functions: for each function name to intercept, intercept the function name itself, the function name with @* appended (versioned symbols on Linux) and the function name with $* appended (versioned symbols on Darwin). Updated filter_stderr such that symbol versions are removed. Updated the expected output files that contain names of intercepted functions.
e3f1e59 : (almost completely just function renaming):
49e05bc : Darwin-specific followup to r10676 (helgrind: Don't instrument any code in ld.so).
a0eee32 : Don't instrument any code in ld.so. Doing so merely generates a large number of races which have to be expensively suppressed, so it's better not to do so.
b80fa96 : Only consider two error contexts as equivalent if the contexts have another type than "data race error" or if both data race error contexts refer to the same access type and the same access size.
b48bde2 : Report an error message instead of triggering an assertion failure when a non-existing thread ID is passed to pthread_join() or pthread_cancel().

b48b49e : Fix compile error.
ddaef35 : Prettify the messages printed when segment mismatches happen. Also get rid of two unnecessary gotos.

To avoid duplication/overlap, I removed these altogether from the Quick Start Guide, and shortened them in the intro.
0211454 : Improve checking for pthread_mutex_cond operations: implement a check for consistent binding between the CV and the mutex, as specified by POSIX. Add commented out code for some other checks that could be done but aren't, as they'd give false positives.

5a92b4c : Make lsframe1, lsframe2 and stack_changes Linux-only since they all fault natively on Mac.
0a96643 : Make sure the x86 direction flag is cleared again if we set it as part of a test, as the x86 requires it to be clear when any function is called and gcc 4.3.0 and later rely on that. Fixes #201708.
a5453e9 : Clarify a comment.
a617d11 : Follow-up of r10638 and r10639: explained in the manual that DRD is now able to perform rwlock type checking.
67707ec : - Added more rwlock type checking. - The rwlock_type_checking test should now no longer trigger a sporadic deadlock.
c844150 : Implemented type checking for reader-writer synchronization objects: complain upon attempts to use a POSIX rwlock where a user-defined rwlock is expected and vice versa.
df2a1f7 : Added a new suppression pattern for Darwin. This is necessary because of the changes introduced by r10634.
80ad555 : Removed -q from the Valgrind options for the bar_bad and bar_trivial tests.
9a787f8 : Support epoll_create and epoll_create1 in ptrcheck. Fixes #189762.
61d36ff : - Moved printing the thread number to the function that prints the preamble. - Matching suppression types with error contexts does now work properly. - Cleanup: added more comments, renamed some functions, removed an unused function argument.
8c979e2 : Made the error reporting behavior of DRD similar to that of other Valgrind tools: if the same kind of error has been detected a second time with an identical call stack, count it as an error but do not print it a second time. The total number of detected errors remains unchanged but the number of error contexts is now reported correctly.
050eec5 : Fixed a bug in the code for reading suppression files: the line numbers reported in error messages were not correct. As an example, the following output was produced before this patch (not correct): $ ./vg-in-place --tool=helgrind --num-callers=1 /bin/true ... FATAL: in suppressions file ".in_place/default.supp" near line 893: suppression must contain at least one location line which is not "..." exiting now. $ ./vg-in-place --tool=drd --num-callers=1 /bin/true FATAL: in suppressions file ".in_place/default.supp" near line 475: suppression must contain at least one location line which is not "..." exiting now.
4f2168d : Updated expected output of tc23_bogus_condwait for Darwin because the test program has been modified (r10623).
3320ef1 : Re-enabled the regression tests tc17_sembar and tc23_bogus_condwait for DRD on Darwin.
94be743 : Make sure the entire symbol is swapped when canonicaliseSymtab decides that two overlapping symbols needs to be swapped. Fixes #163253.
cd8eafb : Relatively inconsequential tidying of the Helgrind supps for Darwin.
f35450e : Add a new output file for tc12_rwl_trivial. It unfortunately can't be the same as the glibc one, because glibc is broken in the sense that it doesn't return an error code for an attempt to unlock a not-locked rwlock, and the returned error code affects Helgrind's output.

0c6bf35 : DRD is no longer considered experimental on Darwin.
6e05836 : Generalized some suppression patterns and added several new suppression patterns.
65912d6 : Updated testing instructions.
83e7eb6 : Fixed an assertion failure that was triggered on Darwin by calling malloc_zone_realloc().
fe212db : DRD does now support sem_open() and sem_close().
b3f3340 : Fixed bug in DRD's rwlock implementation that caused the regression test called rwlock_test to fail sometimes on Darwin. The fact that this test only failed on Darwin and not on Linux implies that on Linux after unlocking an rwlock that was locked for writing there always happens a context switch to another thread waiting for acquiring the rwlock, and that this is not the case on Darwin.
ea7e8b6 : Uncomment this; not sure why it was commented out.
54bfceb : DRD now works on Darwin!
bac8ede : Add a note about our suspect handling of brk(). And disable the brk() part of origin1-yes.c, because it's a pain, giving different results on different systems. This allowed origin1-yes.stderr.exp-darwin to be removed.
b8def27 : Updated expected output after r10592.
3c9afb1 : Print an easy-to-understand message in case the client program tries to create more threads than what is currently supported by DRD.
07c142e : rwlock_test: added more internal error checking.
36003e0 : Removed those suppression patterns that became superfluous because of r10584.
2e1470c : Made number of threads and number of iterations configurable. Decreased stack size allocated per thread.
23f1200 : Various improvements:
9f52e4f : Updated Subversion ignore lists.
daa5da5 : Oops, this should have been included in r10583 ("New methods in WordXA:")
5a1ea4c : Made test output operating system independent by suppressing information about conflicting segments.
d53a34b : Update.
dd75cdf : Replaced code for suppressing the stack memory in use at the time a thread is being created by code for suppressing the memory allocated from inside the pthread_create() call. The new implementation should be a more portable solution for suppressing data races triggered by the thread-local-storage implementation of a Pthreads library.
e2253bf : New methods in WordXA:
dbe8943 : Fix a compile warning.
35db56c : A fix for bug 186796: suppression symbol names were being truncated if they were longer than 200 chars. Now dynamic memory is used and so they can be arbitrarily long in theory, although in practice it bombs out at 100,000 for sanity purposes. This required adjusting the core/tool interface for read_extra_suppression_info().
0cc0857 : Update expected output, so at least Helgrind runs clean on openSUSE 11.0 x86_64.
3d684ca : Reverted r10511.
8f105fa : Fixed bug 149878 (calloc overflow). This disables some of the calloc silly arg checking, but that's no great loss.
7c5747d : Run the pth_inconsistent_cond_wait in quiet mode.
9ccf35f : Added command line option -q, which allows to suppress printing an error message if a Pthreads call fails.
bf599f7 : mremap2 is a totally unreliable test; it's the only test that fails on a number of Linux machines. This change makes it more reliable, at the cost of being less specific.
82baca7 : This was meant to go in with r10573.
d6db259 : In r10465 --time-stamp=yes got slightly broken -- the space between the time and the PID was removed. This commit adds it back in. It also adds a basic test that would have detected this regression, and also the breakage in bug 200990.
f73d87f : Add Valgrind version back into the preamble.
15e3dc4 : The pc-file output from the exp-bbv tool is mildly implementation dependent. This causes the regression test to fail with the "million" benchmark on a Fedora 9 system. For now, remove the pc-file part of the test, and later I'll come up with a better way of testing this feature.
c4b5674 : Labels printed with semaphore tracing enabled do now match the function names assigned by POSIX.

e2b9823 : More documentation updates.
9f717f5 : Updated line numbers in expected output -- these line numbers changed because of r10523.
99adf33 : Made these tests run successfully on Darwin.
e4b9921 : Updated expected output.
9e341ca : Tell the register allocator on x86 that xmm0..7 are trashed across function calls. This forces it to handle them as caller-saved, which is (to the extent that it's possible to tell) what the ELF ABI requires. Lack of this has been observed to corrupt floating point computations in tools that use the xmm registers in the helper functions called from generated code. This change brings the x86 backend into line with the amd64 backend, the latter of which has always treated the xmm regs as caller-saved.
ff971fe : Updated documentation related to the --read-var-info flag.
0f99be6 : Support LODS on amd64. Fixes #189737.
0cd0697 : Removed code for handling --read-var-info from DRD since the Valgrind core already interprets this flag.
83cc386 : Renamed --var-info=yes to --read-var-info=yes.
2df5b00 : Renamed --var-info to --read-var-info.
27974c9 : Updated *.exp files after r10515.
be7e31a : Fix VG_(read_millisecond_timer) on Darwin. Fixes bug 200990.
6fe737b : Tweaks for Darwin.

40d1d21 : Fix disassembly printing of cmpxchg insns (don't print "lock" twice).
afed4c5 : Track vex r1907 (introduce Iop_CmpCas{EQ,NE}{8,16,32,64} and use them for CAS-success? tests).
1fb8c92 : Add new integer comparison primitives Iop_CasCmp{EQ,NE}{8,16,32,64}, which are semantically identical to Iop_Cmp{EQ,NE}{8,16,32,64}. Use these new primitives instead of the normal ones, in the tests following IR-level compare-and-swap operations, which establish whether or not the CAS succeeded. This is all for Memcheck's benefit, as it really needs to be able to identify which comparisons are CAS-success tests and which aren't. This is all described in great detail in memcheck/mc_translate.c in the comment "COMMENT_ON_CasCmpEQ".

8b68b64 : This commit merges the BUILD_TWEAKS branch onto the trunk. It has the following improvements:
109d5da : Fixed typo.
9dedafe : Statistics: fixed bug introduced in r10356.
9f617a8 : Statistics: do not only count DRD_(bm_new)() calls but also DRD_(bm_init)() calls as level one bitmap creation events.
f6ec1fe : Combined DRD_(thread_new_segment)() and DRD_(thread_combine_vc_sync)() into the function DRD_(thread_new_segment_and_combine_vc)() because before DRD_(thread_combine_vc_sync)() was called the function DRD_(thread_new_segment)() was always called.

052f170 : Remove references to the now-defunct INSTALL file.
6d78998 : Generalized a libgomp suppression pattern.
87beea5 : Updated test plan.
66e331e : Updated list of bugs fixed in 3.5.0.
3eecd9a : Robustness improvement: print an error message instead of triggering an assertion failure upon semaphore reinitialization during sem_wait().
7627be3 : Consistency improvement: made sure that for all synchronization operations vector clocks are combined after having created a new segment instead of before.
57ae7ad : - Robustness improvement: do not trigger an assertion failure if one thread destroys and reinitializes a semaphore another thread is waiting on but print an error message instead. - Behavior change: always decrement 'value', even if this makes value negative. - Updated expected output files.
c02dde4 : Disabled libgomp intercepts. Since libgomp support was added to DRD, the libgomp ABI has changed. Two new functions have been added, namely gomp_team_barrier_wait() and gomp_team_barrier_wake(). The simplest way to support all libgomp functions is by disabling the libgomp intercepts. This fixes bug #195169.
c42f2b9 : Updated test plan.
7cb550f : Increased gcc version from 4.3.2 to 4.4.0.
3e606a4 : x86-linux: sys_set_thread_area: don't allocate GDT entry number zero, and reject attempts to use it. This is because the hardware does not allow entry zero to be used, and apparently doing so confuses some code (perhaps Windows apps running on Wine). Derived from a patch by John Reiser.
f31cce9 : Increase a hard limit that was reached in the wild.
4e8808b : For no apparent reason, the machine-dependent syscall thread_fast_set_cthread_self was being called pthread_set_self. This commit fixes this.

Updated expected output files where necessary. - Modified drd/test/Makefile.am such that the tests using gcc's built-in functions for atomic memory access such that these are only compiled when the gcc version in use supports these built-in functions.

cec804b : Change 'nightly' to print "(unchanged)" at the start of the email subject line if the results are unchanged from 24 hours ago. Makes it easier to see (or filter) if results are unchanged.
9cf79b5 : Some tweaks to make more tests pass, or get closer to passing, on --enable-only32bit builds on my Ubuntu box:
8225cc0 : This commit completely overhauls the leak checker. In particular:
402c9ee : Keep track of the svma and bias values for the debug data separately as they may be different to those for other sections of the ELF file if we have separated debug information and the main file has been prelinked since they were split. Fixes bug #185816.
28eab5b : Reverted last commit (r9326) -- its commit message did not make sense.
995b6f9 : Added vgopts: --var-info=yes.
cbb07d9 : Fixed another unintended data race.

61485ab : tests/arch_test is currently being used for two purposes: - by vg_regtest for determining if a directory name matches an architecture; - by various .vgtest files for detecting x86/AMD64 features.

132fdb0 : Add more testing to memcheck/tests/unit_libcbase.c.
8d1181d : Remove WERROR. It's not much use because getting Valgrind to build without errors on all platforms is very difficult.
dcfac13 : Generalise a couple of Qt4 suppressions (David Faure).
0d2e58f : Use 'diff -u' for regtests if it's supported, its output it much easier to read than plain 'diff'.
b0e34f7 : Remove toobig-allocs.c -- it was unreliable and didn't test any functionality of note.
79a5cc4 : Move memcheck/tests/x86/bug133694 into memcheck/tests/x86-linux -- it uses MAP_FIXED and so is highly unportable, and doesn't work on x86/Darwin.
a601553 : Delete memcheck/tests/zeropage. The original purpose of the test is no longer valid, as the comment indicates. Furthermore it mmaps arbitrary bits of address space and so is horribly unportable, and doesn't work on Darwin.
83df0b6 : atoll() is a terrible function -- you can't do any error checking with it. Some of our option processing code uses it. This means that eg. '--log-fd=9xxx' logs to fd 9, and '--log-fd=blahblahblah' logs to 0 (because atoll() returns 0 if the string doesn't contain a number!)
09ee78e : Callgrind: fix a few 'unused parameter' warnings
1dcee09 : Remove a number of unused parameters, found with -Wunused-parameter.
28be7aa : Minor performance optimization: reduced the number of client objects that are inspected during memory deallocation.
889a5d6 : Declared those function arguments that are not modified as const.

07891f9 : Test files were being passed multiple arch options (eg. "-m32 -m64") when built. This worked fine on the x86/Linux and AMD64/Linux but broke ppc*/Linux. This commit fixes the problem. Thanks to Bart for spotting it.

7441b99 : Fix an XML error spotted by Bart.
ded294b : Make fcntl and fcntl64 wrappers more consistent.
776a91e : Updated documentation.
b235a67 : Added regression test for detection of unsynchronized pthread_barrier_wait() and pthread_barrier_delete() calls.
1344d6c : - Bug fix: swapped order of VG_(OSetGen_Remove)() and (*p->any.cleanup)(p) such that the "first observed at" information is now included in error messages. - Performance optimization: started using VG_(OSetGen_ResetIterAt)().
ae912a0 : Updated test plan.
f6ff365 : VG_(OSetGen_ResetIterAt)() now also works for OSet's that do not have an explicit comparison function.
d2c5eae : Changes: - pthread_barrier_wait() intercept now passes the information to the DRD tool whether or not this function returned PTHREAD_BARRIER_SERIAL_THREAD. This information is now displayed when the command-line option --trace-barrier=yes has been specified. - Changed the cleanup functions for client objects that are called just before a thread stops into callback functions. - Added DRD_(clientobj_delete_thread)(). - Removed DRD_(clientobj_resetiter)(void) and DRD_(clientobj_next)(). - Added test for race conditions between pthread_barrier_wait() and pthread_barrier_destroy() calls. An error message is now printed if this condition has been detected. - Bug fix: pthread_barrier_delete() calls on barriers being waited upon are now reported. - Removed DRD_() wrapper from around the name of some static variables and functions.
add2c42 : Updated svn:ignore property in multiple directories.
7e6de96 : Documentation updates.

221666f : Forgot to add this file in the last commit.
8a0b704 : - Add 'unit_libcbase', the beginnings of a unit test module for m_libcbase. - Rename 'oset_test' as 'unit_oset' to make its meaning more clear. - Remove VG_(atoll36), VG_(strtoll8)() and VG_(strtoll36)(); they're not used and so untested, but easy to crib from similar functions if they need to be added again later.
fab6c89 : Updated cellbuzz configuration according to the changes made during the big upgrade of the Cellbuzz cluster in February 2009.
5304457 : Various build system clean-ups and simplifications: - Created Makefile.tool-tests.am, put standard AM_CFLAGS et al for tests in it. - A number of tests are shared between Helgrind and DRD. They used to be built in both directories. Now they are only built in helgrind/tests/, and the DRD .vgtest files just point to the executable in helgrind/tests/. Most of these (about 30) had the source files in helgrind/tests/; I moved the three that were in drd/tests/ into helgrind/tests/ for consistency. - Fixed rwlock_test, which was failing to run due to a wrong name in the .vgtest file. - Removed remnants of unused 'hello' test for Memcheck. - Avoided redundant flag specification in various places, esp. memcheck/tests/Makefile.am. - Removed unnecessary _AIX guards in some Linux-only tests.
466ed6e : Merged r9101 (make Massif tests work if VG_MIN_MALLOC_SZB==16) from the DARWIN branch, along with a few other minor things.
cda5a15 : For the fdleak_* tests, completely remove the stack traces showing where file descriptors came into existence, because there's too much variation and all the expected outputs are a pain. This allows 16 fdleak_*.exp[234] files to be removed.
8b140de : In the core, include malloc_usable_size() as one of the functions that must be replaced if malloc() et al are replaced by a tool. This is because different tools implement the function in different ways.
3f29886 : Remove unnecessary Memcheck test filters.
75a374b : Remove unused filter scripts from DRD.
f37a81b : Merged r9185 (fix up getsockopt mess) from the DARWIN branch, minus the Darwin-specific parts.
86562bd : - Updated copyright statements. - Improved consistency of source file headers.
55df6e7 : Just as for the regression tests of other Valgrind tools, do not explicitly state that these are licensed under the GPLv2 license but leave this implicit.
870f170 : Stack traces for Memcheck's syscall param errors are terribly unreliable, so I changed it to just filter the entire stack trace out for these errors (both normal and XML cases). The syscall name is still present in the error string. This allows a one or more alternative expected output files to be removed for several tests, which is A Very Good Thing.
107bc57 : Merge r9175 (don't run inappropriate OS- and platform-specific tests) from the DARWIN branch.

a764b37 : Restored the previous method for passing arguments from the creator thread to the created thread, since the new approach made some regression tests fail. It is not yet clear to me why.

82a0c5d : Added a missing #include directive.
5c3da01 : Relaxed an assert statement: a thread canceled by pthread_cancel() can really exit with synchr_nesting > 0.
3dbdc86 : Added DRD_(spinlock_init_or_unlock)().
227c659 : - Performance improvement: eliminated busy waiting from thread creation. - Applied DRD_() prefix to all names of functions that are not intercepts of client code. - Removed superfluous include directive, namely #include <inttypes.h>. - Removed hack for suppressing false positive reports on stdio / stderr because recently a suppression pattern was added for these races. - Removed unused code and declarations. - Added more comments. - Updated copyright statement.
292c1e2 : Renamed vg_thread_wrapper() into DRD_(thread_wrapper)().
2356798 : Updated copyright statement.
8b74ab9 : Added file to repository.
0458a12 : Moved 3 Linux-specific tests into linux/ directories.
e66ffee : Filter out everything after "(below main)" in a line. This will help with Darwin, for which such entries can occur within the executable, rather than within libc.
ac31b05 : Merge the non-Darwin parts of r9140 (install vgpreload .dSYMs), just to keep the trunk and DARWIN branch in sync.
6b7611b : Cleaned up the demangling mess:
6bf365c : Changed the way files are installed. Instead of going into $INSTALL/<platform>/<filename>, they go to $INSTALL/<filename>-<platform>. These filenames match those built in the build tree, and so simplifies the build system signficantly and avoids the horrible sed renamings that were previously required. This will also help greatly with the treatment of .dSYM debug directories in the DARWIN branch.
9818bee : Filter out "(core dumped)" after "Bus error" for consistency. This makes shell_zerolength pass on my Ubuntu 8.10 machine.
84f32b2 : Merge r9106 (fix a minor stack entry display bug) from the DARWIN branch.
6882443 : Cleaned up the mess that was the treatment of "below main" functions such as '__libc_start_main', in Massif, m_debuginfo and m_stacktrace. As part of this, --show-below-main is now visible to tools, and Massif pays attention to it.
e615466 : Merge part of r9129 (factor out duplicated Z-encodings of names) from the DARWIN branch.
618ce21 : Fix a typo.
254dafe : Don't install unnecessary .supp files (part 2 of 2).
40d0df5 : Makefile.flags.am Remove mentions of empty variables.
c61a616 : Switched from the Apache License to a BSD-style license in order to reduce the number of licences that applies to the source code of Valgrind.
808e20e : Merged r9120 (Merge Makefile.{inplace,install}.am, and simplify installation of libmpiwrap.so) from trunk.
3e65340 : Make Makefile.install.am much less confusing.
4f350d1 : Removed Makefile.core.am with some judicious refactoring. Also fix a stupid typo in launcher-linux.c that was added in the last commit.
f6ded8c : Removed Makefile.core.am with some judicious refactoring.
cdf8a17 : Avoid unnecessary EXTRA_DIST files in Makefile.am.
b7fda4c : Merge r9110 (inline Makefile.tool-flags.am) from DARWIN branch.
311303f : Index: Makefile.core.am Factor out some includes. Remove some unnecessary includes.
9eb6652 : Fix a minor defect: only the first 14 chars of the 18 chars in the --massif-out-file= option was being checked, which meant that if you did --massif-out-filename=foo by mistake it would accept it and produce a file called "ame=foo".
a2e66b8 : Suppression update.
5d425e8 : Add support for glibc-2.10 (when it eventually appears).
c6d86a3 : Move an assertion (pertaining to showing initial segments to the tools) to the correct place, and add a big comment explaining why this is necessary.
8a22285 : Removed mandatory redirections for DRD since these made DRD impossible to use on openSUSE 10.3 ppc.
1e53e1e : Generalized suppression patterns.
7f42a3c : Do not only recognize .plt and .plt.got sections inside the mapped address range, but also outside the mapped address range (necessary for ppc).
15c67b4 : Suppress any error whose top frame is in libc.so. While not very elegant, this is an effective way to suppress data race reports triggered by glibc's stdio functions (which uses inlined locking functions).
f8aecf4 : VG_(findBoundsFM): add comment re preconditions
93600b1 : Generalise zlib suppressions a bit.
ad03949 : * get_Seg_containing_addr: fix incorrect test guarding assertion (which then failed)
b80d8e1 : Callgrind: Remove ifdef'ed-out, non-working code.
144b76c : Cachegrind/Callgrind: allow for cache sizes other than only powers of two
a65db10 : Initialise laog and laog__exposition even when the first lock-related action is a lock deletion. Fixes a segfault reported by Ali Jannesari.
fc24e7e : Remove function that was made redundant by r9059.
33c57f2 : Minor refinements:
7e98c03 : Intercept and replace calls to calls to strnlen in glibc, for the usual reasons. Also update an expected output (lines numbers in h_intercepts.c should be removed by the regtest system, really).
f22ab4a : Prior to this commit, exp-ptrcheck would assert if the DWARF3 data for global or stack blocks described overlapping blocks (which are nonsensical). Unfortunately it is naive to assume compilers will always produce correct debug info. This commit makes exp-ptrcheck much more robust against such (inevitable) anomalies: stack and global blocks which overlap are simply ignored.
3145230 : Handle a couple of artefacts produced by icc11: DW_TAG_reference_type that doesn't have a size, and DW_FORM_ref_addr (assuming my interpretation of the standard is correct.)
13596ff : Handle a couple of artefacts generated by gcc-4.4: DW_OP_reg{0..31} and DW_OP_const1s.
41d5dea : Handle a few more syscalls, as per #179618. MERGE TO 3_4_BRANCH.
2306332 : Handle redundant REX.W on PUNPCKHgg. Fixes test case dated 2009-01-22 of #173751.
6ece231 : Accept 'enum' type DIEs that do not have any names; apparently Dwarf2 allows this. Patch from Nuno Lopes. #181707. MERGE TO 3_4_BRANCH
f1efbd4 : Make the leak checker a bit less verbose.
711e6ad : Fix aix5 build breakage following r9021.
24c3a1f : Don't try to build m_ume on aix5.
d68d3cf : VG_(apply_StackTrace): following r8818, we should regard an entry of -1 as denoting the logical end of the stack. This change stops printing of a lot of junk below the logical "-1" end mark. See added comments for details.
ec3f2ce : ML_(evaluate_trivial_GX): handle the case
055b0f8 : Handle the case where a Compilation Unit (CU) (or, really, the CU and its associated DIEs) occupies less space than stated in the CU's header. icc9 appears to produce CUs with this anomaly. Not handling the case causes the reader to lose sync at the start of the following CU, since it hasn't skipped the junk bytes at the end of the current CU, and it is basically hosed after that. MERGE TO 3_4_BRANCH (?)
f9d09bf : Merge from DARWIN branch recent minor .vgtest changes.
49db39e : Fix up selection of Helgrind tests (merged r9040 from DARWIN branch).
163c487 : Move memcheck/tests/brk to the linux/ subdir, as it's Linux-specific (merged from the DARWIN branch). Also filter the output more so the .stderr.exp2 isn't needed.
d3e4dd9 : Merge some minor regtest updates from the DARWIN branch: - avoid using <malloc.h> where it's not necessary, because on DARWIN it's called <malloc/malloc.h> - filter the output of brk2 more, which allows the .stderr.exp2 file to be removed.
c876a2f : Move the test for __sync_bool_compare_and_swap almost to the bottom, so it can use $mflag_primary. This makes the word size for which the test is done (-m32 or -m64) be the same as for which it is actually needed, and in some situations unbreaks building of the regtests in 32-bit mode on a 64-bit machine.
7fd6d38 : Rename all the arch/OS/platform-related variables in configure.in to make it clearer what they mean: - They all have VGCONF_ prefixes now, to indicate they come out of configure.in (and are clearly distinguished from the VGA_/VGO_/VGP_ #defines passed in to C files). - The ones that refer to the primary *or* secondary platform have _INCLUDES_ in them. - The ones that are in all-caps have a _CAPS suffix.
5706ca9 : Minor tidyings:
141383e : Suppress any error at all that occurs in libpthread, without any regard for any calling frames. Needed to hide the fact that we can't see stdio locking stuff and hence end up reporting a lot of errors in multithreaded stdio working. MERGE TO 3_4_BRANCH.
3a4b63b : More aggressive suppression of error reports from ld.so. MERGE TO 3_4_BRANCH.
ceccb29 : Handle both %gs and %fs prefixes on amd64 a bit more "properly".
2085f4a : Don't worry about an unmapped, zero sized, bss segment. Bug #181594.
2cbb6ee : Accept zero size text segments. Bug #181594.
160d5a8 : Handle the rodata and sbss sections and cope with variables that are in those sections.
bfd892f : Bias values should be PtrdiffT now.
3553c67 : Removed unused round_Addr_upwards function.
588658b : Don't assume that all global variables are in the data section - we now cope with variables in the text, data, sdata and bss sections.
65e6d92 : Improve detection of where ELF sections have been mapped by taking the ELF segment table into account when deciding on the mapping between SVMA and AVMA for a section.
8aa41de : Some minor format string fixes for gcc-3.3.3 (SuSE 9.1). Not sure why later gccs don't complain about these.
74a74d8 : Don't hardwire @FLAG_M32@ in here, since this directory isn't arch specific (and so the build fails eg on a 64 bit machine that does not have a 32-bit toolchain installed). Use $(AM_FLAG_M3264_PRI) instead.
a6dbb3f : - No longer using VG_ARCH_ALL to determine the DIST_SUBDIRS used for arch/OS/platform-specific tool test dirs, instead writing it by hand. This is important because up until now if we had any arch-specific test dirs, we needed such dirs for all archs. Now that we also have OS-specific and platform-specific test dirs, we don't want to have (mostly) empty dirs for every arch/OS/platform.
3ec9d9a : Merge part of r8943 from the Darwin branch -- use VGA_* instead of VGP_* for selecting the arch-specific tests.
9890ee1 : In AC_TRY_COMPILE, only include the function body, not the surrounding "int main { ... }".
63c7de1 : Replace some 4-space indents with 3-space indents. Merged from DARWIN.
747f8b0 : This should have been part of r9004.
91772d1 : - Split up m_ume.c into m_ume/{main,elf,script}.c. This will make merging the DARWIN branch easier later. - Remove the disabled vgtest_ume test, it's very unlikely it'll ever work again. - Move VG_(find_auxv) to initimg-linux.c, the only place it's used, and make it static.
a7d4ca3 : A couple more changes to fix the conditional building of DRD tests.
a2aa68e : Added yet another output variant.
5639ce1 : Added yet another output variant.
8cdc628 : Elaborated prereq clauses.
5a8c67f : Made compilation of multiple tests conditional.

3826d58 : Only call pthread_rwlock_timedwrlock() or pthread_rwlock_timedrdlock() if supported.
6d45e92 : Added configure tests for optional POSIX threads functionality.
cfc000e : Generate default.supp at compile-time, not configure-time.
d74b0ef : The load addresses depend on the platform, not the architecture.
b4d48a5 : VG_ARCH doesn't exist any more, use VG_ARCH_PRI in valgrind.pc.in.

bc00bb7 : Merged r8966 (show scanning output during leak checking with -v) from DARWIN branch.
070d1a2 : Make sure that sigalrm.c compiles correctly on systems that do not have the header file <asm/unistd.h>.
1f2b143 : Added configure test for the header file <asm/unistd.h>.
ed20050 : Obtain current time through time() instead of through clock_gettime(CLOCK_REALTIME), such that this test compiles on systems that do not support CLOCK_REALTIME.
b59edf1 : Remove an unnecessary #include that breaks the test on Darwin, and update the expected output line numbers accordingly. MERGED FROM DARWIN BRANCH.
c4431bf : Introduce a new type, PtrdiffT. Replace lots of uses of OffT (all those that are memory offsets) with PtrdiffT; OffT should only be used for file sizes and offsets.
a81465a : The SG_GET_TIMEOUT ioctl doesn't write to memory - it returns the timeout via it's return value.
5816a39 : The SG_GET_VERSION_NUM ioctl writes to memory rather than reading it.
4e8224b : Compress the file passed as the third argument before attaching it to the outgoing e-mail.
7f8cd30 : Added an additional expected output file.
28aa0ce : Runs now fine on systems for which PTHREAD_STACK_MIN > 32768.
1581e74 : Do not only intercept SIGILL during detection of the supported instruction set on ppc but also SIGFPE. This patch should make instruction set detection work on the PowerPC 440EPx. Fixes bug #176926.
a00febc : SSE3 and SSSE3 are two different things, so add a proper SSSE3 feature test and use that to guard the SSSE3 tests.
70dbf4e : Changed single recipient into a list of recipients and fixed mutt subject and attachment arguments.
0bae227 : Added to repository.
3040125 : Made sure that all diff files are processed.
9e46dbe : Updated machine details.
fd97cec : Added new nightly build configuration variable: ABT_EVAL.
2261edb : Renamed georgia-tech-cellbuzz.* to georgia-tech-cellbuzz-cross.*.
4d598eb : Fixed typo (a space was lost by copying text between shell sessions).
fcb1cd6 : The blockfault regression test now passes on 64 bit systems too.
6c67ef5 : Add signalfd4 support.
79557c8 : Sort file names alphabetically before processing the diff files.
d8eb77d : Made DRD regression pass when the glibc-debuginfo package is installed.
0311189 : trunk/nightly/bin/nightly Use '.' instead of 'source', because that's how /bin/sh does it. This should make the script more reliable on systems that don't have bash as the /bin/sh, eg. Ubuntu and Debian.
cc874b5 : trunk/memcheck/tests/Makefile.am trunk/memcheck/tests/vcpu_bz2.c trunk/memcheck/tests/vcpu_bz2.vgtest vcpu_bz2.c was (I think) an "svn copy" of perf/bz2.c. Because it's a copy, the two can get out of sync, which was a problem with Greg Parker's Darwin patch. So we remove vcpu_bz2.c, and make vcpu_bz2.vgtest invoke perf/bz2 directly.
23e8a29 : Handle __NR_socketpair in Ptrcheck.
1f2df3e : trunk/nightly/bin/nightly Be POSIXy.
df8a111 : Index: nightly/bin/nightly - Check that it is passed two arguments, abort if not (avoids some possibly confusing behaviour). - Remove various uses of $ABT_TOP in paths; it's not necessary because the first thing the script does is 'cd' to $ABT_TOP. Furthemore, some paths lacked the $ABT_TOP which was confusing. - Gather up all the diffs from the tests, grab the first 100 lines (or less, if shorter) of each, and concatenate into a file, the name of which is passed to the <tag>.sendmail script so it can be attached.
62647eb : trunk/nightly/bin/nightly Use '=' instead of '==', which is a bash-ism that doesn't work on Debian/Ubuntu systems that have dash installed as /bin/sh. It only mildly affected the script's running -- it made it say that certain stages failed when really they didn't.
5a1ba02 : Comment-only changes.
4f6f54b : callgrind/tests/filter_stderr cachegrind/tests/filter_stderr Filter out an additional warning, so the tests pass on machines with a 6MB L2 cache.
bfc79f8 : Add an FAQ about attaching Valgrind to already-running programs.
8d37f36 : Bump version number on the trunk.
332ffec : Add some more system calls to ptrcheck.
b8b1664 : Late entrant for 3.4.0 (sigh)
430b688 : --> 3.4.0 (first attempt)
94a9b24 : Suppress all races whose top frame is in libc.so. This is a not very clever interim solution to the problem of Helgrind reporting lots of false races in glibc's stdio functions, due to it not seeing the relevant (inlined, alas) locking that glibc uses.
4899c87 : Updated ignore list.
4ac853b : Polished manual.
1e76ff5 : Add some more Intel cache configuration values needed for Atom processors. These come from sandpile.org as the current version of Intel's Application Note 485 doesn't have them yet.
415a7b1 : Remove spurious newlines from messages.
70c5e5a : Add some more Intel L2 and L3 cache configuration values.
1dd7eb0 : Updated to do list.
4f75be3 : Suppress any race that occurs in ld.so (just a single frame will do). his gets rid of a bunch of more specific suppressions.
a99ab01 : Additional suppression patterns for glib.
8e1033f : Moved two define's, such that the ABIWARNING appears immediately before the enum declaration it applies to.
dc35ec0 : Made sure that the file bar_trivial.stdout.exp gets included in the distribution tarball.
974aace : Second attempt at 3.4.0 RC1.
e5a3a36 : Added a pthread suppression pattern and generalized a glib suppression pattern.
c8914e9 : Renamed a variable and removed two statements that were commented out.
df1fc9a : Finalise 3.4.0 RC1.
8244481 : Un-break 'make dist'.
10deba4 : ML_(addDiCfSI)(): truncate DiCfSI's that fall partially but not entirely inside the r-x mapped area, so that they fall entirely within the mapped area. This is necessary in order to avoid assertion failures later in check_CFSI_related_invariants().
f1fa5ed : Update bug lists.
adcb5bb : Bump the version stuff.
af0e3ff : Update.
8758f54 : Disable the building of exp-omega, but don't rm it from the repo, nor from the tarball.
565fcf1 : Update for 3.4.0 (imcomplete).
1a620d5 : Minor futzing with the documentation.
4b03c42 : Add a couple more suppressions.
2d7cdb2 : Add an expected-output set for Ubuntu 8.04 (and 8.10) on amd64.
59347ff : Comment out unused code so as to get a warning free build.
19f4236 : Unbreak the build on aix5.
5210413 : Ignore races that occur on data in .plt sections, as well as those that occur on data in .got.plt sections.
f721815 : Rationalise standard suppressions: get rid of vast amounts of near-duplication on the suppressions concerning combinations of libc, ld and libpthread.
484fe80 : During instrumentation, handle Imbe_SnoopedStore{Begin,End} a bit more convincingly.
9ba91f4 : Update expected outputs.
e8cdb36 : Updated after merge of Helgrind from YARD branch to trunk.
af57d5b : Minor updates for 3.4.0. Also fix a large number of missing <para> and </para> tags.
c6a1cd1 : Finish off updates to the Helgrind manual.
5246990 : More documentation updates. Urr. I knew there was a reason I'd been putting this off.
7c76839 : Partial update of the Helgrind documentation (incomplete).
e30177e : Added prereq clause.
51db72d : circular_buffer test now passes on systems with and without built-in support for atomic operations.
237f5e9 : Added a suppression pattern for the data races triggered by the glibc function fflush().
94866cc : Fixed bug in vector clock updating for semaphores with non-zero initial value.
03225a8 : Added command-line option -n, which allows to disable locking.
d94169a : Replaced regular increment by atomic increment.
d22e8b2 : Made config.h include path consistent with the other regression tests.
d5a131f : Fixed typo: added missing right parentheses.
ba1686b : Finished renaming of boost_threads into boost_thread.
a45b572 : Generalized the glibc _IO_file_xsputn suppression pattern. Added a suppression pattern for Boost.
04eb109 : Move description of --read-var-info= from the "debugging options" section to the "uncommon user options" section.
c164bd2 : Following r8845, explicitly enable Dwarf3 variable/type info reading on tests whose output depends on it.
849b0ed : Various changes:
13ca8a6 : Rearrange suppressions a bit, and add a couple more from David Faure.
844a655 : Update expected outputs for glibc25-amd64.
d2dc14a : genoffsets.c: don't use __builtin_offset since older gcc's don't know about it. Also add some comments.
575e48f : Update the expected outputs following changes in Helgrind over the past few weeks.
234780c : Callgrind: add code pattern for runtime_resolve on OpenSuse11.0/x86
b88201e : Don't apply cross-compilation patch during the nightly build any more, as it's no longer necessary.
c7f1b00 : Move the functionality from filter_threadnums into filter_stderr, so that it applies to all tests. Then remove all references to filter_threadnums.
9212454 : HG_(instrument): don't assert on Imbe_SnoopedStore{Begin,End}.
ba69ffb : Change the way pub/libvex_guest_offsets.h is created, so that it is correct for a cross-compiled build.
6fd7d74 : Added another regression test.
3e017fa : Fixed semaphore vector clock updating / simplified semaphore tracing.
c57312c : Fixed grammar / split a paragraph in two.
9ba958b : Added a suppression pattern.
76ca62c : Added a paragraph about the Boost.Thread library.
8639f11 : Create rough entries for the 3.4.0 changes.
3301cd1 : Include new file (why-no-libc.txt) in the distro tarball.
afb42b7 : Fixed regression test tc20_verifywrap2, which was broken through r8829.
62b4c57 : Fix some format string mismatch warnings, associated with r8825.
17b4743 : Add another magic constant to the Iex_Const case in isBogusAtom, as seen in glibc on ppc32.
13581c9 : Add some useful info.
16dfea4 : Add support ioprio_get and wire up ioprio_set on all platforms. Fixes bug #177819.
da9436b : Added more semaphore tracing info.
bb97c5e : Update an FAQ to account for --track-origins=yes.
6fb87f2 : Include vg-in-place in the distro tarball.
e6cab85 : Update.
7bdd1bc : Handle some redundant REX.W prefixes on code from IPP (Intel Performance Primitives). This fixes #173751, at least for the test cases so far provided.
493c4ef : Make sure $mflag_primary is used in the tests for Boost and QtCore features. Also add a big comment explaining why this is important.
1669cc7 : Avoid causing an assertion failure in VG_(make_ExeContext_from_StackTrace) in the case where VG_(clo_backtrace_size) < N_FRAMES (that is, with --num-callers=N where N < N_FRAMES).
357cb16 : Add a couple of suppressions relating to unwinding the stack following pthread_exit.
b1ae15d : This commit subtly changes the meaning of the values obtained via the stack unwind mechanism (the function VG_(record_ExeContext) et al), clears up some associated kludges, and makes suppression matching work more reliably.
a284eb7 : Fix format string warning in PRE(sys_eventfd2).
d7a02db : Add a new module, m_seqmatch, which does very simple sequence (regexp) matching, in the function VG_(generic_match). Patterns to be matched against may contain only '*'-style wildcards (matches any number of elements, we don't care what they are), '?' wildcards (matches exactly one element, we don't care what it is) and literal elements.
84eb41f : Add support for eventfd2 (and wire up pipe2 on PPC platforms).
bd43a86 : Added suppression pattern for random_r(), which is a.o. called by rand().
8a36076 : Fix bug introduced by frame-level wildcarding changes for suppressions in r8725. (Konstantin Serebryany)
1ba0e9b : Don't segfault the guest during a call MPI_Init(NULL,NULL), since those are valid parameters to MPI_Init.
a781be6 : event_map_lookup: when looking for a previous access to an address, find conflicting accesses that overlap the current access in any way, rather than just match at the addresses. This allows reporting of conflicts between accesses which overlap but are not the same size/alignment.
8f5374e : Tidy up and comment sanity-checking code/configuration.
c5ea996 : * In the conflicting-event mechanism, also record the size and read-or-writeness of each access, so that these can be displayed in error messages.
f35dbb8 : * Add a VG_(sizeSWA) function
bc307e5 : Use the new SparseWA data type, rather than WordFM, to implement the (primary) mapping of the conflicting-access mechanism. This speeds up Helgrind by 0% to 30% depending on the workload.
78b7ecf : Add a new container data type, a Sparse Word Array: an array of UWord which is also indexed by UWord. This can be used as a replacement for WordFM with unboxed keys, when the key ranges are dense. It is implemented as a 256-way radix tree (4-deep on 32-bit platforms, 8-deep on 64-bit platforms).
c0b2039 : Followup to vx1875: use .guest_amd64_assume_fs_is_zero == True on amd64-linux.
2e28ac4 : Add to the VexAbiInfo structure, two new fields: guest_amd64_assume_fs_is_zero guest_amd64_assume_gs_is_0x60
f093c8c : Assert that the guest state size is a multiple of 16, not 8.
d660d41 : Initial VEX-end support for Darwin (x86 and amd64).
d86e3a2 : Change the memory allocation strategy used by the conflicting-access machinery, so as to allocate fewer chunks of memory. This increases the speed of Helgrind by about 10% on some apps, which probably means the conflicting-access machinery itself is about 20% faster.
c98279e : Simplified test program.
4281619 : update bug status
2d5d529 : Reran SPLASH2 benchmark and updated results.
a656f3d : ignore .valgrindrc files that are world writeable or not owned by the current user (CVE-2008-4865)
a5bf231 : Updated notes section.
23d4469 : Helgrind's event-map garbage collector hammers VG_(OSetGen_Next). Import an optimisation from the analogous function in m_wordfm.c.
8fd92d3 : event_map_maybe_GC: use a flat array when computing the distribution (counts) of generation numbers in the oldrefTree, instead of using a WordFM as an associative array. This significantly accelerates the event map garbage collector.
3b0c4d7 : Re-set constraints in 'consistent' style after a race is detected, instead of the more aggressive setting, which appeared to cause a large number of extra race reports.
da1dd99 : add glibc 2.9 support to changelog
d2e31eb : glibc 2.9 support
de57c49 : Added prereq clause.
b0e009d : Don't put raced-on locations in an (E)rror state; instead leave them in a (C)onstraint state. The former approach can cause races to be missed. Also, update state machine slightly following re-analysis thereof.
b80f0c9 : Fix comment typo.
1c466b7 : Add informal correctness argument for the logic in evh__HG_PTHREAD_BARRIER_WAIT_PRE, as it is somewhat subtle.
0f7a029 : Add some suppressions for Qt4-related code.
38e0cf9 : * Update Qt4 interceptors and add, as comments, findings of analysis of Qt4 threading functions.
9b1f0fd : event_map_maybe_GC: handle corner case that was previously simply asserted on: if all the entries in the event map are in the same generation, then we have no LRU information at all with which to decide which entries to discard. So in this case throw away half of them randomly -- there's nothing better we can do.
b3fc062 : A couple of 'make dist' fixes.
b7ba04f : Handle "movsd G,E" for G and E both regs. This is the non-binutils encoding. Fixes #175150.
00408ca : More DRD suppression pattern simplifications.

b9a313e : Added yet another DRD suppression pattern.
c95c210 : Expand filename for coredumps correctly. Fixes #174908. Also take the opportunity to remove some sprintf-ing into a fixed-sized buffer.
5eed741 : Add a comment re VG_(expand_file_name).
f8722ca : Don't let GDB_PATH be "" if no GDB is found at configure time, as this causes any attempts to attach a gdb to the process to fail in a confusing way.

94d7059 : Make test 'tc21_pthonce' less scheduling-sensitive.

9f569b7 : Add initial support for POSIX barriers (pthread_barrier_{init,wait,destroy}).

42f17ea : Handle EvM GC messaging properly.
1cbc12f : Make sure laog__handle_one_lock_deletion actually gets called as a result of the client doing pthread_mutex_destroy() or pthread_rwlock_destroy().
676fe78 : Adjust sed scripts used to generate the linker scripts on Linux, so as to delete everything after the trailing ======. This apparently makes the system buildable with icc 9.1. (patch from Philip Blakely). Fixes #173099.
a1bf24f : Use a couple of reader-writer-lock tests from drd.

ab19515 : More updates to expected outputs. This currently gives Helgrind zero failures on opensuse 10.2 on amd64 (glibc 2.5, gcc-4.1.3).
7e18ab1 : Update expected output.
3fcd85f : Move the conflicting accesses in each thread earlier, so that pure h-b is not fooled by the locking on non-conflicted parts of the arrays. (Not really sure what's going on here, but DRD and Helgrind behave identically, so I'm not too concerned.)
d024ae5 : Update baseline expected outputs, now that Helgrind uses a different algorithm than in 3.3.x.
d52392d : A bit of tidying up:
641a13c : Update.
7d8f137 : Support "repe scas" on amd64. Fixes #168943.
5a5eec0 : When trying to establish whether or not debuginfo should be read from a file, first the mapping permissions _before_ peering at the file's header, rather than afterwards. This changes the logic to behave more like it does in 3.3.x. Fixes #164669, although really it is all still rather fragile. The bug report, http://bugs.kde.org/show_bug.cgi?id=164669, contains a detailed explanation.
3fc4c8a : Update expected output, with a line number that's actually correct.
1c5845d : Add a second expected output. It appears that a recent glibcs print one (or a value near it) as "+1.0000e+00" instead of "+1.0000e-00". Or it could be a rounding issue .. I dunno.
f5049f7 : Attempt to reduce output variance by ensuring mainSort() is never inlined.
9ec6af6 : Use a "sided" comparison rather than a "point" comparison, so as to ensure that gcc generates only one conditional jump per conditional expression, not two.
131defc : Update expected output now that Memcheck's realloc implementation always moves the block, even when the new block is smaller or the same size.
8fff3ec : Sigh: /bin/sh on Ubuntu is not bash, it is dash (what a nuisance) and it doesn't do the "[ ]" thing itself; instead it hands it off to /usr/bin/[. And that doesn't understand "==" on strings; it wants "=" instead.

4815eb5 : On ppc32/64 we don't have a reliable way to detect function entries and exits at the moment. So disable stack array bounds checking for ppc32/64 platforms. Also (unnecessarily) disables global array bounds checking on those platforms.
b103a55 : Futz with debug printing.
20864ff : Change the default PIE load address from 0x100000 (1MB) to 0x108000, to keep ppc32-linux happy.
50fde23 : Dwarf3 variable & type reader: use 64-bit numbers throughout to represent the sizes of types, even on 32-bit hosts, where a type with a size >= 2^32 is, well, if not meaningless, then at least impossible to instantiate. This is of course motivated by reality .. on ppc32 SUSE11.0, the debuginfo for glibc-2.8 appears to contain a declaration amounting to

9e1bed8 : Re-enable preening of global invariants. (This happens when a .so is unmapped, and that .so contains global variables that were accessed while it was mapped in.)
4b8ce60 : Set average translation size plausibly, so as to avoid excessive retranslations caused by the default size.

c9d682f : Updated Subversion ignore list.
19eff0a : Updated Subversion ignore list.
7402dc5 : Updated Subversion ignore list.
b09132d : Added double quotes around a shell function argument.
644ffec : Updated Subversion ignore list.
3b9f50c : Updated Subversion ignore list.
f26303a : Updated Subversion ignore list.
8144ff4 : Disabled printing of file descriptor value in order to make the test results more reproducible.
744f9ea : Enabled capget and capset system calls for amd64, ppc32 and ppc64.
d1a1061 : Added regression test for Linux' capget system call.
e025eca : Fix regression on none/tests/faultstatus caused by r8522.
59a2d18 : Rework storage management in the Dwarf3 type and variable reader, to try and reduce its space consumption. This change changes some long linked lists into XArrays instead.
7db115a : Try and bit a bit more space-economical, by increasing the average loading factor from 0.75 to 0.83, and by being more careful in VG_(cloneXA).
6a3a284 : Make the absolute bare minimum changes needed to stop the Dwarf3 variable & type reader dying on gcc-4.3.x produced Dwarf3. This is done by handling DW_TAG_class_type and treating it the same as DW_TAG_structure_type. I don't know if this is really correct or not.
a203330 : Add a description of the FP offset/size to type VexGuestLayout.
4d758f3 : Fix RPM/spec build. (Daniel J Blueman)
bee43c1 : Make VG_(addToXA) and VG_(addBytesToXA) 64-bit clean.
896f6f9 : Move the WordFM (AVL trees of UWord-pairs) implementation from helgrind/ into the core. It's just too darn useful to not be in the core. There is some overlap in functionality between OSet and WordFM, but OSet is more space efficient in some circumstances, whereas WordFM is easier to use and a bit more flexible in some cases.
4231a85 : Tidy up VG_(stat) usage in VG_(check_executable). Followup to r8522.
ec61b65 : Presently, Valgrind (non-client) code that wants to use the stat family of syscalls is impossible to write in a way that's portable and correct. On some targets (eg x86-linux) you need to do sys_stat64 and receive the results in a 'struct vki_stat64'. But on other targets (eg amd64-linux) neither sys_stat64 nor 'struct vki_stat64' exist.
2b8db3e : C89 fixes (stop gcc complaining).
4190600 : The address space manager, and in particular the NSegment type, hardwire the assumption that an inode number is a UWord, that is, a host word. There's no reason for that assumption to be valid; an inode number could be a 64-bit int even on a 32 bit platform (eg w.r.t sys_stat64). This commit changes inode numbers and, for good measure, dev numbers, to be 64-bit regardless.
dead90a : Handle new IR ops Iop_RoundF64toF64_*.
0f1ef86 : Handle frin, frim, frip, friz, in 64-bit mode only, for now.
edc9547 : Tidy up the wrappers for pread64 and pwrite64, and make these two syscalls available on ppc64-linux.
fe397a2 : Ignore .EH bit in lwarx / ldarx as it appears to be merely a hint.
f0d6595 : Added yet another Qt4 suppression pattern.
4f6aa5c : Ensured that the qt4 regression tests compile with the pkg-config flags on all platforms.
21d3cfc : Qt4 detection test is now based on pkg-config. Qt4 QMutex::tryLock(int) test now uses proper Qt4 compiler flags.
c07349e : Add support needed for exp-ptrcheck on ppc32/64.
623eec3 : Un-break configure test for clock_gettime().
31277bf : Removed duplicate volatile keyword such that the compiler does no longer print a warning.
d029e46 : Switched from ANSI C stdio to Unix I/O in order to avoid that the I/O statements trigger any locking.
09df48f : Compiles now with old versions of <sys/epoll.h> too.
1d07a38 : Updated Makefile.am.
a1e7d7c : Removed duplicate expected output file.
eb33915 : Added suppression pattern for Qt4.0/4.1.
ce5f249 : Added expected output for comiler versions without support for built-in atomic operations.
7950111 : Handle Iop_ReinterpF32asI32, as needed for exp-ptrcheck.
228c7c8 : Minor printing changes.
b3238a5 : Add a followup comment to the changes in r8454, which made memcheck's client realloc function use an always-move strategy.
e2624a9 : Attempted to make DRD documentation compatible with pdfxmltex. Added note about g_thread_init().
2a33acd : Sorted noinst_HEADERS filenames alphabetically.
da7c098 : Reverted commit 8448.
62f54e4 : Added configure test for QMutex::tryLock(int).
0c47751 : Fixed race condition.
059b370 : Include inlined C files in tarball, else it's not buildable.
8d2cd45 : Temporarily comment out a couple of XML fragments which cause the .pdf generation (make print-docs), and hence make dist, to fail for completely non-obvious reasons, even though xsltproc (make html-docs) does not complain about them.
8849a56 : Change memcheck's (client) realloc implementation so that it copies and moves the block even when the new size is smaller or the same. This increases the chance that it can detect buggy code which assumes that realloc-smaller doesn't cause the block to move.
5e5fff9 : * handle sys_getprocs64 on ppc32-aix5
afa617b : Origin-tracking fix: make sure that we have a shadow-origin (B) temporary defined for every (original) temp used in the block's IR preamble, as is already done of the shadow-definedness (V) temporaries. Otherwise we can end up generating references to B temporaries that have no assigned value, which causes the IR sanity checker to complain. Only observed (and even then rarely) on the complex preambles sometimes used for TOC-afflicted platforms.
6f362a6 : Temporarily disable Qt4-related tests, as they don't build on systems with qt-4.2.1 at least. It appears the type of QMutex::tryLock has changed somewhere after qt-4.2.1.
414f358 : Always include the X client library suppressions, and don't bother doing any testing for X (which was always pretty bogus anyway).
498185b : Remove initial settings of CXXFLAGS/CPPFLAGS, as they cause -I/usr/include/qt4 to be given to compilation of the entire system.
505a819 : Fix a silly mistake resulting in a bunch of global variables being defined in all the object files in Memcheck.
a8ffda6 : Format string fixes for ppc{32,64}-aix5.
d696210 : Stop mpxlc complaining about GNU-isms when compiling libmpiwrap.c.
f33b433 : * Make sure we're using GNU sed; install can otherwise fail
026debf : When the leak checker finds overlapping blocks report the details before asserting.
2a836b5 : When warning about permissions being changed on a large chunk of memory report the actual addresses involved not just the size.
95bfdcc : Added -m32 flag, such that the SPLASH-2 benchmarks are compiled in 32-bit mode (these benchmarks were not designed to be compiled in 64-bit mode -- radiosity deadlocks when compiled in 64-bit mode). Suppressed harmless data races in the radiosity benchmark.
c8d376d : Enabled Radiosity benchmark.
1c6623c : Raytrace benchmark now runs as it should.
0feed2e : Restored proper compiler flag order.
83d0149 : Cleanup.
37630e5 : Removed data that is no longer needed. Added a reference.

15071eb : Minimum time measurement error is now really changed from 0.00 to 0.01.
bd6722b : Documented meaning of input parameters.

a9c5508 : Modified code such that concurrent pthread_cond_wait() and pthread_destroy() calls do no longer trigger an assertion failure in DRD.
8f0b0d7 : Continued working on the DRD documentation.
9905c2e : Bug fix: only complain about recursive locking before pthread_cond_wait() is called if the calling thread holds the lock.
08e6d6a : An error message is now printed if the mutex pointer passed to pthread_cond_wait() does not point to a mutex object, and also if the mutex pointer passed to pthread_cond_wait() points to a recursive mutex that has been locked recursively.

6b0e2dd : Added comment.
3bb1cec : An error message is now printed if two different threads call pthread_cond_*wait() on the same condition variable but with a different mutex argument. Added regression test pth_inconsistent_cond_wait.
d9e39ec : Semaphore and barrier reinitialization are now reported.
886b87c : DRD now prints where a mutex appeared for the first time in addition to the mutex address when an error message is printed for condition variables.
46b5fce : Some time ago reporting sending POSIX signals where the mutex associated with the signal via pthread_cond_wait()/pthread_cond_timedwait() was disabled. Reenabled this report, made it configurable, and added a regression test for the new command line option.
68a8a20 : Delayed thread termination such that the "other segment" information is included in the data race reports.

68bac81 : Continued working on the DRD documentation.
07a5163 : Fixed filter.
edbf716 : Added extra filtering for the stderr output of malloc_free_fill such that the output of this test becomes independent of the Linux distribution the test is run on. Should fix #162819.
7b35d21 : Let the compiler print a comprehensible error message if it does not provide built-in functions for atomic memory access.
cd529dc : Added configure test for the gcc/icc built-in functions for atomic memory access (__sync_bool_compare_and_swap() a.o.).
5df2609 : Added ppc implementation of atomic compare and swap.
f3b7285 : Use same flags for OpenMP regression tests as for the other regression tests.
85d2253 : Minor change of the help text.
e55883d : Reworked test such that file locking is now triggered from two different processes.
f578a69 : Handle apparently-bogus DW_TAG_compilation_unit DIE that shows up in gcc-4.3 output. My reading of the DWARF3 standard is that a DW_TAG_compilation_unit should have either DW_AT_ranges or a (DW_AT_low_pc, DW_AT_high_pc) pair, but not both. So I think this is a gcc bug.
a42d444 : Suppress false positives in Memcheck caused by very clever coding in zlib.
a4a86e3 : Added missing mode_t argument to open() system call.
654013c : Changed the unusual "%s", "" back to "".
d9c0fac : Fixed mismatches between format string and argument list. Output should be binary identical to the output before this patch.
4d62674 : Result of timerfd() syscall is no longer printed to stdout, which should make this regression test more reproducible.
9d865fa : Pass the flag -Wno-format-zero-length to gcc (if supported by gcc) while compiling tools. This flag only affects those tools for which -Wformat is enabled (at this time only exp-drd).

The input file for these tests is now generated and now contains the proper number of threads. - Some SPLASH2 benchmarks accept the syntax -p${p} but not -p ${p}, and some accept -p ${p} but not -p${p}. - Commented out RAYTRACE benchmark because it seems to hang with p > 1.

4f192dc : Updated after level-2 bitmap size change.
8b4b2ee : - Reduced level two bitmap size from 2**16 to 2**14 addresses. This improves the performance of exp-drd (with default settings) for some tests. - Some consistency checks were commented out via #if 0 / #endif because of performance reasons. 3281150 : Added Cholesky and FFT.
c4a174f : Made script more robusts. Ratio is now always computed relative to the non-Valgrind single-CPU run.
ca9f2ad : Modified TLS-test slightly: the program checking for TLS support is now compiled, linked and run when compiling natively and compiled and linked only when cross-compiling. Before it was compiled and linked only, both for native and cross-compilation.
60ba3aa : Try to make these tests more reliable for different machines.
2ebe411 : Changed _Spec::mandatory from HChar* into const HChar*. If no symbol information is found in ld.so during startup of the exp-drd tool, let Valgrind abort and print an informative error message.
afe8226 : Added intercepts for strlen() and strnlen().
d5c6352 : Fixed typo.
0560549 : Update.
cb2d007 : - Replaced algorithm for suppressing false positives on symbol relocations: instead of not instrumenting code in .plt sections (which is x86 specific), suppress all data accesses to .plt and .got.plt sections (which works both on x86 and on PowerPC). - A warning is now printed upon startup to inform users about false positives which will be reported on PowerPC because with the current version of VEX it is impossible for tools to recognize atomic PowerPC instructions as such.
7342b1b : In some obscure circumstances, the allocator would incorrectly omit a spill store on the basis that the register being spilled had the same value as the spill slot being written to. This change is believed to make the equals-spill-slot optimisation correct. Fixes a bug first observed by Nuno Lopes and later by Marc-Oliver Straub.
a97a789 : Don't complain on .got.plt sections of size zero. Apparently such sections are generated by older toolchains (binutils 2.15.90.0.3 ?)
f06b427 : Updated scripts for running SPLASH-2.
ca9ff62 : update
7064fb2 : Fix a bug in Massif and Cachegrind, whereby if program's forked, the child wrote into the parent's output file even if %p was specified.
89230ca : Allow 64-byte line sizes (PA6T cpu).
c85bf02 : Allow 64-byte line sizes (PA6T cpu).
76dda8f : Make the size calculations inside VG_(mallinfo) 64-bit clean.
7a1eaca : More fiddling with the sys_signalfd wrapper.
9269147 : In the leak checker, don't assert when there are multiple identical blocks in the lc_shadows array. Such a situation could arise from incorrect use of VALGRIND_MALLOCLIKE_BLOCK, and has been observed to cause assertion failures for some runs of Wine on Valgrind.
510521e : Make sure the debug information is read before a tool is notified about an mmap() system call.
8785c12 : Added to repository.
9f9235a : Add initial glibc-2.8 support for Helgrind.
7524c3e : Refinements: added check for /usr/include/tiffio.h and added compiler flag -g3.
212d6c9 : Tidy up timerfd wrapper stuff a bit:
80d6e6d : Fix a couple of longstanding enum inconsistencies discovered by Florian Krohm's static checker.
74c8467 : Several reader-writer lock related fixes.
cf0c394 : Removed the superfluous casts that were introduced in r8132.
89ea7ab : Add a missing case and remove the bogus associated comment.
93ca0cb : Make the rlimit_nofile regression tests less system dependent.
fbce73d : Make the fdleak regression tests less system dependent.
58cac55 : sys_timerfd() and sys_signalfd() wrappers now interpret their first argument consistently as signed instead of unsigned. Fixes #162663.
906ef12 : Updated to do list.
d0d634d : Added support for the fadvise64() system call on ppc64.
7aa2b6d : Updated to do list.
c874142 : #define HAS_ALTIVEC is now fetched from config.h instead of from Makefile.am.
092b626 : - Added support for querying information about .plt sections. - Added support for .got.plt sections.
d5dea1d : Bug fixes (not in bugzilla): - Make sure that Valgrind does not complain when it tries to read the debug information of a file of size zero when such a file is mmap()'ed into memory. - Make sure the filename is included in the error message that is printed when reading the debug information fails for a file that is mmap()'ed into memory. - Fixed assertion failure that was triggered by supplying an output buffer to VG_(seginfo_sect_kind)() that is smaller than the filename to be copied into that buffer.
5fbe0af : Removed ppc debug print statements.
6bd721a : Removed superfluous #include directive.
cddeaf5 : Let the configure script recognize the AR variable, such that the name of the archiver can be specified at configure time. Changed test for TLS-support from AC_RUN_IFELSE to AC_LINK_IFELSE. Both changes are necessary to make cross-compilation possible.

1d4070d : Added hold_lock regression test.
c5c3a08 : Remove comments that became obsolete because of a previous commit.
d9d8bf0 : Filter out the time during which a lock has been held.
1412d68 : VG_(read_millisecond_timer)() is now monotonic, even if set_timeofday() is called or if ntpd adjusts the clock backwards. On Linux kernels where the clock_gettime() syscall is not supported, VG_(read_millisecond_timer)() falls back to the old behavior.

4de9776 : Modified test such that fewer iterations are run when the test is run as part of the automated regression tests.
2dbdbab : Added command-line options -s and -t such that the loop step and hence the run time of the test can be influenced.

068baa2 : Compute the starting address of the instruction correctly. This has always been wrong and can cause the next-instruction-address to be wrong in obscure circumstances. Fixes #152818.

5fa8780 : Make sure sp[0] and fp[0] are set in a rarely-taken path. Thanks to Bart for spotting this.

1fb1755 : Postponed call of vg_set_main_thread_state() from /lib/ld-*.so:_start() to the call of main(), the program entry point.
6ad00b7 : Added an assert statement to check the validity of the computed highest used stack address.
9d624d1 : Dynamically allocate the origin tracking cache as needed (only for runs with --track-origins=yes), rather than having it statically allocated. This is important because the cache is large (100MB) and soaking up 100MB of address space for a non-tracking run is not good. Unfortunately this slows down the origin tracker by 1 to 2 %.
7244e71 : Re-check complex and fragile bit-twiddling pertaining to indexing into the primary map on 64-bit systems. Add extensive comments and startup-time assertions.

7ce7166 : Move the error management code for Memcheck into a new file, mc_errors.c, as it is relatively self contained. This reduces the size of mc_main.c by about 1350 lines.

e3939e1 : Added a libdl.so suppression pattern. Removed the libX11 (XReply) suppression pattern.
f1ac71a : Changed the way how data races in NPTL's thread-private data on the top of the stack are ignored: instead of clearing the corresponding region in the bitmap of every thread when the stack pointer is increased, the appropriate bits in the suppression bitmap are set at thread creation time.

a2b6e1b : Added reference counting to segments. Synchronization objects (mutex, semaphore, barrier, rwlock) now keep a pointer to a segment instead of copying a vector clock for modeling causal relationships.

e3b57aa : Regtest/stability changes for drd (Bart Van Assche)
ae5137e : Allow a WordFM iterator to be initialised so as to exclude all key values below a given value. This allows efficiently iterating over small subsets of a mapping. Use this in Helgrind to avoid a performance bad case. Patch from Konstantin Serebryany.
174ca63 : Fix inconsistent order of fields. I think this is purely aesthetic since nothing depends on the actual layout of this struct, but anyway. Noticed by Vinay Nallamothu.
