da09859 : Move VG_(clo_backtrace_size) to a tool-visible header file.

eced459 : Rename drd_preloaded.c to drd_intercepts.c (Bart Van Assche)
0e9a0f5 : Very kludgey implementation of IRET. May or may not fix #155011.
7c1a19a : Mark the main thread as running while the initial memory declarations are made to the tool so that the tool can associate that memory with the main thread if it wishes.
9e86a12 : Stop drd trying to get a backtrace when there is no stack pointer.
5a835d5 : Add const qualifiers to appropriate arguments of OSet routines.
dc2f79e : Comment-only change.
c9d3383 : AIX5 counterpart to r7302: Improve handling of programs which require very large main thread stacks.
adacaf9 : Propagate the ucontext information with a received signal to the signal frame constructors and use it (on x86 and amd64) to fill in the trap number in the signal context information.
3059d27 : Add a new method VG_(record_depth_1_ExeContext), a trivial derivative of VG_(record_ExeContext), which just records the first stack frame but does not attempt to unwind the (guest) stack. This is useful in situations where we suspect unwinding the stack might cause a segfault.
7069886 : Add a couple of regtests for large stack frame management.
95d86c0 : Improve handling of programs which require very large main thread stacks. Instead of hardwiring the main thread stack to a max of 16MB and segfaulting the app beyond that point, allow the user to specify the main stack size using the new flag --main-stacksize=<number>.
d5c3f28 : Print a nice message if allocation of the stack fails, rather than just asserting.
5bdfbd2 : When allocating space for the client stack on Linux, take notice of the --max-stackframe value. This makes it possible to run programs with very large (primary) stack requirements simply by specifying --max-stackframe.
ae4485a : Fix stupid error spotted by by Konstantin Serebryany.

95e7900 : Don't do comparisons of (signed) Words by merely subtracting them, as this does not always produce correct results. Instead use a slower but correct method. Analogous fix to that applied to m_oset.c by r7283.
9bc8d9e : Don't do comparisons of (signed) Words by merely subtracting them, as this does not always produce correct results. Instead use a slower but correct method. Fixes #147545. (Nick Nethercote, Tom Hughes et al)

e0744f0 : Only pass valid ThreadIDs to VG_(record_ExeContext). (Bart Van Assche)
5b8ab5b : Update contact details.
eb0fa93 : New options for Memcheck, --malloc-fill=<hexnumber> and --fill-free=<hexnumber>, which cause malloc'd(etc) and free'd(etc) blocks to be filled with the specified value. This can apparently be useful for shaking out hard-to-track-down memory corruption. The definedness/addressability of said areas is not affected -- only the contents. Documentation to follow.
a8162b2 : Marginally enhance help message.
5abcc0b : Get rid of VG_NUMW_CLO, as it is pretty much identical to VG_NUM_CLO, and only used in one place.
fa4ca3b : Make the freed-block-queue volume metrics 64-bit throughout, to avoid any wierdness on very large machines in the future. Also, double the default size from 5MB to 10MB, on the basis that programs are now on average twice as lardy as they were when it was set to 5MB, whenever that was.
f707b10 : Include headers in tarball.
006f29f : Add a test case for semaphores with nonzero initial values.
11e352f : Correctly handle semaphores with nonzero initial values. Fixes bug observed by Matthieu Castet. Also, add another sanity-check flag.
721ad7b : Remove pthread_object_size.h and associated hardwired constants. (Bart Van Assche)
1c7e833 : So much for C's "type system" (ha ha). Correct version of r7250.
3c2f748 : Don't assert when destroying a locked rwlock.
fd4b6f4 : Changes to make Memcheck work sanely on recent incarnations of AIX 5.3:
6eab897 : Don't be confused by archive (.a) files which contain both a 32-bit and a 64-bit version of the same object (with the same name). Prior to this, it would sometimes attempt to read debug info from the wrong version of the object, complain that the magic number wasn't right, and so end up reading nothing at all for that object.

Spotted by Nick N whilst peering at code generated for new Massif. Preventative changes in amd64 back end (which doesn't appear to have the same problem).

b088b89 : Minor tweak to x-axis positioning of bars.
1a2741a : - Rewrote documentation. - Added a new time unit, instructions executed, and made it the default -- it's much more reproducible and consistent than milliseconds. Requires IRSB instrumentation and so slows down some programs (malloc-light ones such as bzip2) by about 20%, others by less. - ms_print now doesn't overwrite the x-axis in the graphs. - Added a test for --detailed-freq and --max-snapshots

778d783 : Update documents in preparation for 3.3.0, and restructure them somewhat to move less relevant material out of the way to some extent. The main changes are:

63e2bcd : Update bug status.
fc7773a : Don't load debug sections from the linked debug file if we have already loaded them from the main ELF file. Fixes #145609.
9d3f9d7 : Support sys_utimensat on x86-linux. (Dan McGee)
12373b1 : Followup to r7192: don't bork the compilation if GDB_PATH is not defined (in config.h)
e0036f7 : Handle sys_getitimer on ppc32-linux and ppc64-linux.
7839d11 : In the --help text, print the actual name of the GDB that will by default be used. Fixes #151938. Unfortunately this makes the help text non-constant, which could have a bad effect on regtesting; but GDB is so usually installed in the standard place /usr/bin/gdb that I don't think that's much of a big deal.
bb4396c : Support in{b,w,l} and out{b,w,l} on amd64. Fixes #152357.
1ff57e6 : Be more robust against malformed DWARF2 line number information: don't assert when a reference is made to a filename not in the filename table. Fixes #150380 and #129937.
f4c665f : Do Massif output file name properly. Default is massif.out.%p, where %p expands to the PID. Updated the tests. Still todo: handle %q for environment variables, and do the same for the core and Cachegrind/Callgrind.
7d9b3af : shut GCC up
6db7371 : update
0313b1e : Zero out the vki_user_regs_struct before using it. Otherwise, we end up passing uninitialised garbage on the stack to ptrace(SETREGS, ...) for any fields in the struct which are not filled in. This does not fix any known bugs, but seems like a good precautionary measure.
de0c806 : Update.
62c9aa7 : Add initial code to support debugger attaching on ppc64-linux (Ryan John). Works on 2.6.20. Does not work on 2.6.23 for unknown reasons.
7d7ddd2 : Minor tidyings to the debugger-attach code, as part of a failed attempt to fix debugger attach on ppc32-linux and ppc64-linux (see #151908). The fork/ptrace-based mechanism works fine for x86-linux and amd64-linux but not on ppc. I have no idea what is going on.
fc9bf72 : When doing ptrace on amd64-linux, provide values which don't fail the kernel's sanity checks for kernel >= 2.6.21. Fixes #145622.
d7a544b : Fix this: vex: priv/guest-amd64/toIR.c:3741 (dis_Grp5): Assertion `sz == 4' failed. (CALL Ev with sz==8) as reported in #150678 and #146252. Also change a bunch of assertions on undecoded instructions into proper decoding failures.
a1c0df3 : Initial glibc-2.7 suppressions for Helgrind. Also rearrange order of entries in file.
68c80c1 : Preliminary support for Fedora 8, which includes initial support for glibc-2.7.
b9354be : * more suppressions, for glibc-2.5 on ppc64 * generalise the 2.4.so and 2.5.so patterns just to be on the safe side
eafad3b : Try to fix, or at least avoid if possible, some arbitrary delays at thread creation time observed when running on POWER5 64-bit Linux.
6da5c5b : Add regtest for the --child-silent-after-fork added in r7177.
6e31f80 : Add a new flag, --child-silent-after-fork=no|yes [no]. When enabled, causes child processes after fork to fall completely silent, which can make the output a lot less confusing. In addition it is pretty much essential in XML output mode, so as to avoid mixing up any child XML output with the parent's.
ec6e27c : Don't pollute the XML output if the program terminates with a signal, and for a couple of other minor warnings.
c74b3ba : Make handling of setuid executables marginally more sensible, as suggested in #119404.
a273dc6 : Makefile.tool-inplace.am: correctly handle tool names with dashes in, using same changes to magic sed scripts as were recently applied to Makefile.install.am.
3387889 : Spelling fixes and misc tidying for the manual. (Brian Gough)
d7dda40 : Update.
0edccdd : Stack registration stuff: don't dereference NULL pointers (Eric Sharkey, #150044).
5abf0f1 : Don't segfault on syscall (SYS_io_destroy, 0). (Jakub Jelinek) Fixes #147325.
497c69e : Add support for private futexes (whatever they might be). Patch from Eric Dumazet. Fixes #146781.
a610f53 : Don't crap out when malloc_stats is called; instead just have a no-op implementation of it. Fixes #145559.
0fd3049 : Make one redirect mandatory for ppc64-linux.
5092a97 : Make one of the ppc32-linux initial redirects mandatory, and add further comments.
df24cf1 : Introduce the concept of a 'mandatory redirection'. A redirection says (essentially) "I am the replacement for function foo in object w/ soname bar.so". Now, if a redirection is mandatory, and bar.so is loaded but foo is not found in its symbol table, then V aborts.

671da87 : Handle the "alternative" (non-binutils) encoding of 'adc' and tidy up some other op-G-E / op-E-G decodings. This fixes a bug which was reported on valgrind-users@lists.sourceforge.net on 11 Aug 2007 ("LibVEX called failure_exit() with 3.3.0svn-r6769 with Linux on AMD64") I don't think it ever was formally filed as a bug report.

0be79f3 : Another attempt at fixing some Massif regtest failures.

fe692d6 : More glibc-2.6 suppressions.
62721e9 : - Make other integer CLO macros more correct, as I did for VG_NUM_CLO in the last commit. - Add a VG_DBL_CLO for fractional arguments. - Make Massif's --threshold and --peak-inaccuracy arguments fractional.
ea5d235 : Add four 'strtoll' variants, which are like 'atoll' but let you detect if the string converted wasn't entirely numeric. Using them for numeric command-line options -- previously if you had a option "--foo=<n>", where <n> is supposed to be an integer, then "--foo=blah" would be interpreted as "--foo=0", because the "blah" would be converted to zero and the remaining chars wouldn't be noticed.
79ef5e5 : Add some seemingly unnecessary initialisations to shut GCC 4.0.2 up.
2831b51 : In vg_SP_update_pass (stack-pointer-change analysis code), correctly handle partial updates of SP. Tricky. This fixes #152022.

0d2a2c1 : Comment-only change.
862ed5e : Don't hang on some old systems, since that makes the entire regtest system hang.
e1b4654 : Ensure omega.h is copied into the installation tree at 'make install' time.
c17be79 : Followup to r7105: stop gcc complaining about violations of ANSI C aliasing rules by casting through (char*) as an intermediate type, rather than through (void*). This seems at least moderately justifiable since the ANSI C standard explicitly says that any object may be accessed through a char pointer.

963286e : Back out r7132.
55a3004 : Filter out some of Massif's verbose output that varies from machine to machine, caused by them getting slightly different stack traces.
32397c0 : Changed Massif to record the 'slop' heap bytes caused by rounding asked-for sizes up to a multiple of 8 (or whatever --alignment is). This is combined with the "admin" bytes, resulting in the "extra" bytes. Added VG_(malloc_usable_size) to the tool interface to support this.

95386ae : Suppressions for (new) Helgrind.
b411202 : Import thrcheck from the THRCHECK branch, and rename it Helgrind (with permission of the existing Helgrind authors).
c4356f0 : Merge changes from THRCHECK branch r1787. These changes are all to do with making x86/amd64 LOCK prefixes properly visible in the IR, since threading tools need to see them. Probably would be no bad thing for cachegrind/callgrind to notice them too, since asserting a bus lock on a multiprocessor is an expensive event that programmers might like to know about.

53092c6 : ppc64-linux equivalent to r6813 (use sigframe return stub in m_trampoline, not on the stack)
a594026 : ppc32-linux signal handling: don't place the sigframe return stub on the stack; instead use a stub in m_trampoline.S. This makes it possible to deliver signals on non-executable stacks, and makes the behaviour consistent with x86-linux and amd64-linux.

23c97b6 : Followup to r6783: supply a correct index/strchr replacement for ppc32-linux/ppc64-linux.
d1dea99 : This module supplies various replacement functions, amongst them a replacement for index/strchr in ld.so. Unfortunately the replacement functionality was actually rindex/strrchr and amazingly it has taken about 2.5 years for anyone to notice.

487cadb : Merge from CGTUNE branch:
4d77a9c : Merge from CGTUNE branch, code generation improvements for amd64:
4cc684b : Merge from CGTUNE branch:
eb17e49 : Merge from CGTUNE branch:

3f94a7d : Changes to m_hashtable:
cfdc5fd : gcc-4.3 compile fixes.
54477e3 : Allow up to 7 prefixes, so as to accept 66 66 66 66 66 66 2e 0f 1f 84 00 00 00 00 00 nopw %cs:0x0(%rax,%rax,1) as a valid no-op. Blargh.
9877e9b : Dynamically expand the ExeContext hash table, rather than using a fixed size. Partial commit of a patch from Christoph Bartoschek.
1d2e2e6 : The drastic increase in the number of per-arena freelists in r6771 exposes a performance problem with doing m_mallocfree.c sanity checks (at --sanity-level=3, at least), caused by slowness in listNo_to_pszB_min. This commit fixes the problem by caching the results of queries to listNo_to_pszB_min.
d35bf74 : Make the ExeContext hash table a whole lot bigger.
1069473 : update suppressions
0b3fd2d : Previously, each Arena has a linked list of Superblocks, which can make VG_(arena_free) expensive if many superblocks have to be checked before the right one is found. This change gives the arena a dynamically expanding sorted array of superblocks, so that finding the superblock containing an about-to-be-freed block (findSb) is now O(log2 n) rather than linear in the number of superblocks in the arena. Patch from Christoph Bartoschek.
c1ac977 : Some improvements for malloc/free intensive programs, inspired by performance studies by Christoph Bartoschek:
88eb963 : suppression update for 10.3/glibc 2.6
ff1e389 : add glibc-2.6.supp to the distribution list
0a93c63 : Update.
b707d10 : * implement fistp * fix incorrect behaviour in out-of-range conversion conditions for fisttp
4c99385 : All platforms: make it clearer that missing syscalls constitute reportable bugs.
198f34f : Get rid of VG_(getcwd) and replace it with a pair of functions, VG_(record_startup_wd) which records the working directory at startup, and VG_(get_startup_wd) which later tells you what value was recorded. This works because all uses of VG_(getcwd) serve only to record the directory at process start anyway. The motivation is that AIX does not support sys_getcwd directly, so it's easier for the launcher to ship in the required value using an environment variable. On Linux sys_getcwd is used as before.
ca73f4d : update bugstatus
b5579c3 : VG_(needs_shadow_memory) does not exist; remove prototype for it.
620dd26 : Apparently 'index' shadows a global decl on some targets; therefore rename.
a780296 : Handle a whole bunch of obscure types.
896a7fd : Test a whole bunch of obscure types.

6a62401 : Callgrind manual: rewriting start of section about avoding cycles
362f783 : Callgrind format: Note about event names in the example
08e31e2 : Merge (from 3.2 branch) r6743 (Edit the manual to bring it up to date and make some of the wording a bit more professional sounding.)
c8bd0c5 : glibc 2.6 support
ae44c38 : Clarify --trace-children a little.
85e6675 : Update svn:ignore properties.
941393b : Update
d7dccdb : Callgrind: improve documentation
8badbaa : Add branch-misprediction profiling to Cachegrind. When the (new) flag --branch-sim=yes is specified, Cachegrind simulates a simple indirect branch predictor and a conditional branch predictor. The latter considers both the branch instruction's address and the behaviour of the last few conditional branches. Return stack prediction is not modelled.
3b20f66 : Update.
e29a31d : Oops. Fix longstanding bug which will have caused an unnecessary 4M of bss space to be allocated.
e428ab0 : Fix stack overflow which lead to totally mysterious .bss corruption and hence to segfaulting in vex on ppc32/64-linux in obscure circumstances. VKI_MAX_PAGE_SIZE is 64k in recent Valgrinds.
90e2e4b : Handle x87 FCOMP.
b508d77 : Older assemblers on amd64-linux don't do lahf/sahf; work around that.
2682038 : Fix regression in new/new[]/delete/delete[] intercepts for gcc-2.96.
1ac9d0c : Avoid compilation warnings with gcc-4.2.
3465e75 : Stop gcc-4.2 producing hundreds of complaints of the form "warning: cast from pointer to integer of different size" when compiling on a 64-bit target. gcc-4.2 is correct to complain. An interesting question is why no previous gcc warned about this.
a72c26d : If gcc supports -fno-stack-protector, use it. This should fix compilation failures on distros where -fstack-protector is enabled by default. See #144112.
fcf5410 : Update.
38dba99 : Add disclaimers.
db5c657 : augment previous commit
c1b1d42 : It's generally a good idea to set call-by-reference arguments, especially when the function comments says that they always are set.
09beb9e : wrap env related functions to be able to track undefined values better
9a0cba4 : Fix some copyright notices: - extend some to 2007 - use njn@valgrind.org instead of njn25@cam.ac.uk - use "tool" instead of "skin"
bcccbc0 : When doing 'demo' translations for --profile-flags=, make at least some attempt to discard existing translations first. Otherwise Cachegrind (rightly) asserts on the basis that it is seeing duplicate translation requests for the same entry point.
6de362b : Update.
c6f43dd : Fix out of date comment.
905edbd : Implement lahf/sahf on amd64. Also set NDEP on x86 sahf. Fixes #143907.
1f456de : Test sahf/lahf on amd64.
9c3b25a : Fix various cases where the instruction decoder asserted/paniced instead of doing the normal SIGILL thing. Fixes #143354.
443aa37 : Handle some more types: {REAL,INTEGER}{4,8} and 2INT. Also a change to reduce the number of error messages printed if there is an unhandled type.
8165064 : Fold Add8(t,t) ==> t << 1. Fixes #143817 (Unused bitfield pad bits confuse memcheck)
0a8db5c : Explicitly zero CCs. It's already being done by VG_(OSet_AllocNode), but that's more by chance than design.
6ce1a23 : Counterpart to r1745: teach the amd64 back end how to generate 'lea' instructions, and generate them in an important place.
79e04f8 : Teach the x86 back end how generate 'lea' instructions, and generate them in a couple of places which are important. This reduces the amount of generated code for memcheck and none by about 1%, and (in very unscientific tests on perf/bz2) speeds memcheck up by about 1%.
6f286c3 : Test some Fortran types.
b63ca16 : add a comment
b4cfa2f : Remove duplicate code -- make XArray use VG_(ssort).
72effab : update
1b4e123 : Augment a comment.
a007859 : clarify comment
6a34b36 : update
a3e991b : Fix bug 142491: allow more --alloc-fn functions (128, up from 32).
19879f1 : update
1274d24 : Fix bug 142197: don't free --toolname:foo options after they've been munged, because tools should be able to assume that they are never freed, just like other options.
2ebdb57 : update
64bd24a : Fix 142488: don't read ./.valgrindrc if CWD==HOME.
a368961 : Add a variant of gsl16test which handles the newer gsl-1.9 package.
1b2add1 : Add assertion + comment to a loop using VG_(getcwd).
3ecfaaa : Update slightly.
7fb65eb : x86 back end: use 80-bit loads/stores for floating point spills rather than 64-bit ones, to reduce accuracy loss. To support this, in reg-alloc, allocate 2 64-bit spill slots for each HRcFlt64 vreg instead of just 1.
c952a2d : More info about the VEX changes.
fa18a26 : Don't build SSE3 tests if the configure test determined that the assembler does not know about SSE3 instructions.
b81c795 : Clarify the "out of memory" message.
f0aabf8 : Older assemblers don't speak SSE3. Add a configure test for it.
a954461 : Unbreak the build on ppc64-linux.
fd4203c : amd64 equivalents of vx1742 (synthesise SIGILL in the normal way for some obscure invalid instruction cases, rather than asserting)
d51dc81 : x86 front end: synthesise SIGILL in the normal way for some obscure invalid instruction cases, rather than asserting, as happened in #143079 and #142279. amd64 equivalents to follow.
948a6fc : Make ptrace-based launchers able to handle --help, --version etc. Problem is that --help etc are handled by the tool exe. But a ptrace-based launch scheme can't run "no program" if the user just types "valgrind --help" because the launcher depends on starting the client first and only then attaching valgrind to it using ptrace. So instead provide a dummy do-nothing program to run when no program is specified. m_main notices this and acts as if there really had been no program specified.
810fe14 : Followup to r6650: tidy up sys_sigreturn/sys_rt_sigreturn on ppc32/64-linux.
cba8f43 : Followup to r6650: tidy up sys_sigreturn/sys_rt_sigreturn on ppc32/64-linux.
1829053 : Document and tidy up one of the more arcane corners of signal handling: why PRE(sys_sigreturn) has to construct a fake syscall return value which, when written back to the guest state, leaves it unchanged. It's only taken me about 3 years to realise why :-) Fixes to ppc platforms to follow.
ea9c15e : Use a 64-bit counter to keep track of the total number of bytes allocated, rather than SizeT which is word-sized. Your average C++ lardware can easily turn over more than 4G in total in a half hour run on a 32-bit machine, in which case the counter wraps around.
3e5a8b5 : Back out r6640; I'm pretty sure it is the wrong thing to do now.
12f8f92 : Tidy up a lot
66225ad : More redhat8 suppressions.
de21b95 : Add a test for vex ppc64 code generation bug fixed by vex r1739 (When generating 64-bit code, ensure that any addresses used in 4 or 8 byte loads or stores of the form reg+imm have the lowest 2 bits of imm set to zero, so that they can safely be used in ld/ldu/lda/std/stdu instructions.)
9dd4d68 : Add a custom stderr filter for memcheck/tests/amd64/defcfaexpr.

7acef08 : Handle sys_ioprio_set on amd64-linux.
7d6f103 : It appears glibc-2.5's getenv() function steps along environment strings in 16-bit chunks, which can cause false errors in some cases (sigh). So do the usual thing and replace it.
e265636 : wibble
71043fe : update
34085e3 : When generating 64-bit code, ensure that any addresses used in 4 or 8 byte loads or stores of the form reg+imm have the lowest 2 bits of imm set to zero, so that they can safely be used in ld/ldu/lda/std/stdu instructions. This boils down to doing an extra check in iselWordExpr_AMode and avoiding the reg+imm case in cases where the amode might end up in any of the abovementioned instructions.

14c7cc5 : Get rid of the type XArrayStrings in m_clientstate and use new generic equivalents in module m_xarray instead. A suprisingly pervasive change.
7df1515 : Make all the m_xarray functions tool-visible.
d864eb9 : Expandable arrays of arbitrary element type T are a simple, useful abstraction implemented independently in several places in the code base (bad!). This commit moves into public view a generic implementation of it which has been lurking in readxcoff.c for some time. Currently nothing uses it.

a44b15f : Make VG_(printf) et al conform to ANSI w.r.t. capitalisation of hex numbers: %x produces lowercase hex, and %X produces uppercase. Unfortunately this probably changes the output in dozens of places.
95611ff : --wait-for-gdb=yes: gcc 4.1.2 now appears to delete do-nothing loops, so make the loop variable volatile so it can't do that.

d8366ee : update
f767d96 : Essentially non-functional tidyings and improvements to debuginfo reading. Two sets of changes:
dbb9c8e : This code shouldn't be run unless --trace-mem was specified.
5a0a773 : Update for changes to lackey
5d1c901 : * make the --trace-mem output format more concise * new option --trace-superblocks for getting a log of superblock entries
650d82a : Get rid of the unused --model-pthreads flag.
4994cc2 : Fix ppc64-linux dispatcher following r6582.
5f76de0 : Redo the dispatcher's fast-cache mechanism (VG_(tt_fast) et al) to be more cache friendly. This changes the mechanism from being a table of pointers to (guest address, translated code pairs) to being a table of pairs (guest address, pointer to translated code). The effect ranges from zero up to about 20% performance improvement on memcheck, the biggest effects being seen for programs which jump around a large number of blocks of code and whose data set does not fit in L2.
7234335 : extra thing
b224a48 : Oops; make declarations match definitions. So much for C's type system.
ab8e511 : Work around gcc limitations on aix.
f7cdfe2 : Unbreak aix build.
085f936 : Specialise VG_(ssort) for 4-word elements. This removes about 80% of all calls to VG_(memcpy). Thanks to cachegrind for showing somebody was calling VG_(memcpy) a huge number of times, and to callgrind for finding out who :-)

34f8e83 : Update.
f9d2f9b : Redo the interface to m_initimg (module for setting up the initial client image) so it's less of an incomprehensible mess. Basically the idea is to have two standard functions, VG_(ii_create_image) and VG_(ii_finalise_image), which communicate using the structure types IICreateImageInfo and IIFinaliseImageInfo. The types hold various OS-specific bits of info. A nice side effect is that m_main is tidied up somewhat.
1936f8b : CFI reader: when decoding the single (address) argument to DW_CFA_set_loc, take into account any encoding info conveyed by the augmentation string. See big comment in the code.

ef4433b : When doing rlwinm in 64-bit mode, bind the intermediate 32-bit result to a temporary so it is only computed once. What's there currently causes it to be computed twice.

0e24d09 : Get rid of # comments in assembly files.

7cc2040 : When unmapping segments from below aspacem_minAddr, convert them back into SkResvns, not SkFrees. Fixes #133694. Thanks to Tom Hughes for patch and test case.

42e9bd0 : Add missing #include.
044f138 : Suppressions for various structure padding things on amd64 SuSE 10.1.
32d615b : More reduction rules, which further reduce memcheck's false error rate on optimised x86 and amd64 code.
cd8c95a : SuSE 10.1 (ppc32/64) fixlet.
ec4e607 : Hand assemble cmpxchg16b as old assemblers don't understand it.
9195aa1 : Fix previous commit (r1640?) so that it's actually correct :-)
a9cb67b : Comparing a reg with itself produces a result which doesn't depend on the contents of the reg. Therefore remove the false dependency, which has been known to cause memcheck to produce false errors for xlc-compiled code.
d78c9fc : Update.
409e73f : Regtest for #127521 (amd64 cmpxchg8b/16b).
d0aa0a5 : Implement amd64 insns cmpxchg8b and cmpxchg16b. Fixes #127521.
8aeeaa9 : A small fix to the "mempool trim" client request; the previous version didn't cope with zero-sized chunks properly. (from Graydon Hoare).
35c1c7c : Regression test for fix for #129866.
ee2de2c : Extra paranoia that should really have been committed in r6003.
63a622f : When handling mremap, disallow an expanding in-place remap if it would trash some other segment as a result of the expansion. This fixes #129866. I don't know if it is a good solution though. Causes none/tests/mremap{,2} to fail now, although I think it is still OK. mremap really is a semantic disaster area.
c73fe10 : Regtest for bug fixed by r6001.
613a9f2 : When a segment becomes free, and it is above aspacem_maxAddr, mark it as SkResvn rather than SkFree, since doing otherwise causes the area above aspacem_maxAddr - which starts out as SkResvn - to be polluted with SkFree bits. Fixes an assertion failure found by Alex Bennee (users list, 9 Aug 06).
ef68c5b : Regression test for #132146.
6140822 : Generate less verbose IR for amd64 'bswapq'. Fixes #132146.
f355f6b : amd64 insn printing fix.
88d3ba8 : Don't print more lines of a stack-trace than were obtained. Thanks to Bart Van Assche for spotting.
6692608 : Update
c49ae75 : Regression tests for SSE3 support.
fcf21f3 : 64-bit equivalent to r1635: handle all SSE3 instructions except monitor and mwait in 64-bit mode. Regression tests to follow soon.
d874687 : Update expected output following Graydon H's leak checker fixes.
dd5d204 : Handle all SSE3 instructions except monitor and mwait. 64-bit equivalents to follow soon.
ec387ca : Handle nop-with-an-amode (sheesh. Mutancy. whatever next?) for x86 and amd64. Fixes #131481 and #131298.
fcf126f : Print the same text as micro_ops_warn on x86; doing otherwise defeats the stderr filter for said text and so makes the test fail on Pentium-4's in 64-bit mode.
5bee4f8 : Followup to r5991: when leak checking, treat zero-sized blocks as if they had size one. Otherwise they appear to cover no address space, so no pointers to them are ever found, and so they are always incorrectly marked as leaked.
eb5ecdb : Update.

a630fcf : A couple of suppressions for FC5/ppc32.
1cf56cf : Assertion is too restrictive; it's possible to validly get an addressibility error when MC_(clo_undef_value_errors) is True.
a269958 : Rewrite inline asm for ppc32/64-linux to make them gcc-4.1.0 proof. Thanks to David Woodhouse for pointing me in the right direction.
cd90bfe : ppc backend: handle vector constant of zero.
fcb3bc9 : When moving an address range add the new range before marking the old one as free otherwise the filename referred to by the temporary copy of the segment may be dropped from the segment name table when the old range is freed even though the new range is going to use it.
00afab8 : Validate the fnIdx for a file segment when doing a sanity check.
8c2a6ca : Change ifdefs to select per-platform, not per-arch.
a59aeef : Fix crash on ppc64-linux.
1036011 : (1) build libmpiwrap.so with -fPIC, not -fpic. (2) if the build/install fails, just keep going anyway.
6204590 : Get rid of assertion getting in the way of handling 'sbbb G,E' where E is memory. Fixes #127631.
b7d59b9 : Update for 3.2.0.
9660332 : Add JosefW.
2a9ca15 : Add missing closing tags (a.k.a. "Wow, that xsltproc is such a pedant!")
0b73e8c : Update.
0d41dd0 : Report the error number when a UME mmap fails.
183375a : A 1 page stack isn't big enough for this test on ppc32-linux.
42a32a2 : Update expected output following vex r1619.
5328b10 : Got a sudden attach of the implicit-type-casting paranoias whilst looking for (non-) bug in running Python.
7c1fa87 : Back out r5595: the redirections deleted there are in fact used by gcc 2.96 on R H 7.3.
346d9a1 : A couple of IR simplification hacks for the amd64 front end, so as to avoid false errors from memcheck. Analogous to some of the recent bunch of commits to x86 front end.
8dd6b9d : Un-break coredumping on ppc64-linux. Finally fixes #121617.
d7baad4 : Change the default load address on all platforms to be 7/8s of a G. This should make V work on any address space setup in which at least the first 1 G of address space is usable.
9088540 : Clear up yet another gcc-4.1.0 stunt leading to false uninitialised value errors on SuSE 10.1 (x86) running konqueror.
05b1f9a : Implement the set_robust_list and get_robust_list system calls.
8d2772b : Sync system call lists with 2.6.17-rc4 kernel source.
3cad615 : gcc 3.3.3 on ppc64-linux believes (perhaps correctly) that 'fd' can be used when uninitialised.
275ccdf : A few more x86 eflags-helper rewrite cases, which further reduce the false error rate of memcheck on optimised code.
89d89e9 : Add an IR folding rule to convert Add32(x,x) into Shl32(x,1). This fixes #118466 and it also gets rid of a bunch of false positives for KDE 3.5.2 built by gcc-4.0.2 on x86, of the form shown below.
54be8dd : Add specialisation rules to simplify the IR for 'testl .. ; js ..', 'testw .. ; js ..' and 'testb .. ; js ..'. This gets rid of a bunch of false errors in Memcheck of the form
49ceddc : Yet more messing with masking approximate results.
365985f : Update expected outputs following r5895.
7f1f7a8 : Apparently Intel's rcpps etc approximations are more approximate than AMD's. Kludge everything accordingly. Sigh.
5b0acb0 : Update expected results following change in r5898.
2de0441 : Add masking for results of rcpps/rcpss/rsqrtps/rsqrtps so as to give consistent results on all platforms. Expected outputs not updated yet.
b977908 : A new flag, --error-exitcode=, has been added, to allow changing the exit code in runs where Valgrind reported errors. Fixes #121814 and #126517.
5850108 : Oops, this should have been in r5895.
513646f : Increase number of unsuppressed errors shown before cutoff by a factor of 100.
414a43d : Update.
1287ab4 : Enable 'SHLDv imm8,Gv,Ev'. Fixes #126583.
5fadaf9 : Enable 'sbb $imm,%al'. Fixes #126668.
0e21d1d : Regression test for clc/stc/cmc on amd64.
3180446 : Implement CLC/STC/CMC. Fixes #125651.
dbdb36f : Comprehensive tests for bt{s,r,c,}{w,l,q} on amd64.
25d2386 : (1) Fix longstanding bug causing erroneous register zeroing for 'btl'. (2) Implement 16-bit versions of bt/bts/btr/btc. (Fixes #125607)
1636922 : Test x86 {push,pop}{w,l}.
fcff178 : Support 'popw m16'. Fixes #126243.
4395ad4 : Add a comment.
1d05727 : Tidy up bug status file and document a few new fixes.
dadff0a : Ignore offset information in anonymous mmap calls. Fixes bug #126722.
67b0a95 : Tests for 16/32 bit byte reversed loads and stores.
c00fcc7 : Don't check the fifth argument of mremap() unless MREMAP_FIXED is set in the fourth argument. Fix to bug #123535.
f9d8385 : Add support for CDROMREADRAW and fix CDROMREADTOCENTRY to mark the right number of bytes as defined in the post handler. Fixes bug #126696.
a43717f : Fix linkat, renameat and symlinkat wrappers to look at the arguments correctly. Fixes bug #126938.
d1e697a : Another suppression needed by SuSE 10.0 on ppc32.
ea3a99f : Increase scheduling quantum to 100k basic blocks. Nowadays even modest cpus can run 5-10M memcheck'd bbs per second and the previous limit of 50k gives a 100Hz switch rate, which causes cache pollution (a known performance problem) and other context-switch overheads.
afd1639 : Fix for 32-bit mode, as per comment.
413a468 : Implement sthbrx.
40d8c09 : Implement lhbrx.
a170a3f : Fix printing bug in PRE(sys_stat64).
f218491 : Vectorise copy_address_range_perms for common cases. This gives about 40% speedup on artificial programs which just do realloc() and nothing else, and about a 3-4% speedup on starting kpresenter-1.5.0 and loading a 16-slide presentation.
d7aca4c : Tests for the mov{z,s}{bw,bl,wl} instructions.
6ba982f : Fix incorrect behaviour of mov{s,z}bw (#126253).
290e34e : Update the Ever-Growing List Of Sins.
d4b93a8 : Increase # supported threads to 300 (see #126217).
c40fce5 : Print a slightly more helpful error message if the log file creation fails.
e26e42f : Add another test of permissions range copying (copy_address_range_perms).
e5b662b : Get rid of executable permissions on C source file.
63c8de5 : Add .type and .size directives for VG_(run_innerloop) and VG_(run_a_noredir_translation) on all platforms where they are missing.
8f07359 : Counterpart to r1605: in the ppc insn selector, don't use the bits VexArchInfo.hwcaps to distinguish ppc32 and ppc64. Instead pass the host arch around. And associated plumbing.
386c9bf : Make VG_(run_innerloop) visible for outer Valgrinds with self hosting. Without this, the symbol has size 0 and type NOT, and is ignored by the symbol loader.
10e80e3 : Hint to better run with option "--pop-on-jump" when doing self-hosting runs with outer callgrind.
5b40994 : Callgrind: Fix for callgrind_control
a762b0f : Callgrind: Improve self-hosting with outer callgrind tool
a5f55da : Don't use the bits VexArchInfo.hwcaps to distinguish ppc32 and ppc64, since that doesn't work properly. Instead pass the guest arch around too. Small change with lots of associated plumbing.
a672ea3 : Get rid of VG_(x86_linux_REDIR_FOR__dl_sysinfo_int80) and do the x86-linux stack unwind kludge another way. This is believed to fix #108258.
15d3591 : Update
56295ac : Un-break 'make dist'.
55c4376 : Fix completely bogus asm, which didn't work when compiled with gcc-4.1.0 since it trashed the regs that gcc assigned for %0 and %1 before reading them. local_sys_write_stderr() for the 3 other targets suffer from the same problem.
7bc57fc : split the assert so that its more obvious which part is failing
b148920 : Update 64-bit cleanness info.
6bb0825 : Another fix for interactive control, together with the --base option, which allows to specify another directory for dumps and control/result files. With "--base=/tmp/foo", we want control/result files in "/tmp", and not in a directory "/tmp/foo/".
4e28a85 : Fixes for interactive control:
e25e765 : Add support for sys_broc on amd64-linux when --kernel-variant=bproc.
c57bc14 : Almost all the stuff in pub_tool_libcsignal.h was not used by any tool; so has been moved back into pub_core_libcsignal.h.
e87dba3 : Build fixes for gcc-3.3.3.
1baf7db : - Fix indentation in one section of Cachegrind - In the same section, use VG_(percentify) to avoid overflow when computing information for -v printing.
535a235 : Update
b293916 : update
ca54af3 : Remove tool-specific code (which says which tools allow XML) from the core by introducing a new "need": VG_(needs_xml_output)().
a0d693b : Regression test cases for FP rounding modes on ppc32 and ppc64. (Dave Nomura).
152fdf4 : Un-break core dumping on ppc32-linux.
9ebe5f2 : Update again
3ed706c : Update
a58bbbc : Syscall wrappers for ppc32-linux (and one for amd64-linux). (from Jakub Jelinek) See #125492.
ae84d78 : Fix for instruction-decoding failures reported in #124499.
582031b : Not all MPI implementations define MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG_LONG.
9e41d8d : Suppress any source filename in a "(below main)" line in a stack trace.
5e0e922 : Clarify the Helgrind-doesn't-work message.
576f323 : Allow 'repe scas' (possible fix for #124892).
7eca0cc : Recent GCCs (3.4+ at least) optimize static unused functions out, so making VALGRIND_PRINTF and VALGRIND_PRINTF_BACKTRACE static and attribute unused proved to be much better than always compiling it as exported weak function. (Jakub Jelinek)
f84805e : Add a suppression for yet another glibc string function: __strcpy_chk. We really ought intercept/replace this, and that would be easy, except __strcpy_chk uses __chk_fail and I haven't figured out what that is/does.
5bac8e5 : On x86, don't use x87 registers for 8-byte FP loads/stores; instead use an mmx register (which is the same thing in disguise) since mmx loads/stores are guaranteed to be the identity. This should fix failures of this test on x86-linux.
28d2e64 : Add the O_LARGEFILE constant so people can use it when writing tools that generate large trace files (> 2GB).
534e201 : Properly handle external debuginfo (.gnu_debuglink) for stripped and prelinked libraries (patch from L. David Baron).
eaf0ca9 : Redid the --trace-mem=yes option of Lackey properly. Updated some related stuff along with it, such as the NEWS file.
1b1d752 : Re-enable amd64 test for pmaddwd.
d69222c : Fold in a patch which appeared in FC5's default valgrind build, which causes V to ignore more DWARF3 CFA expressions on amd64 and so gets rid of complaints from the CFA reader. Why didn't Red Hat push this patch upstream? I don't know.
db85903 : Implement amd64 pmaddwd for SSE2.
840b4aa : Include missing files in tarball (== unbreak from-tarball builds)
42fcf5d : Update
c0a02f8 : Oops: when adding translations to the auxiliary transtab, don't forget to ensure D-I cache coherence. Fixes SIGILLs in fn wrapping failures on low end PowerPCs.
d99644d : Tweaked Lackey. Main change is that the default instrumentation is now only added if you specify --basic-counts=yes (which is the default). So all of the instrumentation is now controlled by a command-line option (one of --basic-counts, --detailed-counts or --trace-mem) and so if you turn them all off it behaves like Nulgrind. This makes it clearer what's going on and easier for newbies to modify.
8c20d87 : Fix vg_perf to work with older Valgrind versions.
36c11e9 : Commit a patch from Olly Betts which avoids a possible problem with COUNT_LEAKS on 64-bit machines.
a874ef4 : Add a FAQ.
4cf530b : Use better variable names.
72c84c9 : Avoid compiler warnings on ppc64-linux.
de5358b : update

54d0dc7 : ppc32-linux: work around assemblers which can't do Altivec, by emitting the relevant instruction directly. Fixes a build problem on Debian 3.1 (ppc32).
313639f : Enable sigsuspend on x86-linux and ppc32-linux.
a1bdebc : Don't use the presence of a filename to decide if a segment in the initial /proc/self/maps to decide if the segment is an AnonV or FileV segment as some systems don't report the filename. Use the device and inode numbers instead. Fixes bug #124528.

12c73f1 : Callgrind: add 4 regression tests
8a95fd3 : Fix another place where function addresses passed to Vex needed to be dereferenced properly. (Logically part of r5814).
bb76070 : Fix ppc64-linux breakage - get the function entry address, not the descriptor address.
bca134f : Add 64-bit test output.
3dfd9f0 : Don't print an address on stdout as it doesn't get automagically changed into 0x.........
dc6734b : Another shadow memory test. This one does a huge number of loads and stores of char/short/int/int64/double at random offsets and hence alignments in an array. It does it in a way in which the computation just computes the expected V bits, and hence can check whether these seem correct.
19df83c : Get rid of unused #define.
2229db0 : In check_all, allow two different acceptable byte values, so as to cover the behaviour of all possible variants of float loads/stores.
b2963ad : Partial fix for the sh-mem.c failure on PPC32. This should make it work on PPC32 now but break it on the other platforms. Julian will commit a change to ensure the 32-bit floats are copied through the FP regs on all platforms to make the broken ones work again.

e93fc72 : update
1d0825f : Merge in the COMPVBITS branch to the trunk. This is a big change to Memcheck, replacing the 9-bits-per-byte shadow memory representation to a 2-bits-per-byte representation (with possibly a little more on the side) by taking advantage of the fact that extremely few memory bytes are partially defined.

fb1e9ad : Add a new kind of memory-painting primitive, which is: 'make_defined'. For each byte in the range, if the byte is addressible, make it be initialised, but if it isn't addressible, leave it alone. So it's like a version of make_readable which doesn't alter addressibility.

39eb667 : Fix minor anomaly pointed out by icc9.
f8dc64f : Denestification.
1162491 : Teach the Dwarf2 line-info reader how to handle so-called 64-bit Dwarf, which is a (fully documented) Dwarf3 variant in which some 32-bit fields are expanded to 64 bits. Presumably this is useful for those vast hordes of folks who regularly build executables or shared objects more than 4GB long. For whatever reason, IBM's xlc/xlC/xlf insist on generating 64-bit Dwarf when compiling even hello-world size programs for ppc64-linux.
517cdd5 : Enable sys_getrusage.
c8c5c87 : Handle main thread stacks up to 16MB.
d5a30a4 : Fix erroneous hardwired redirect spec.
453e8f8 : Get rid of general case in mkLazy3 and instead add new cases as they appear.
1a866b4 : Oops, stuff that should have been part of r1573 (4-arg primop change).
96a015e : Enable rounding checks for fmadd/fmsub et al.
e91cea7 : Track vex r1573 (introduction of 4-arg IR primops for ppc fmadd/fmsub).
40c8026 : Redo the way FP multiply-accumulate insns are done on ppc32/64. Instead of splitting them up into a multiply and an add/sub, add 4 new primops which keeps the operation as a single unit. Then, in the back end, re-emit the as a single instruction.

334870d : ppc32/64: handle twi/tdi (conditional trap) instructions
b0e1ccc : This causes problems on setups where ld.so is mapped at just over 1M: it zeroes out that area (as a result of one of the mmaps) and the program consequently goes into an infinite loop. Change the map sizes to just one page to avoid that.
56de421 : fre: observe the current rounding mode
c3778a2 : Redo x86g_calculate_FXTRACT to only use integer arithmetic.

fa7fc6b : Comment-only changes
4796d66 : Fixups following recent FP rounding mode changes.
bee2c28 : Add a check for fsincos.
672f778 : Yet more x86 instruction tests, mostly aimed at wierd/transcendental x87 insns.
d6075eb : Tidy up a couple more x86-related primops following rounding changes.
9b0cc58 : Make the CSE pass more aggressive. It now commons up Mux0X and GetI expressions too. This generates somewhat better FP code on x86 since it removes more redundant artefacts from the x87 FP stack simulation. Unfortunately commoning up GetIs complicates CSEs, since it is now possible that "available expressions" collected by the CSEr will become invalidated by writes to the guest state as we work through the block. So there is additional code to check for this case.
f47286e : More x86 tidying up following rounding changes.

b32bc73 : Un-break ppc32 following recent hw-capabilities hackery.
7c54586 : Unbreak ppc32 following recent hw-capabilities hackery.
e3121f3 : Track vex r1555 (Change the way Vex represents architecture variants into something more flexible.)
5117ce1 : Change the way Vex represents architecture variants into something more flexible. Prior to this change, the type VexSubArch effectively imposed a total ordering on subarchitecture capabilities, which was overly restrictive. This change moves to effectively using a bit-set, allowing some features (instruction groups) to be supported or not supported independently of each other.
09e88d1 : Re-enable stfiwx.
4f3e0f2 : Track vex r1553 (addition of Iop_Est8FRecip, case Iop_Est5FRSqrt)

c74373d : In 32-bit mode, handle F64toI64 and I64toF64.
7fd5bb0 : A bit more backend tidying: - fix up more float-integer conversions - remove unused signedness field on PPCInstr_Load
92923de : Change the way the ppc backend does ppc32/64 float-integer conversions. fctiw/fctid/fcfid/stfiwx are now represented explicitly and are generated by the instruction selector. This removes the need for hdefs.c to know anything about scratch areas on the stack and scratch FP registers.

870c84b : Re-enable fsqrts.
eb3603e : Vex can't simulate floor() or ceil() correctly on ppc32/64 from glibc-2.3.4 onwards, so just replace the functions with the older glibc implementation. This is an ugly kludge.
aa60ddf : The ppc32 port ran itself out of spill slots on some heavy duty FP code.
02fd0d7 : Test program to check the behaviour of a bunch of FP functions.
f65f9d3 : Enable message-queue syscalls.
48e7bc4 : Use perf/fbench as a simple FP test too. This is a modified copy, not a symlink.
22b4448 : Fix profiling dispatcher.
bb68627 : Comment-only changes.
46712cd : Use the bz2 test in perf/ as a regression-test, just as a moderately complex integer program which exercises Vex a bit.
7541cac : rm unneeded headers
0283bae : Two unrelated changes:
3a384b3 : Index the BB_info table by redirected guest address, not non-redirected guest address. This is a small but significant change needed to make function wrapping work. The problem is that with function wrapping two different translations are associated with the non-redirected address (of a wrapped function entry point), and so cachegrind asserts. Whereas the redirected guest addresses reflect the reality of only one translation associated with each address. So use them instead.
6b0d5b3 : rm 'inline' - produces too many complaints with -Winline
7c788ae : Get rid of compiler warnings.
e80ac00 : Test to check that cachegrind's BB_info management system isn't confused by function wrapping.
818cbba : Update.
8611edf : Handle __NR_madvise.
2f22bd7 : ppc64-linux: compute the correct initial program counter and tocptr when the interpreter is loaded at a different address than what it asked for.
811f02e : Yet another possible output, due to trivial differences in backtraces. This is getting rediculous. We need a better way to compare backtraces in regression test outputs.
5a6d7e4 : Wibble
38de099 : Make fn wrapping work again on ppc32-linux.
8215ffa : Forgot to svn add this.
66226cc : x86 function wrapping fixes.

d68ac3e : Changes to make function wrapping work better on ppc64-linux:
134d1aa : More function wrapping tests.
5ff11dd : More ppc64-only function wrapping hacks:
9dd9cf1 : Add Ijk_EmFail, a new kind of IR block exit: an emulation failure (fatal error) from which Vex (generated code) cannot recover.

2da8f33 : Update with new expected outputs.
9e9864c : Suppressions-tests fixes.

5a3f36f : Don't try sys_sigprocmask on ppc64-linux.
81c145a : getcontext() seems to be unimplemented on glibc-2.3.3 on ppc64-linux. Handle that eventuality.
a151c39 : Clever handling of partially defined equality does not work on ppc32/64 at the moment. Make this test handle that whilst still testing the facility on x86/amd64.
714cbe0 : This was segfaulting on ppc64-linux, even natively. These changes stop it doing that. Am not convinced this is a good fix -- I don't really understand how this program works.
26fd33d : Make a bit less nonsensical on 64-bit platforms.
cfb5e2b : ppc64-linux: apply the bogus-LR kludge in a second place.
dcb6ec8 : Deal with somewhat dubious numbers showing up from the kernel for the r3 (syscall return) value in the ucontext for a signal interrupting a syscall.
aa80426 : Rationalise demangling a bit more, so that suppression matching works properly again.
da646ca : Add handy debugging line.
94c6735 : More syscalls.
cf64bd2 : Consistently call init() before doing any MALLOC_TRACE, since the latter depends on function pointers obtained by the former.
dfbaa22 : Make VG_(get_StackTrace2) aware of bogus LR values in replacement/wrapper functions on ppc64-linux, which otherwise mess up the backtraces.
0c95e94 : Fix an all-platforms bug introduced by the recent overhaul of function interception and wrapping. This was causing failures matching function names in suppressions to function names in backtraces when the latter names were Z-encoded (eg malloc), which typically caused all leak suppressions to fail because they contain names such as malloc, which are Z-encoded.
e21a858 : To reduce the endless nuisance of multiple different names for "the frame below main()" screwing up the testsuite, change all known incarnations of said into a single name, "(below main)".
9085f7e : Make these behave correctly on ppc64 ELF.
2e1a677 : Valgrind-side handling (fast case) for the ppc64 ELF stack redzone.
93baf94 : Allow more syscalls.
cf8986c : For ppc64, emit AbiHints from the front end so as to tell tools when the 288-byte stack should be regarded as having become undefined as per the ppc64 ELF ABI.
8813eef : Make the selection of the default platform a bit more sophisticated, so it does the right thing on ppc64-linux rigs.
848a1c3 : Get the core thread modelling code compiling again - uncomment the code, fix the includes and switch to OSets instead of SkipLists.
342ff2e : Update.
9b0567a : Reinstate VG_ARCH_ALL, erroneously removed by r5496.
33afdb5 : Change the default --trace-notbelow= number from zero to infinity, effectively, since that's a more useful default.
774453b : The symbol table reader hides all that dot crazyness on ppc64-linux now.
cf95181 : ppc64-linux: set R2 before running __libc_freeres
658f05a : More ppc64-linux function replacement/wrapping stuff.
461df9c : These files all speak about instrumentation functions. Instrumentation functions now take a callback closure structure (VgCallbackClosure*), so this commit changes the signatures accordingly.
63fed7f : Add test code for checking that m_debuginfo's tocptr-reading code on ppc64-linux are working properly.
641a5cb : Fix copy-n-paste error.
62eae5f : Increase size of the largest guest state handled.
34593e5 : Rewrite VG_(translate) to make it clearer (it had grown like Topsy for a long time) and to use the new preable-generating callback facility supported by Vex. Use this to add support for R2 saving/restoring needed for function replacement/wrapping on ppc64-linux.
40c186c : Further refine ppc64-linux ELF symbol table reading to try to establish the toc base value (R2) needed for any given symbol.
9734b20 : ppc64-linux function wrapping support (does not work properly)
c716aea : Two different sets of changes (hard to disentangle):
be482ae : Give the ppc64 guest state a 16-entry pseudo-register array, guest_REDIR_STACK. This is used (along with a stack pointer, guest_REDIR_SP) by Valgrind to support function replacement and wrapping on ppc64-linux. Due to the strange ppc64-linux ABI, both replacement and wrapping require saving (%R2,%LR) pairs on a stack, and this provides the stack.
6e53088 : Teach the ppc back end (64-bit mode only) how to deal with PutI and GetI. These are needed to support by IR trickery which supports function replacement/wrapping on ppc64-linux.
204cf50 : Add some ignores.
69724e6 : Tidy up ELF symbol table reading a bit. Make a completely new function for reading ELF symbol tables on ppc64-linux so as to avoid cluttering up the {x86,amd64,ppc32}-linux cases with convoluted hoop-jumping needed to handle both the dotful (older) and dotless (newer) ppc64-linux ABI variants.
74d6e0e : Fix bogus assertions.
78c0c09 : Use VG_(am_mmap_anon_float_valgrind) to allocate the unredirected translation cache. This ensures that the cache space is executable which it isn't when it is allocated as a static variable in the data segment, at least on my amd64 box.
360ed5d : Decode NOREDIR events properly in debug output.

a879a47 : Make sure EM_X86_64 is defined as elf.h doesn't define it on some older systems.
5741d40 : Duh, remove debug printing. Duh.
8d1fa88 : Update.
7289274 : Increase buffer size, so that long debugger command lines don't crash V. Also add buffer overrun checks.
a162c2c : Strict-aliasing fix needed to make gcc-4.1.0 happy.
75d8eb9 : Nasty hack to stop the leak checker dying on custom-allocator example from Ashley Pittman.
7e9ed71 : When using a custom allocator that allocates with no intervening blocks, the <= relation is the correct one. In effect asserting < constitutes an off-by-one error.
49bdd7a : findSb: gradually rearrange the superblock list to bring frequently accessed blocks closer to the front. This speeds up malloc/free intensive programs because evidently those searches cause a lot of cache misses (so cachegrind tells us). For perf/heap.c on P4 Northwood, this halves the run-time (!) from 85.8 to 42.9 seconds. For "real" code (start/exit ktuberling) there is a small but worthwhile performance gain, of about 2 seconds out of 95.
bc6a06c : Update known-bugs summary.
59b2c31 : Fix typos.
444e4b4 : Add a malloc/free stress test.
a527a49 : Add info about overhead in heap blocks and OSet nodes.
8f53e99 : Fix switchback.c to reflect changes to call of LibVEX_Translate() Fix test_ppc_jm1.c to reflect direct linking - main -> __main etc - vex_printf -> vexxx_printf etc
bb01b7c : Fixed up front and backend for 32bit mul,div,cmp,shift in mode64 Backend: - separated shifts from other alu ops - gave {shift, mul, div, cmp} ops a bool to indicate 32|64bit insn - fixed and implemented more mode64 cases
5ee4948 : Hold the event count in r29 rather than the count register, since the former doesn't need to be spilled and reloaded for every bb run.
1f430d3 : Add missing cases in debug printing.
f774505 : ppc32/64 backend: take r29 out of circulation so the Valgrind dispatcher can use it.

265bf44 : add note about recent performance improvement
30e23ac : Improvments to vg_perf: - show percentage speedup over the first Valgrind when comparing multiple Valgrind - don't accept --reps < 0 - avoid div-by-zero if the runtime is measured as zero
0d3a1a8 : Make this work on platforms where r != x.
0d9efdd : Rewrite amd64 dispatch loop to add performance enhancements as per x86 reorganisation of r5345.
0528bb5 : Modify amd64 backend to use jump-jump scheme rather than call-return scheme.
274807d : - Track vex r1494 (x86/amd64 change of conventions for getting to translations and back to dispatcher, and also different arg passing conventions to LibVEX_Translate).
17c7f95 : - x86 back end: change code generation convention, so that instead of dispatchers CALLing generated code which later RETs, dispatchers jump to generated code and it jumps back to the dispatcher. This removes two memory references per translation run and by itself gives a measureable performance improvement on P4. As a result, there is new plumbing so that the caller of LibVEX_Translate can supply the address of the dispatcher to jump back to.

It works a lot like the vg_regtest script. It's a bit rough around the edges -- eg. you can't currently directly compare two different versions of Valgrind, which would be useful -- but it is a good start.

9856aac : Fix some whitespace issues.

f811097 : Stop gcc4 complaints re ppc32 test - Moved all declarations in front of statements. Based on patch from Yao Qi <qiyaoltc@cn.ibm.com>.

e1b349b : Add a new file tracking performance improvements.
0181c77 : Update version number to 3.2.0.SVN (I think that's right).
2525617 : Sync with reality.
f9517d0 : Modify the tree builder to use a fixed-size binding environment rather than one that is potentially proportional to the length of the input BB. This changes its complexity from quadratic to linear (in the length of the BB) and gives a noticable increase in the overall speed of vex. The tradeoff is that it can no longer guarantee to build maximal trees, but in practice in only rarely fails to do so (about 1 in 100 bbs) and so the resulting degradation in code quality is completely insignificant (unmeasurable).
ba97adb : 3rd go at making args match format string.
d40e1bf : Add some 3.2.0 goals.
842c93f : Disable 'yield' -- it fails so often that it's useless.
97ab7e7 : mc-tech-docs.xml - removed ref to cachegrind.org
252c614 : Post-release changes: - removed a reference to cachegrind dot org from mc-tech-docs.xml - in an effort to simplify future borked links, replaced all valgrind website urls with entities so now we just have to change one string. - new stylesheet to create the docs to 'fit' into the website - added build rules 'make website-docs' + make download-docs to /docs/Makefile.am
5d75045 : Record tagging/branching magic incantations.
fa46202 : Hopefully final changes for 3.1.0.
9bec93c : Due to package upgrades (docbook, passivetex), removed some bug-patches and created some new ones in the stylesheets. Also tweaked some files to structure the xml properly. The FAQ and the Quick-Start are now 'articles' inside a book-wrapper, which is as it should be.
66afb9f : 64-bit format string fix
750ba5e : Make glibc-2.4 suppressions work on 64 bit platforms too.
4eeda9c : Be paranoid about the alignment of the storage arrays.
a36dcfa : ppc32 only: use the signal context structures in a way which also works with 2.4 kernels. Without this, signal handling and hence threads don't really work properly on ppc32 on kernel 2.4. Add comments from Paul M too.
39a7c1d : ppc32 only: clarify meaning of second arg of VG_(mk_SysRes_ppc32_linux) and fix an inconsistent use of it, from m_signals.
2d6b14a : Use a very fast in-line allocator. This improves its performance by up to 10% on a P4.
2573c25 : Compile vex at -O2. This improves its performance by about 15% on a PIII running SuSE 10 (gcc 4.0.2).
2ead522 : Do float-to-bit-image conversion in a way which does not break ANSI C aliasing rules.
20eb26d : Fix build system bug causing omission of some ppc32 test files from the tarball.
fdf619e : Fix bug observed by Neal Norwitz in which mremap fails for file mappings.
e329b26 : Enable a few extra system calls on amd64 as found by the Python test suite.
ae17e7e : Hopefully final 3.1.0RC1 changes.
6a443b2 : As with ppc it's necessary to have an initial redirect for index(strchr) on x86 glibc-2.3.5.
71ef8e7 : Fix obscure memcheck bug found by Nick. This could cause false negatives, but only in the following unlikely circumstances: for an 8-byte store, which is handled by by the slow path (due to misalignment or incomplete addressibility). In this case, the bug caused the top 32 of the written V bits to be forced to zero ("defined"). This would not have affected the vast majority of 8-byte stores since almost all of them would either have been handled by the fast case or would have the top 32 V bits as zero anyway (almost certainly both).
336c89d : Note that Helgrind and Addrcheck are still busted.
c66077e : Add a note to release notes about GUIs, which some survey responders seemed unaware of.
ee88d28 : Another item for 3.1.0 release notes.
f2383df : add comment from log message

664c859 : Don't test division by zero; 7400 doesn't do what 970/7447 do.
0e5c1ef : Update expected outputs.
fdeaa95 : Another m{t,f}{xer,lr,ctr} simplification.
941051f : Test m{t,f}{xer,lr,ctr} in a simpler way.
e70e7c2 : If we're doing an estimation operation, arrange to zap the bottom byte of the result as it's basically garbage, and differs between cpus.
b05b0dd : Update expected output.

5777862 : Fix this so that it compiles with gcc4 by writing the test fns completely in assembly (for those that require literals to be changed).

2fedc64 : Counterpart to r5202: restore previous assembler state with .previous
2fa01f1 : Add a few missing regtest outputs.
d9fc382 : Hmm. Perhaps all those top-level pieces of assembly weren't such a clever idea. There's no reason to assume the assembler is in .text-mode when it encounters them, and as gcc 2.96 rudely demonstrates, sometimes it isn't. So put .text in front of all of them.
41a7b70 : gcc-2.96 build fixes
7e109d1 : Minor doc tweaks, mostly white space
2c091b8 : Minor QSG tweaks.
a103e14 : comment-only change
1aaadbd : Document PPC32 FP limitations.
96fcfc8 : ppc32: just apply the initial-redirection hack when Memcheck is in use
edf7fc5 : Cleaned up access to 'special purpose' registers.
8f3bc90 : Track valgrind r5196, wrt Non-Java mode
1b6b2b3 : Changed altivec floating point setup to Java/IEEE mode - Non-Java mode is the system default, but was causing some accuracy problems by rounding off intermediate denormalised results to zero. We now have some small errors (lowest bit only) due to using greater accuracy than the system default, but is better overall.
deae6e4 : Patch to workaround borkage with new docbook stylesheets: filename is no longer being passed through to generated docs, but is being replaced with a relative path to the source dir.
37a1fc1 : Yet another ppc32 suppression.
76de5cf : Cleaned up toIR.c somewhat - cleaner extraction of instruction fields, consistent variable names, spaces for tabs, comments++

b67c6ce : wibl
7c68e98 : gcc isn't so hot at reading English text
2683716 : I couldn't resist
09ef408 : copy log message as a comment
55c6e55 : document
b325ad1 : Allocate stack with mmap rather than malloc, so that on ppc32 we get an executable stack.
9ad122b : Change the cannot-detect-cache-config message on PPC32 so we can filter for it more precisely and thus tell if the auto-detection ever fails on x86/AMD64.
54e095f : Enable mq syscalls (untested).
7fd59fc : Fixes to make the .pdf build using the toolchain on SuSE10 (from Donna).
73cf4c6 : Make VG_(apply_StackTrace) stop if it looks like we've overshot main().
d6e91bc : sys_tgkill: hand the syscall to the kernel in the standard way, rather than doing it inline. Doing it inline screws up on ppc32-linux if we're sending an async signal to ourselves (the same thread) because the kernel immediately hands the signal to async_sighandler() which then dies at the assertion that this thread's state is VgTs_WaitSys. From which I conclude this wrapper has always had a race against the kernel which did not show up on x86 or amd64. (and/or that I don't understand this stuff too well)
7f4bd10 : Connect properly to the tgkill wrapper.
89551b3 : This won't work on ppc32 unless you ask for an alt stack with x permissions, since signal returning requires execution of code on the stack.
8e73238 : Get rid of bogus assertion.
4a5223b : Update README_DEVELOPERS to describe how to debug valgrind more easily. Based on patch from Yao Qi <qiyaoltc@cn.ibm.com>.
05e4f8e : Removed vki_ntohs definition and the infrastructure that supported it as it is no longer used.
329af4b : Use VG_(ntohl) and VG_(ntohs) to decode IP addresses and ports. Note that this also required reversing the order of the arguments to the print call as the previous ordering assumed that the address was still byte swapped.
a4a4f41 : Provide a full set of ntohl/htonl/ntohs/htons routines in the valgrind C library.
9e11408 : Kludgey endianness fix (for printing only) to stop fdleak_ipv4 failing on ppc32. I'm sure there's a Right Way to fix it, and this isn't it.
8202204 : Enable sys_lstat on ppc32.

I really have no idea how these work (what's there is a conceptual transcription of what we have for x86-linux) and so if those of you more Skilled In The Art Of Signals than myself would care to peer at it, that would be appreciated.

710099c : wibble
053fe98 : Update manual for 3.1.0, sections <= manual-core.html.
20241ba : Incremented the xml output protocolversion to 2, following the change in the time field format of r5042
376e871 : More detail about pre-release testing.
bfceb08 : Implement SSE2 'clflush'.
bc5948e : delete unused multiply primops
90c524e : Remove horribly out-of-date comment.
2f93288 : Handle some ALSA ioctls that don't have size or direction hints.
f349d55 : In XML mode, emit a closing </valgrindoutput> on various kinds of failures, so as to help parsers stop parsing:
7394b04 : More man page updating, including: - commented out stuff about addrcheck - --log-file no longer puts "pid" in the filename - other minor changes
bb704c3 : Make this test compile on my machine.
4e45eb6 : Enable the prctl system call on amd64.
75ea798 : Separate the stack unwind logic for amd64 and x86, so that they can be differently performance-tuned. amd64 needs to consult CFI first and then if that fails (unlikely) follow the %rbp chain. On x86, the CFI is almost never helpful, but consulting it first wastes significant time in allocation-intensive programs. This commit pulls the two archs apart and puts the CFI check second on x86. This reduces start time for ktuberling on x86 on memcheck from 78 seconds to 75.
1d3cee2 : On amd64, when running allocation-intensive code in the presence of many shared objects, finding the relevant CFI information for stack unwinding becomes a significant performance overhead. This change slowly rearranges the SegInfo list to bring more popular entries to the front during CFI lookup. This reduces the startup time of konqueror on memcheck on amd64 from 124 to 110 seconds.
d125cd5 : Update manual page.
c8cb9d0 : Document sign extension of si_code by the kernel.
05cf1eb : Added tests for altivec load/stores Enabled altivec float tests
f7da610 : gcc4 picked up a typo.

b3eb91b : comment out altivec tests for unsupported insns
f3f173c : More av insns: vmaddfp, vnmsubfp

1f50399 : addition
95458c6 : Preserve the sign of the bottom 16 bits of si_code when discarding the top 16 bits - the pthread library uses negative code values in the signals it sends between threads.

4a68980 : Bug status updates.
2315d18 : Suppress AT_SYSINFO in the auxiliary vector because it contains a pointer to the system call routine in the sysinfo page and older versions of glibc will use it. Fixex bug #115496.

43d6075 : Handle IR primops arising from running Altivec code. It seems Altivec is stronger in the vector integer area than SSE, but weaker in the vector FP area.
1bee561 : Handle instrumentation artefacts arising from memchecking Altivec code. Also, rename a few primops and add another folding rule.
a5ad9ba : Cachegrind was aborting if it hit a client request. Now it doesn't. This fixes #116057, I think. I added a regtest so it won't regress again.
4818d73 : Avoid compiler warnings.
e0008d6 : Call VG_(unknown_SP_update) each time we switch to a new thread. This ensures that current_stack is switched to the new thread's stack so that we don't ignore the next stack update and hence fail to mark memory that should be valid as valid.
de3cf13 : Add some extra debugging to the stack management module and simply it a bit - there is no need to keep a full copy of the current stack descriptor as we can just keep a pointer to it.
e00659d : m_libcsignal is needed here.
9341b18 : Remove redundant conditional - ppc32-linux is already handled.

So I'm still not sure whether this is right or not. Should I just put in a bunch of casts to shut it up, or is it really expecting pointers and not ints?

7a2db47 : Augment a little.
ddce30f : update
1b70e82 : update
592ae09 : Reinstate timestamping, sort-of, having trashed VG_(ctime) as part of the glibc-removal process. Timestamps are now printed in terms of elapsed wallclock time since startup, shown as days, hours, minutes, seconds and milliseconds. The arithmetic is done with 32-bit unsigned ints, so people doing Valgrind runs that last longer than 49.71 days are going to see some funny results :-)
6550519 : Handle the PROT_GROWSDOWN and PROT_GROWSUP mprotect flags properly which stops glibc falling over when a program requires an executable stack and glibc has been built to assume that PROT_GROWSDOWN will work.

7fb9df9 : Allow rax/rbx/rcx/rdx (and their narrower counterparts) to be used again but only after the high registers are exhausted or (and this is the important point) if they are explicitly requested.

121d1d0 : When unwinding the stack on x86/amd64 subtract one from the value of ip before starting a new pass of the loop.

6d7c4f0 : Handle any number of 0x66 (operand-size-override) prefixes.
