5e55f49 : wibble
4fa325a : API change: make the handling of syscall-denoting instructions a bit more general, so as to facilitate handling different combinations of syscall/int more easily.
36e2355 : Generate offsets for all amd64 integer registers.
09f6173 : Don't try to honour the ELF interpreter's load address if it is zero.
ae8bce9 : Split faultstatus into the platform independent tests and those which are x86 specific. The first three x86 specific ones should work on amd64 as well so I have added those as amd64 tests.
b8abe82 : Remove the as_mmap and as_shm tests which don't make much sense since the address space manager was rewritten.
42d6367 : The memcheck/tests/sigprocmask test is designed to test that we handle the old style sigprocmask system call correctly without corrupting memory when we copy out the new (larger) signal mask into the user provided old (smaller) signal mask.
1399c74 : Fix format string in signal mask printing.
f7781e9 : Display signal masks correctly when --trace-signals=yes is used on 64 bit platforms.
81afd4b : Update EXTRA_DIST to include new results files.
770ba3d : Add alternate results for memcheck/tests/strchr on amd64.
c28e3dd : The sloppyRXcheck logic in the sync checker was not correct - it was simply treating R and X as equivalent but the real problem is that mappings can appear to have X permission entirely indepenent of anything else with recent x86 kernels.
8e9cb43 : Removed memcheck/tests/weirdioctl as it is badly broken and seems to serve no useful purpose.
0d15944 : Don't give the heap execute permission - the linux kernel doesn't normally give execute permission to memory allocated from the heap with sbrk.
73aefbb : Update memcheck/tests/xml1 results.
a5aa1b6 : Update memcheck/tests/xml1 results.
069e641 : Make the request for space for the interpreter into a hint so that we can still proceed if the preferred load address is not available.
240fd86 : Implement 66 0F 11 = MOVUPD (untested)
7a26f02 : Reinstate and extend lackey's functionality (a major overhaul), from Jeroen N. Witmond. Thanks for that.
195232b : Fixed test to not assume that malloc(10) will return 10 nul bytes!
4c249ac : update
aedc7c3 : Whitespace only change (test commit to see if auto-mail-on-commit is still working).
163566b : If pdfxmltex bombs, as it so often does, at least cause the build to come to a halt rather than just hanging.
5ec4dd4 : Update.
46c59b1 : Make ULong_width(0) return 1 instead of 1431655765. This stops cachegrind segfaulting if it can't open its output file.
152cb59 : Build fixes following recent coredump hackery.
cf4ac71 : Fix a couple of gcc warnings following recent coredumping changes (r4970).
f4c2310 : Get core dumping working again - the architecture specific code that was in the sigframe module has been moved into the coredump module where it belongs and things fixed up to compiler again.
62d0543 : Tidy up a couple of format strings.
d14c570 : x86 front end: implement in/out insns.
2e9f3f3 : The version string from --version was being printed to stderr. This commit fixes it to print to stdout. I added a regression test for this.
7e45ebf : Trawl through bugzilla/users-list and add various bugs.
a9f538c : Don't assume the first statement is an IRMark, since it could instead be part of a self-check. Instead, copy verbatim any IR preamble preceding the first IMark. This stops cachegrind asserting on self-checking translations.
e98d2c5 : Update bug status information.
40b9ce7 : Enable Altivec by default if it is available.
620eb5b : Handle a few more primops result from running Altivec code.
dc1f913 : Fill in a few missing Altivec cases: - rename Iop_Perm to Iop_Perm8x16 - backend: handle Iop_CmpNEZ8x16 - frontend: for vperm, mask off all irrelevant parts of the steering values
3f21fd3 : Remove inefficient and not-completely-general logic in addHRegUse and replace with something general and simpler.
d147094 : Minor altivec changes: - vsplt{b,h,w}: guarantee to always produce in-range shifts - lvs{l,r}: mask second arg to helper so assertion in helper doesn't fire. Also pass in offset to dest rather than reg #.
24596d8 : Pass args to match format string.
88b7add : Handle SHT_NOBITS sections when checking for section overruns. This fixes a problem where debug info was sometimes not being read on ppc32.
9f63f04 : Document bug #114757.
8bf1c33 : Don't assert if the DWARF line info reader is given so little data that it can't even read the length of the block - just report an error as we do if there isn't enough data for the rest of the block. Fix bug #114757.
50cdb6f : Document bug #114756.
70a5cb0 : Add support for the mbind system call on x86 and amd64. Fixes bug #114756.
69b7291 : Unbreak build.
1d1a226 : Increase the threshold above which new errors are not shown from 300 unique / 30000 total to 1000 unique / 100000 total. Programs are generally bigger now than 3 years ago.
74b4cca : Remove all remaining references to pointercheck. It's sad to see it go, but realistically we can't implement it portably, at least without considerable performance overhead and some additional complexity.
19617ae : The Spin-Doctor arrives in Valgrind-Land: rename --weird-hacks= to --simulation-hints=. Bwaha.
74e3233 : In the spirit of other changes over the past month aimed at supporting monster-sized programs better, increase the default freelist volume from 1M to 5M. Maybe even that is too small.
96f7724 : Oops, un-break cachegrind regtesting following r4951.
5bbef3a : rm the skiplist module, as it has been superseded by the AVL-tree based m_oset module.
c32ba46 : Clarify the P4 warning message a bit.
75553fd : rm unused var
8b43555 : Fix make dist (seems to work, but am unsure if this is the right fix).
20b4a15 : Make the usage message a little neater and more self-consistent.
ce29f37 : Halve the size of the fast tt lookup cache. This improves ppc32 performance quite a bit, since the cache is emptied quite often on ppc32, and a smaller cache is less intrusive in the real machine's L2 cache. On x86 the change doesn't seem to have much effect.
34f042e : Use standard syntax for the rlwinm.
65e1939 : Snap up some easy pickings pointed out by cachegrinding nulgrind on ppc32.
fe0ffd4 : Reenable a couple more syscalls needed for self-hosting on ppc32, which now works.
4ba057c : Change the core-tool interface so that tools are fully aware of both the guest extents for the presented translation and also its original un-redirected guest address. These changes are needed in particular to make cachegrind's code cache management work properly.
f461149 : API change: pass both the VexGuestExtents and the original pre-redirection guest address to instrumentation functions.
6c1bbbb : Add extra auxiliary data structures which make it possible to quickly find and delete all translations intersecting with small address ranges (8 k or less, currently). This makes it possible to simulate ppc32 icbi instructions in reasonable time, and finally makes the ppc32 port run at a usable speed.
cd0309b : Add a new arena (VG_AR_TTAUX) for holding auxiliary TT/TC structures (see next commit).
a1c4bfb : Fix socket stuff on ppc32, so that --log-socket actually works.
09ca09b : augment comment
29acef0 : Removed remaining traces of address space padding technology as it is not longer relevant with the new address space manager.
fd9f622 : A small Cachegrind cleanup: previously it was copying some things (eg. instr_size and instr_addr) into Ir events, then later copying those into instrInfo nodes. Now it just allocates the instrInfo nodes earlier and copies them in directly. This is a bit more concise and easier to understand.
c285dca : Cachegrind cleanups: - Remove some unnecessary assertions. - Add in some new ones. - Make things more concise and readable by factoring out things like "cgs->events[i+1]" into things like "ev2" in flushEvents().
6ce2dd3 : update
c438e08 : Comment-only changes.
d3bef4f : OSet-ified Cachegrind: - The instrInfoTable was a VgHashTable, now it's an OSet. - The CC table was a custom 3-level hash table, now it's an OSet. This is easier to understand and there's no worrying about whether the hash array sizes are big enough. It also has the nice property that the results in the cachegrind.out.<pid> file are now sorted, so they're a bit easier to read.
7cf6658 : Clarify the disInstr message.
0a5dc8e : update roadmap
8a96ec5 : OSet-ify m_redir.c.
746f02c : Fix 'shell' for those lacking '.' in their $PATH, hopefully.
bfb22ad : Filter out line numbers from shell error messages.
31d8342 : Various fixes to reduce noise level on SuSE 10 (PPC). Also fix some ppc32 syscalls.
681b881 : Unfortunately gcc4 doesn't like recently added prototypes. Comment out for the time being.
4f3ef1f : Add comments re loss of pointercheck.
a07dce4 : Add a large comment giving an overview of what it does and how it works.
d2b70dc : Comment-only change: add comments re self-checking translations and self-modifying code.
6e81ea1 : Choose a less-similar variable name when avoiding -Wshadow warnings.
b18cf2b : Avoid two compiler warnings.
03d8aa8 : Get rid of various compilation warnings.
39af548 : Rename a local variable so as to make -Wshadow shut up.
7375061 : Overhaul the way programs are loaded at startup and exec() works. Now the checking of programs done in these two places are combined, which avoids duplicate code and greatly reduces the number of cases in which exec() fails causing Valgrind to bomb out.
0dc0fad : Update bug status.
8f92409 : Use an soname of libc.so* for libc redirects so that we catch a wider range of libc's such as uclibc as well as glibc. Fixes bug 114289.
c1bcf10 : We can print native word sized values sensibly now...
16ff11a : C90 fixes.
f7d2609 : Tiny comment/code layout tweaks; no functional change.
a3a29a5 : Get rid of bbSeenBefore and associated logic: it appears to be irrelevant.
ae986ca : Build fixes for gcc-2.96. The system now builds and regtests with the default gcc-2.96 on Red Hat 7.3.
197bd17 : Build fixes for gcc-2.96 (which does not allow declarations after the first statement in a block).
e9814c3 : Correct variable name.
1e94668 : Only add -Wdeclaration-after-statement if the compiler supports it.
3786772 : Notify the tool via tool_discard_basic_block_info() about translations thrown away due to lack of space.
d456196 : Fix x86 specific declaration-before-statement warnings.
60a4b0b : Fix statement-before-declaration warnings for the core code.
d1dce84 : Add -Wdeclaration-after-statement to the compiler flags so we can catch code that will fail on older compilers.
20edebf : rm trigram stuff.
5155dec : Redo the way cachegrind generates instrumentation code, so that it can deal with any IR that happens to show up. This makes it work on ppc32 and should fix occasionally-reported bugs on x86/amd64 where it bombs due to having to deal with multiple date references in a single instruction.
0b6941e : ppc32 only: give debug info names for a couple of fns to make cachegrind profiles more understandable.
aa34929 : Make sync checking work on recent x86 kernels (eg SuSE 10) which mark many 'r' sections also as 'x' because x86 can't really distinguish them. The change just regards 'x' and 'r' as equivalent on x86. Checking on ppc32/amd64 is unchanged.
e73a243 : update
0103de5 : Convert some native types to our types.
b619ca7 : Update cache simulator for 64 bit addresses. This probably won't have caused many inaccuracies so far because it only matters if addresses above the 4GB line are used. Thanks to Josef W for the patch.
15a6563 : clarify self-hosting instructions
585b8b3 : Document self-hosting.
dfb1144 : Handle the out-of-range shift cases for slw/srw in a different way which creates less IR and fewer insns at the back end. Worth about 2% running bzip2 -d with --tool=none.
21d223c : update
9d540e5 : Enable chasing of unconditional branches and calls.
d84f467 : ppc32-linux: reinstate sys_fsync, sys_sched_setscheduler
21ccba8 : Make --log-socket= work on ppc32.
249ebd7 : ppc32-linux: handle sys_madvise.
48db0f0 : Enable sys_ftruncate64 on ppc32.
a9e62a9 : ppc32 only: improve handling of CmpORD32S, so as to avoid false positives from ppc code of the form "cmpi %reg,0 ; branch-if-negative .." where the top bit of %reg is defined but not all of the other bits are (common-ish enough to cause a considerable number of false positives if not done right).
5f3a998 : Disable ppc32 altivec pro tem (just temporarily).
992dff9 : Fix the handling of CmpORD32{S,U} which was completely bogus and would have caused ppc32 to miss many uninitialised value errors. (Change affects ppc32 only).
aaddbc2 : Fix a memcheck anomaly observed by Nick: lazy propagation of undefinedness was not being done properly for scalar shifts and that could have led to undefined-value errors being falsely reported in the obscure case where the shift amount was undefined but the end result of the shift was unused. This commit handles shifts more in accordance with the maximally-lazy V-bit-testing scheme used by the rest of memcheck.
26b3320 : Special-case rlwnms which are really slwi or srwi. This gives about 1% translated code size improvement for run-of-the-mill integer code.
8162371 : Add a comment about Memcheck not doing anything for mprotect.
fe37f19 : Fix expected output.
89c7965 : Clarify FAQ and Java and JITs.
dde37b4 : Added an FAQ about Java.
8e5963d : When looking for a heap segment to extend look for the heap limit address rather than the base address as the heap may have been split into more than one segment by using mprotect on it...
a994db9 : Document memalign fix.
8af1a17 : Stop memalign crashing if it fails to allocate the memory. Bug 112538.
75d7ad9 : The amd64 BOUND bug turned out to be bogus.
cbadeb3 : Document realloc fix.
0cd42f0 : Fix realloc wrappers to handle the out of memory case properly - if the call to VG_(cli_malloc) returns NULL then don't try and copy the data or register a new block and just leave the old block in place instead, but still return NULL to the caller.
0fd92f4 : Changed some overflow-prone counters from UInt to ULong.
ce5a566 : The m_syswrap subsystem is Valgrind's model of how the kernel behaves with respect to syscalls. It is detailed and comprehensive but does not offer a way to deal with minor deviations in behaviour from the vanilla kernel sources, either due to running a hacked kernel or running a vanilla kernel with a custom kernel module loaded.
616cf59 : Adjustments to the sync-checker:
fad54d7 : Update.

a7690fb : Handle BT/BTS/BTR/BTC at size 4 as well as 8.

3ed7230 : Document fix for 112031.
98e68a4 : If the launcher can't figure out what it's own name is, don't bail out. Instead, print a warning message, continue, and cause any attempt to trace into a child process to fail with ECHILD.

4255206 : Document fix for 113642.
50d01ab : Make sure we have all the DWARF2 sections before trying to decode any DWARF2 debug information. All make sure we don't fall over if the .debug_info is less than four bytes long. Fixed bug 113642.
4c69088 : Document bug 113796.
1340c35 : Create a new SkShmC segment type for shared memory segments so that we can ensure they are never merged with adjacent segments. This makes sure that we can find the right piece of memory to release when the shmdt system call occurs.
aa55dca : Check permissions when sanity checking the segment list against the kernel's memory map.
f61fea0 : Get the SHM_RDONLY test the right way round. Fixes bug #113796.

260667d : A corresponding fix to 4823: don't deal with MAP_FIXED case directly here; instead uniformly pass all requests to VG_(am_get_advisory), so that layout policy is controlled from one place only.
d5560ec : Changes to sys_mmap2 wrapper:
a911677 : Future-proof a piece of conditional compilation.
97a649d : On x86 and ppc32 the offset argument to mmap2 is specified in pages not bytes. This is a horrible kludge of a fix and it should probably be fixed properly with a separate sys_mmap for amd64.
caf971d : Fix a very stupid bug in the new aspacemgr, in which mmap "hint-style" requests were being granted at the requested address when they should not have been. This was causing ppc32-linux to crash at startup (since the wrongly-granted mapping annihilated 5 others). This shows the value of a multiplatform approach -- the bug applies to all targets, yet x86 and amd64 appeared to work perfectly.
a48a493 : Make ppc32-linux build again following aspacem merge. Doesn't work, though: programs crash before reaching main. I don't know why.

e810c19 : Enhance the dead-code removal pass so that it detects unconditional side exits and deletes all code after them. This helps clean up the IR created by {l,st}sw{i,x} from the ppc32 front end. It's also a general transformation which ought to have been implemented long ago.

7ce8311 : Fix a problem I introduced in r4208 when reducing the space used by heap blocks. The minimum size for redzones is now sizeof(void*), but I forgot to ensure this. Massif was asking for 0 byte redzones, and this was screwing things up on 64-bit platforms, and Massif was dying very quickly. This should fix bugs #111090 and #111285.

4775c42 : Make "silly arg" message 64-bit clean.
87452d6 : Update.
4857d4f : Enable testing of RCL insns.
2eef773 : Support x86 RCL instructions.
33d17fa : Even more ppc32 syscalls.
6a64a9f : On a PPC32Instr_Call, don't merely record how many integer registers carry parameters. Instead record the actual identities of such registers in a bitmask. This is necessary because the PPC calling conventions have "holes" in the register ranges. For example, a routine taking an UInt(32-bit) first param and an ULong(64-bit) second param passes the first arg in r3 but the second one in r5 and r6, and r4 is not used.
5598ef9 : Make sure vex_svnversion.h is updated after an svn update and declare the libvex.a target as phone to ensure that we always try and rebuild it in case there have been changed in the VEX code.
04bf3af : Update ignore lists.
a07574a : Update bug status.
f7e9d87 : Suppress memory leaks from the linuxthread manager thread. Bug #111006.
deb0f0f : Add suppressions for some glibc 2.2 linuxthreads issues. Bug #111006.
59b559a : make it work for SL10
64ab429 : rm now-redundant macros.
acaec5f : Incorporate a patch from Craig Chaney which gives better stack snapshots on ppc32-linux in the presence of functions subject to leaf-function optimisations.
a9fff9b : Enable a few more syscalls on ppc32-linux.
b1e123a : Fix signedness-of-char problem which caused this to segfault on ppc32-linux.
db1aa22 : update
60beca1 : - Fix bug causing thread slots not to get reused - yet more syscalls on ppc32
02392cd : update
7da2a8f : update
f17c0ed : update
36c0c29 : update
5addd6c : Enable a couple more syscalls on ppc32.
721f2c8 : Make show_segments() public, and use it when VG_(get_memory_from_mmap)() fails. This might help debugging.
966d663 : Make it possible to match against "???" line in suppressions, using "obj:*" or "fun:*". Also generate "obj:*" for such lines with --gen-suppressions. Includes a regtest.
aac88d5 : vki_stat64 as defined in the 2.6.10 sources looks significantly different from our rendition, so update the latter.
ad50be3 : The strlen that ld.so uses on ppc32 causes a lot of false errors in memcheck, and they are hard to get rid of and hard to suppress. So add a bootstrap strlen function and redirect to it right from the start. This fn only replaces the strlen in ld.so; the "normal" redirect mechanism still replaces the strlen that glibc supplies.
c808ef7 : Add tested but unused code just in case it is useful at some point in the future: a potentially more memcheck-friendly implementation of count-leading-zeroes.
aa260e8 : Added VG_(OSet_LookupWithCmp)(), which can be useful.
e6c1403 : Bug status updates.
5496c30 : Pass AM_CFLAGS to the compiler when extracting the default linker script so we are sure to get the 32 bit version when appropriate.
088bfb4 : Partial implementation of mallinfo(). It still puts zero in all the fields, but all the plumbing is now there so that m_mallocfree.c can fill them in.

0684dd4 : wibbles
f66dbfc : Whoops... I guess the regtests don't exercise that code...
1d0cb0d : Something I realised recently: in C, iterators are much better than higher-order functions for traversing data structures. The higher-order approach is too clumsy due to the lack of polymorphism and closures; you have to use void* too much and it is more verbose than it should be.
1d68e53 : wibble
6db3470 : Trim some fat; removing this assertion makes Remove() about 5% faster.
7b880bc : Add a thorough unit test for m_oset. Note that this is Memcheck testing code that's part of Valgrind, which is a good thing.
b6979de : Forgot this file.
e1b2b96 : Added new module, m_oset, which provides a generic data structure, OSet, which is a sorted set with no duplicates. This is derived from m_skiplist, which it will hopefully replace. The interface has the following improvements:

246a9d2 : Changed many, but not all, of the VgHashNode* parameters and return types in m_hashtable.c to void*. This requires no changes to code already using VgHashTables, but it allows some previously-required casts to be removed. I also changed Memcheck and Massif by removing some of these now-unnecessary casts.

b3507ea : Fixed a bug in Cachegrind: it was adding instrumentation after conditional jumps, so if those jumps were taken, the instrumentation wasn't executed. This was causing the I-cache access counts to be underestimated.
2bd97d1 : Implement 0xA0 /* MOV Ob,AL */ and 0xA2 /* MOV AL,Ob */.

50b8f77 : "Fix" (kludge) highly obscure bug in flag settings for growdown stacks which manifested itself as unreliable behaviour with --smc-check=stack. The accompanying comment explains.
dbcfae7 : Make copyright notices consistent.
a43a651 : Update this-cpu-not-supported message.
7be5509 : When identifying stacks so as to decide whether or not to make a self checking translation in the case --smc-check=stack (the default), don't use SF_GROWDOWN as an indication of stackness, since that only is set for the main stack. Instead establish whether code is being taken from a stack by seeing if the requesting thread's stack pointer points into the same area that the translation is being taken from.

08551a7 : Never ever delete vex_svnversion.h except when doing 'make version'. Purpose is so that 'make distclean' or 'make clean' in a tarball'd build do not delete it, and so do not render the tree unbuildable.

85a9dca : Makefile stuff, partly from Tom, which uses the SVN-externall'd VEX tree a bit better. Also, fixes to make 'make dist' include into the final tarball a minimal but workable subset of the stuff in the VEX directory.
f5ceb82 : Property change: list svn://svn.valgrind.org/vex/trunk as an SVN external to be checked out into ./VEX
afc0bfd : Don't delete vex_svnversion.h during 'make clean'. This causes breakage if someone builds from the final V tarball, then does 'make clean', then re-runs make -- because creating this file requires (1) svnversion to be present on the end-user system, which it probably isn't, and (2) the metadata which svnversion consults also to be present here, which it certainly isn't [in the cut-down VEX image in the distro tarball.]

b9c7c79 : bugfixes and improvements
3448a1c : Don't claim that the --single-step= and --optimise= flags exist any more. They have been replaced by --vex-guest-max-insns= and the --vex-iropt-* flags.
33e6042 : Rename tags in XML <status> block.

7906958 : Replace a bunch of useless memory-to-memory copies with some highly predictable branches.
9053d22 : Reenable an ADC variant.
e75d157 : When canonicalising CFI information, truncate overlapping address ranges and remove zero-length entries. If these appear it's because the generating compiler has created invalid CFI info. Nevertheless we should handle this robustly. This fixes a bug reported by Bill Hoover.
41c0109 : Implement ADC Ib, AL.
a32ad6b : Enable RCR tests.
112b099 : An appallingly inefficient, but correct, implementation of rcr. On x86, rcr is a dog. On amd64 it is a mangy dog with fleas on.
98e9f34 : Implement bswapq %reg. Generates pretty verbose code, but it works.

a514661 : Enable rt_sigpending on amd64. Fixes bug #109429.
6fa6bf1 : Fix XER.OV computation after multiply.
0e88d8f : Fix very stupid bug in my mtxer implementation. The relevant IRStmts would work better (viz, at all :-) if they were added to the IR code list after being created, instead of merely being dropped down the back of the fridge.
10e1beb : Add some more intercept rules for ld.so on amd64.
20ef547 : Do all ppc32 flag calculations in-line, partly for performance reasons and partly to try and avoid confusing memcheck so much.
265eb5c : Allow negative sizes for structure members in stabs. Fixed bug #109385.
bc21094 : Implement STC/CLC/CMC, and take the opportunity to make PUSHFL work a bit more like how the hardware does.
07720f3 : Handle a 'd' stab that indicates a file in pascal. Fixes bug #89914.
b9b10c7 : Make VG_(kill_self) use kill to send the signal, not tkill, as we are sending it to the whole process not a single thread.
d8d0ad2 : Handle stabs builtin type -30 (wide characters, 16 bit unsigned).
b0987f0 : Document different argument order for clone on amd64.
e7203a8 : Bring the vki_sigevent_t definition into line with current kernels.
f38dad9 : Move config.h inclusion from pub_tool_basics.h to pub_core_basics.h so it's not seen by external tools. This was requested by Josef W.
7a06b85 : Implement SBB Ev,Gv.
6359f81 : Implement LOOP disp8 (0xE2).
67c5364 : The timeout argument to rt_sigtimedwait is in the third argument not the fourth, plus linux allows it to be null.
1b1a223 : More system call fixups.
c8b2635 : Implement F3 90 (rep nop).
507ae56 : Yet more amd64 system calls.
6cb1804 : Update ignore list.
8bc8582 : Add a CPUID case, thanks to Josef W.
7b1a6a4 : Change textwidth, and also add a note about the shortcomings when running 32 bit processes on 64 bit machines.
8d3f845 : This commit reduces the overhead of each heap allocation done by Valgrind's allocator, by overlapping the redzones (used when blocks are in-use) with the prev/next ptrs (used when they are free). This reduces the overhead for a heap block allocated by the core from 32B to 16B on 32 bit machines, and from 48B to 32B on 64 bit machines.
483398e : Fix broken tests.
c8ec9f8 : Recategorise some options in the usage message.
49b45ba : Reinstate stack trace printing on assertion failures. It's terrible for the module dependency graph, but it's very useful.
005b4ef : Specialise NZ after ANDL/ORL/XORL. This fixes #109314.
3f81c4e : Add some specialisation rules which are ultimately helpful in reduce memcheck's false-error rate on inlined strlen and related nasties.
22cab06 : Make ADC Ev,Gv work.
4a9f6f4 : Make a first cut at the 3.0.0 release notes.
49ef544 : The devil's in the details ..
b33fc68 : Fix mistaken comments.
2b18aa8 : Pass clone arguments in the correct order when doing a fork style clone. This should fix bug #109358.
4c9c80d : Enable sched_yield on amd64. Fixes bug #109362.
10c4b52 : Return success when get_thread_area succeeds.
c8c3a85 : Add a makefile for the new documentation directory to avoid errors when make tries to recurse into it.
f2dab38 : Support ARCH_GET_FS with arch_prctl on amd64.
f7c00b1 : We have a nice little collection of text files describing various high level things. But they're all over the place. This commits moves them all to the new docs/internals/ directory, and gives them a consistent naming scheme.
0da7ac6 : Get Addrcheck closer to compiling. It's still a long way from working, though.

e4fed1c : Make attaching a debugger work on amd64.

e5e1f82 : Oops; forgot to update spec
768db0e : New command line option: --xml-user-comment=XMLTEXT, which allows copying of arbitrary bits of XML text to the XML output.
daf77af : New printf format specifier %t, which is like %s but escapes XML-unfriendly chars and thereby helps in the construction of valid XML output.
c55ad8c : Fix the mmap2 pre-handler to avoid corrupting the arguments when it fails with ENOMEM due to a lack of memory.
b8a3dac : Show Valgrind's args too in the XML output.
68cde6f : Add time stamps to XML START/FINISH indications.
a11553a : Move the code for generating a human-readable time string into its own function.
ad31116 : New command line option: --log-file-qualifier=VAR. When specified, the contents of environment variable VAR (viz, $VAR) are incorporated into logfile names. This makes it easy to incorporate environmental information into logfile names.
109e935 : iselCondCode: handle literals.
32327ec : Add some assertions.

13696cc : Fix crash when no environment is given to execve.
92098db : Check members of the stack_t structure passed to sigaltstack individually to avoid problems with padding on 64 bit platforms.
b9fef19 : Check each member of the ifconf structure passed to SIOCGIFCONF individually to avoid problems with padding bytes on 64 bit platforms.
56e1c84 : Check each field of the msghdr structure passed to sendmsg/recvmsg individually to avoid complaints due to uninitialised padding bytes on 64 bit platforms.
5c4643a : Update svn:ignore lists.
d6dd991 : If the client program is a PIE executable, avoid mapping it at address zero. Instead do something like what the kernel does and map it in the middle of the client address space.
1110699 : add comment
4e13695 : Take a copy of the environment given to execve before trying to mangle it as it might be in read only memory. Fixes bug #101881.
68884ef : Add a folding rule for 1Sto16.
d45b446 : Handle 0 :: Ity_I1 as well as 1 :: Ity_I1.
d655564 : Handle the BLKGETSIZE64 ioctl. Fixes bug #104797.
f5d62be : Preserve %esi across VG_(clone) as the caller may be relying on it not being changed. Fix to bug #106713.
463b3d9 : Track API changes in vex r1272.
feacf14 : Fix up linking/relocation a bit, and track API changes in r1272.
5e0274d : Track API changes in r1272.
b51f0f4 : Some changes to the ppc32 compilation pipeline, with two aims:
18f1927 : Allow a NULL argument to the times system call. Fixes bug #103509.
16ade0d : Fixed debug code so that it compiles and fixed a printf to report the start and end as (apparently) intended.
5912dd7 : Consider blocks with both SF_MMAP and SF_STACK set as part of the root memory set as any additional stack space allocated by valgrind will have both flags set. This fixes bug #106293.
db247dc : tweak
089f51f : Introduced get_pszB() to cover several common cases.
e6f9e3b : tweaks
d0e685c : Introduce get_bszB() and get_bszB_as_is() to factor out some common combinations of function calls.
472cc7c : Replace is_inuse_bszB() with is_inuse_block(), which is higher-level and thus makes the code that uses it easier to understand.
a257865 : Rename 'other' as 'other_b' to make the fact it's a block more clear.
641e616 : Make VG_(percentify)() cope if the denominator is zero.
7a5915e : Fix comments.
37b71bf : Fix build breakage.
3965520 : xml output for tool=none is fine too.
6271eb9 : Fixed bug #88678 -- debug info is now correctly gathered for files containing spaces.
b0eb66e : Remove dead code.
5cf7791 : Remove very old info about the CVS repo at Sourceforge.
6c90209 : Get rid of endianness assumptions in the PRRAn macro, which is important for doing checks of scalar syscall args.
6e340c7 : Clean up endianness macros a bit. Now pub_tool_basics.h defines VG_LITTLEENDIAN or VG_BIGENDIAN and that's what should be used.
9680ed9 : Fix up ppc32-linux stack unwinding.
162bebd : Add comments from PaulM.
78164b9 : Another seemingly-small but critical change imported from 2.4.0-ppc: don't read symbols from sections with w permissions. For some reason ppc-linux maps executables three times, not twice as on x86, and if the w flag is ignored, we wind up reading debug info twice, getting wrong redirections, and then it all goes to hell in a handbasket.
8ea6771 : Implement 8-byte-transfer cases for lwsi and stswi.
e1c444e : Import sigframe stuff from Paul's tree. With this and the other changes today, it's possible to run bash on ppc32-linux.
72dc4ce : Oops, this really should have been part of r4136.
b865b16 : Fix/reinstate a whole bunch of syscalls.
ce2a615 : Assertion-failure-avoiding hacks from Paul's tree. I don't know why these are necessary, but they are.
d714d2e : A longer gdb-attach delay for ppc
13ac35b : Check the obvious ..
900f6b5 : Added LibVEX_GuestPPC32_put_cr7(), LibVEX_GuestPPC32_put_cr()
51900a2 : Added LibVEX_GuestPPC32_get_cr() for easy access to entire cond reg Filled in some missing defaults in LibVEX_GuestPPC32_initialise()
8d61eb1 : Comment wibble.
97ad9ab : Don't bomb cachegrind at startup.
9828b34 : Add a simple random number generator to m_libcbase so we don't have to use the one from glibc.
8cf88b7 : Create and use bigendian versions of MC_(helperc_{LOAD,STORE}V{2,4,8}). This involved some serious nastyness from the Department of Cpp Abuse.
a932d29 : Enable a couple more syscalls.
b1b2a35 : Add a nested-functions test from Lee Kindness.
0bfc6b6 : My life is one endless stream of small things which don't quite work. This time it's gcc giving us an instruction with REX.W redundantly set to 1.
447f2a1 : Don't allow vex to chase into any block for which we might want to create a self-checking translation.
c24824a : Comment-only-change: record subtle interactions between self-checks and bb chasing.
42a65c9 : Self-modifying-code check for amd64.
e8aaa87 : Fix bits and pieces needed to make self-checking-translations work on amd64.
16a403b : Tidy up some loose ends in the self-checking-translations machinery, and unroll the adler32 loop in a not-very-successful attempt to reduce the overhead of checking.
4daf439 : Update expected output.
8c30ec2 : Modify this test so it no longer uses client requests, but instead relies on --smc-support=all to work correctly. Hence it tests the s-m-c support at least on x86. Jump through various hoops to defeat vex's basic-block-chasing optimisation, which has an annoying habit of making this test work correctly even without --smc-support=all.
26412bd : Support for self modifying code on unfriendly platforms (x86, amd64) via the use of self-checking translations. (Friendly platforms which have icache-invalidation instructions we can observe, such as ppc32, are already handled correctly.) This should finally fix the longstanding problem of V incorrectly handling calls of statically nested functions (a gcc extension), and more generally make it a lot easier to use V to debug dynamic code generation systems.
ec3c885 : Make LibVEX_Translate (an API fn) take a Bool indicating whether or not a self-checking translation has been requested.
c1aff95 : rm unused code
db4738a : Basic support for self-checking translations. It fits quite neatly into the IR: if a translation self-check fails, the translation exits passing VEX_TRC_JMP_TINVAL to the despatcher and with the guest_TISTART/guest_TILEN pseudo-registers indicating what area of the guest code needs to be invalidated. The actual checksumming is done by a helper function which does (a variant of) the Adler32 checksum.
4f38bd9 : This is x86 specific; re-home accordingly.
937411f : smc1 is an x86-specific test; re-home it accordingly. (How did this one evade detection for so long?)
21f7f0c : --time-stamp=yes is incompatible with --xml=yes, at least for the moment.
151b90d : Scan the entire BB looking for "bogus literals"* before instrumenting any of it, so as to avoid any problems arising from switching from one scheme to the other half-way through.
16031ba : Add a regression test for memcheck's ability do deal with partially defined operands in equality comparisons.
e6f8af4 : Extensively re-analyse, re-check and revise the scheme for expensive handling of integer EQ/NE, which can sometimes do better than the naive scheme when the inputs are partially defined. I never was convinced it was correct before, but now I am. Regtest to follow.
3c45f5b : Rename VG_(get_obj)() as VG_(find_seginfo) to be more consistent with the other function names.
7b781b5 : This test is nonsensical for ppc; it only applies to x86 and amd64.
5d7ae0d : Define the system call numbers for pread64 and pwrite64.
a27cfc4 : Keep older versions of gcc (3.0.4) happy.
b2112c1 : Enable some more amd64 syscalls.
4f08a65 : Sort out the mess that is pread64/pwrite64 properly. All three platforms that we currently support use the same handlers in the kernel without any platform specific wrappers.
1936d8d : set default fpu, altivec control words in dispatch-ppc.S (both zero)
64c00da : Disable PIE by default (sorry Tom), even on PIE-enabled platforms. It causes too much breakage. PIE builds are still possible, but you have to say --enable-pie to get them now.

1bad800 : Add a test script (recycled version of Tom's nightly/bin/nightly) which is useful for doing automated test runs against the GNU Scientific Library v 1.6 (gsl-1.6). This has proven very helpful in shaking out Vex simulation bugs.

8253ad3 : Implement fcmovu/fcmovnu. gcc-4.0.1 -msse2 -ftree-vectorize generates them.
d4d3dd6 : Add some casts.
7d7f1b6 : A further hack to reduce ppc32 reg-alloc costs: don't give the regalloc so many registers to play with. In the majority of cases it won't be able to make much use of vast hordes of FP and Altivec registers anyway.
ee7d228 : Fix (well, ameliorate, at least) some lurking performance problems (time taken to do register allocation, not quality of result) which were tolerable when allocating for x86/amd64 but got bad when dealing with ppc-ish numbers of real registers (90 ish).

9e6491a : The logic that drove basic block to IR disassembly had been duplicated over the 3 front ends (x86, amd64, ppc32). Given the need to take into account basic block chasing, adding of instruction marks, etc, the logic is not completely straightforward, and so commoning it up is a good thing.

e074506 : Track Vex API change in r1233 (VexSubArch -> VexArchInfo).
27e1dd6 : (API-visible change): generalise the VexSubArch idea. Everywhere where a VexSubArch was previously passed around, a VexArchInfo is now passed around. This is a struct which carries more details about any given architecture and in particular gives a clean way to pass around info about PPC cache line sizes, which is needed for guest-side PPC.

This will be fixed.

d9774d7 : Improve handling of inlined strlen on amd64 by using the expensive mode for 64 bit add and subtract operations when the bogus literals flags is set and by adding two new constants to the list of bogus literals.
9450d24 : While we're not printing stacktraces from assertion failures, might as well disable pp_sched_status() -- which produces traces that are less useful than the main one that has been disabled -- and break the circular dependence between m_libcassert and m_threadstate.
2025cf9 : Break up VG_(show_BB_profile)(), and move half of it into m_main. This removes m_transtab's dependence on m_translate (breaking a circular dependence) and m_debuginfo, hooray.
856c54e : Combine the percentify() functions from Cachegrind and m_transtab into a single more general one exported from m_libcprint.

310ed28 : Simplify atfork to only provide the functionality we need.

47167fd : Killed --libc option -- can be achieved with --hide.
07112e4 : Fix 32-bit-ish looking assumption.
d9109c6 : Cleaned up m_redir.c: renamed some variables and functions, added some comments, neatened the debugging output, avoided unexpected side-effects in functions, tweaked code to make it clearer.
0787fc0 : If read_lib_symbols() fails, once again discard the SegInfo. And some other minor cleanups.
1047c64 : Allow multiple module names per --hide option.
88c5148 : Made m_debuginfo not depend on m_aspacemgr, breaking the direct circular dependence between them. (There's still an indirect one via m_libcmman.)
4f612c2 : Avoid m_redir.c importing priv_symtab.h.
41f8e4a : Remove unneeded cases from match_lib.
5953c10 : avoid compiler warning
d9e5fd7 : Rename functions to make the type involved clearer.
6081fce : Make the is_stage2 test work when running Valgrind in-place in a source tree.
0d74162 : Remove the Segment back-pointer from SegInfo. The only place it was being used was in resolve_redir(), and due to the way resolve_redir() is called, the involved test was always failing anyway. So we lose nothing by removing it except some complexity -- there is no longer a circularity between Segments and SegInfos.
0151588 : Do not print backtraces in assertion failures. This is an as-yet unsuccessful attempt to remove m_libcassert from the huge cycle which most of the modules currently live in.
bc32e82 : Added some more targets to the docs. Removed 'the' from 'the default' in 'parial' opt to be consistent Added opt info for --avoid-strlen-errors (was missing)
abbf59d : A small program to read .dot files created by auxprogs/gen-mdg and compute the strongly connected components in them.
b69f7c1 : Moved the mman VG_(*_native)() functions into m_aspacemgr, and removed the unused init_shadow_page() function. As a result, m_aspacemgr no longer depends on m_libcmman, breaking a circular module dependency, good!
40e7358 : Fix bug #107524 -- epoll_ctl does not access 'events' if it's a EPOLL_CTL_DEL invocation.
6140074 : Remove out-of-date comments.
508aef5 : Enabled a bunch more syscalls A few simple progs make it through memcheck now - bzip2, gzip, xfontsel

c7e1071 : "make dist" fixes from Ralf Wildenhues.
6b30d85 : fixed sign-extension bug for branches
945ed2e : Moved Robert's stack tracking code out of m_aspacemgr into a new module m_stacks, because it's a nicely distinct and stand-alone piece of functionality. This happily removes m_aspacemgr's dependence on m_mallocfree (there was an apparent dependence due to the #include, even if it didn't manifest itself in practice -- very important!) and m_options (not so important).

9762bbf : Fix ppc32 'Call' bug - was (very) incorrectly jumping over the call on cond failure
7b2c38c : VG_() -> ML() for ppc32, amd64 (plus a few scattered ones in comments etc)
af839f5 : Removed the VGA_/VGO_/VGP_ prefixes for arch/OS/platform-specific things. These made sense when the arch/OS/platform-specific code was in one module, but as that code got mixed in with generic code the boundary between generic and non-generic blurred, and the distinction made less sense. So let's get rid of them.
f845f8f : Removed some repetition in the way VG_(record_fd_open)() is called. As part of this, VG_(resolve_filename)() no longer calls VG_(malloc)() and so m_libcfile no longer depends on m_mallocfree.
7eb7c58 : For symbols which have C-level global scope but which we regard as module-local, use the new ML_ prefix instead of VG_. This makes it trivial to see which names are those exported from public module interfaces: precisely those using VG_.
ae71dd4 : argh! there were loads of the little beggars ....
3c3d5a4 : Removed ante-deluvian file
d0ef55f : I forgot to remove this a while back.
3a08815 : Declare my_sigreturn as static. This is correct in so much as it isn't used anywhere else, but it does cause gcc to issue a warning because it doesn't realised that the assembly code has defined the function.
57ca7ab : Remove VG_(getcwd_alloc)(), which can be done otherwise pretty easily. This halves m_libcfile's dependence on m_mallocfree.
1727cc8 : Make search_all_symtabs() work in the same way as search_all_loctabs() and search_all_scopetabs(), ie. search through SegInfos instead of Segments. This reduces m_debuginfo's dependency on m_aspacemgr.
62ff0f2 : Added VG_() prefixes to functions exported from m_ume to avoid namespace pollution.
08a2e17 : Rename ume.c/ume.h as m_ume.c/pub_core_ume.h to be consistent with all the other modules.
06244e7 : Move VG_(resume_scheduler) to m_signals, and make it local. Reduces m_signals' dependence on m_scheduler.
351d006 : Move VKI_SIGVGKILL and VKI_SIGVGRTUSERMAX out of vki-linux.h since they're not really from the kernel and they're defined in terms of VG_(max_signal), which is in m_signals. Renamed them with the VG_ prefix too, since they're now not part of the kernel interface.

487ac70 : Fix bug causing TINVALs to throw away huge numbers of translations unnecessarily.

b506bd8 : Moved VG_(first_matching_thread_stack), removing m_threadstate's dependency on m_machine.
419bbcb : Slight reduce m_syswrap's dependence on m_signals by moving VG_(client_signal_OK)().
748ace4 : Remove redundancy.
eb0daa3 : Attempt to fix the stage2.lds borkage.
fc51f8d : Malloc replacement worked very much like a 'need', but wasn't one. I've changed it so it now is, which makes it consistent with the other 'needs'. Because of this, I was also able to invert the dependence between m_mallocfree and m_tooliface, which is related to setting the redzone size for client heap blocks. As a result, m_tooliface now doesn't depend on anything except pub_core_basics.h, hooray!
64c8324 : Tweaked m_tooliface to reduce its dependencies on other things:
b9bce63 : Simplify the implementation of m_trampoline and the stuff that refers to it. Now there are no more offsets and no copying of code into the stack. We just redirect directly to entry points in m_syscalls.S.
d0d7c1f : Don't #include pub_core_stacktrace.h in pub_core_execontext.h. So a few places have to #include pub_core_stacktrace.h themselves, but that's ok because explicit is better.
3756925 : turn off debugging output
899ce73 : Don't #include pub_core_debuginfo.h in pub_core_aspacemgr.h. So have to #include it explicitly in lots of other places, but at least the dependency is clear now.
3ced4ce : Move typedef to a better spot.
e070c20 : Tweak comments and remove an unnecessary #include.
e5c600e : Although it doesn't actually matter from a generated-code point of view, it doesn't make much sense for the args to VG_(mk_SysRes_{x86,amd64}_linux) to be stated as unsigned; therefore make them signed.

ed623db : guest-ppc32 ~~~~~~~~~~ - store-with-update instrs: Valgrind pagefault handler expects faulting address >= current stack ptr, so we need to update the stack ptr register _before_ storing the old stack ptr - branch_ctr_ok (bad calc for 'branch if %ctr zero' case) - mcrf: scanning bitfields in the wrong direction - on spotting the magic sequence, delta += 24 - updated DIPs for +ve-only args

75b65aa : Moved VG_(start_debugger) out of m_main.c into its own module, m_debugger. This removes the dependence of m_signals.c and m_errormgr.c on m_main.c. It required also moving VG_(clexecfd) out of m_main.c; I put it in m_libcproc.c which seemed like an ok-but-not-great choice.

6676d5b : Move VG_(sanity_check_general) out of m_main.c into scheduler.c. Removes the dependence of m_scheduler/ on m_main.c; reduces the dependence of m_signals.c on m_main.c.

d804ab8 : Fix AMD64 build.
fbd78b2 : Get rid of the ELFSZ define, which is created at the configure stage and use VG_WORDSIZE, as that is used everywhere else.
8340749 : Removed dependency on <sys/mman.h> by using our own versions of mmap/munmap. Required making VG_(munmap_native) public.
f844cb6 : Add a comment.
4b0c071 : Un-break the build on SuSE 9.1 (x86). It seems that something in <fcntl.h> messes up stuff acquired indirectly from vki-x86-linux.h. This fix is therefore a kludge; it merely puts our defines ahead of the glibc ones. The right solution is to entirely remove the glibc dependency.
909c319 : Don't #include <sys/stat.h>, which was causing problems due to it redefining certain names which clashed with field names in vki*.h. There are plenty more glibc-isms that can be removed from m_main.c.
dcc99d3 : Fixed a bug in .valgrindrc reading I introduced recently -- freeing memory I should not have.
3f7e911 : Get "make dist" closer to working again.
136b83b : In m_redir.c, no longer need to handle the case of redirection to a symbol -- we always redirect to a specific address. This simplifies things a bit.

39cc735 : Handle Clz64 and Ctz64.
6743b7c : Disable debugging printing. Duh.
726baec : More CFI-reader hacking. Thus far the reader has assumed that each FDE refers to the immediately preceding CIE, and gives up if that isn't so. Well, that isn't so, and this commit fixes it. Now FDEs may refer to CIEs seen arbitrarily far back. This fixes some missing stack traces on AMD64.
f25e902 : Move some #define-d constants into the VKI department, where I should have put them in the first place.
aba741d : Increase the number of auxmaps from 500 to 20000. This should be enough to cover 1.25GB of auxiliary address space. This is all still a hack until such time as the address space manager is rewritten, but should make things work more reliably on amd64-linux for now.
58fa733 : Alternate expected outputs with better stack traces. CFI based stack unwinding may have been a giant pain to implement, but it does appear to be better at not missing stack frames and generally being consistent then the old x86-linux follow-the-%ebp scheme.
a5c9e4a : Fix some socket-related functionality on amd64. This means file descriptor leak checks now work on amd64.

934d2d5 : At clone(), always start the child off with a copy of the parent's GDT.
468dc79 : When handling the clone variant done by the Quadrics Elan3 user-space driver, start the child off with a copy of the parent's GDT. All other uses of clone() are unaffected.
ea27e46 : Modularised all the debug info stuff as m_debuginfo/. It's a mess and needs further cleaning up, but it's a start.
0c24647 : Modularised vg_signals.c as m_signals.c.
04e1698 : Modularised vg_main.c as m_main.c. Moved some stuff out of it to reduce the number of files that depend on it, but there are still some which should be removed in the future.
1075931 : debug-logging (-d) totally didn't work when one Valgrindified process exec's another. This commit fixes it.
278b3d6 : Modularised m_scheduler.
1d88711 : Change the way thread termination is handled. Until now, there has been a concept of a 'master thread'. This is the first thread in the process. There was special logic which kept the master thread alive artificially should it attempt to exit before its children. So the master would wait for all children to exit and then exit itself, in the process emitting the final summary of errors, leaks, etc.
10ca4eb : Apparently someone somewhere in some obscure library deep in the basement of mozilla requires 'lods'.
fc8dc42 : Unbreak AMD64 compilation.

2335d11 : Improved structure of LDT-related code: - one declarations from core.h removed, one moved to within m_syscalls. - all the x86 LDT stuff made local to m_syscalls. x86-linux/ldt.c removed as a result. x86/state.c slimmed down, too. x86/x86_private.h removed too. - all the AMD64 LDT stuff was deleted, since it was all commented out. It can be added back in later in the appropriate places if necessary. Thus amd64-linux/ldt.c and amd64/amd64_private.h were removed. - other minor naming changes
14b278b : Cover the unknown-platform case.
e25782d : Remove dead constant.
02bc4b8 : Don't mix backticks and apostrophes when quoting words -- eg. use 'foo' rather than `foo', as www.cl.cam.ac.uk/~mgk25/ucs/quotes.html explains we should (in more detail than you'd imagine was possible). I did this both in output messages and in some comments, for consistency.

d0073f4 : Remove a short sequence of code that was: (a) overly complex (the parens could be added by the sprintf); (b) buggy (buf is used uninitialised if VG_(get_fnname) fails); (c) redundant (the VG_(core_panic_at) prints the stack trace anyway).

d38156e : Reinstate a SBB case.
5410cfd : CFI reader: don't assume RA_REG is anything in particular; instead use what's specified in the currenty applicable CIE.
2a3a1a7 : Create a fast version of MC_(helperc_MAKE_STACK_UNINIT), so as not to slow down call-return intensive amd64 programs too much. Revised version is approximately 8 times faster than the naive version.

826ec49 : Use the new IRStmt_AbiHints created by the amd64 front end. This finally makes memcheck able to reliably track the definedness of the stack on amd64.

5a9ffab : Add the beginnings of what might be a general mechanism to pass ABI-specific knowledge through the IR compilation pipeline. This entails a new IR construction, AbiHint.
8a5ad76 : Update FAQ about GLIBCXX_FORCE_NEW name-change.
a733b5f : Unbreak build by moving creating pub_core_dispatch_asm.h for holding asm-only constants.
b4e6542 : When constructing a LeakErr, the (Char*) .string field is abused to carry an Int. This is confusing but works on 32-bit platforms; on 64-bit ones, gcc complains about the cast. This commit adds another kludge to keep gcc quiet. Really this should be fixed properly. The casting-abuse is 'undone' in case LeakErr in MAC_(pp_Shared_Error).

0ab10c4 : Fix compilation warnings on amd64 caused by I_die_here.
4a4f687 : Move some macros into a more private place.
36b66df : Modularised the dispatchers in m_dispatch.
641d5cc : Modularised vg_skiplist.c as m_skiplist.c.
694b1b6 : Cleaned up vg_messages.c and related printf stuff. vg_messages.c is now a layer above the printf stuff in vg_mylibc.c, which is layered over m_debuglog. This makes the module interfaces neater, more consistent, and cuts 40 lines of code.
444eba1 : Replace two exported functions with one.
9f05a64 : More floating-point tuning.
4ec8a63 : Update a bit.
db261e4 : Add a couple more %rflag-helper specialisations.
9b457d8 : Allow reg-alloc to use %rbx. This is a callee-saved register and therefore particularly valuable - bringing it into circulation reduces the volume of code generated by memcheck by about 3%.
26b32fc : Ah, the joys of register allocation. You might think that giving reg-alloc as many registers as possible maximises performance. You would be wrong. Giving it more registers generates more spilling of caller-saved regs around the innumerable helper calls created by Memcheck. What we really need are zillions of callee-save registers, but those are in short supply. Hmm, perhaps I should let it use %rbx too -- that's listed as callee-save.
0bc78ab : Do a bit better for (part of) a very common memcheck idiom: "is this pointer defined ?"
36932cb : Moved Vex's arch/subarch detection out of main() into VG_(translate)()'s init routine. This meant that VG_(vex_arch) and VG_(vex_subarch) could be made local to VG_(translate)().
695234d : Make VG_(clone)() declaration private to m_syscalls.
a91498f : Removed the obsolete client request numbers that were used in the old libpthread. There seems to be no danger of old libpthread.so files causing problems; I just tried installing a current Valgrind over a 2.2.0 installation and it worked fine.
e2a4458 : Remove dead macro.
de583aa : Move VG_(dispatch_ctr) out of vg_main.c, which never touches it, into vg_scheduler.c, which does.

9fc3112 : Move VG_(block_signals)() to vg_scheduler.c, the only file that uses it, and make it private.
923f15f : Fix stabs parsing bug introduced by fix to bug 90128 which meant that structDef() didn't always call VG_(st_setname) as it should.

Anyway, now it annoyingly fails due to memcheck reporting bugs in libpthread et al. Move it to corecheck so at least it can continue to run and hopefully not continually fail.
5bcde92 : Fix stupid bug I introduced in r3556, which broke handling of RT signals. Sigh.
2c27f70 : Fix really stupid bug I introduced during recent 64-bitification of mc_main.c. As so often the case, the regtest system saved the day by being the first to notice this idiocy.
14ea685 : Don't truncate addresses in error reports.

1dd628a : Update expected output.
55022aa : * Clean up the DWARF2 CFI reader a bit * Check that cie.ra_reg that shows up matches the RA_COL we assume * Improve debug printing a bit
c4f204f : VG_(addCfiSI): ignore CfiSIs which state an address range outside of the segment itself. This may well be hiding bugs in the CFI reader, but I can't figure out why some .so-s generate very low address ranges -- sometimes eg 0x0 .. 0x1.
7624567 : Improve debug printing
e53bd99 : Handle Iop_Neg{8,16,32}.
71a35e7 : x86 guest: generate Iop_Neg* in the x86->IR phase. Intent is to ensure that the non-shadow (real) computation done by the program will fail if Iop_Neg* is incorrectly handled somehow. Until this point, Iop_Neg* is only generated by memcheck and so it will not be obvious if it is mishandled. IOW, this commit enhances verifiability of the x86-IR-x86 pipeline.
f04fd62 : Reset the address encoding to the default before parsing the augmentation string for a new CIE or we may end up using a bogus encoding from the previous CIE if the new one has no encoding specified.
4a64fee : Generate better code for CmpNEZ64(Or64(x,y)), a common idiom resulting from memchecking of FP code.
84a2c38 : Memchecking very large BBs of FP insns on x86 sometimes needs a lot of spill slots.
9fe96a0 : Some suppressions for FC3 amd64 systems.
edef146 : gcc-3.3.3 is fooled by strings like "linux/include/asm-i386/*.h"; it thinks it is seeing a comment within a comment, and complains.
55efbdf : When handling 'sbb %reg,%reg', first put zero into %reg. This removes the false result dependency on the previous value of %reg.
8ac39e4 : Minor tweakage: use testl rather than andl in three places on the basis that andl trashes the tested register whereas testl doesn't. In two out of the three cases this makes no difference since the tested register is a copy of some other register anyway, but hey.
65b17c6 : Minor cleanups.
ac7924c : Correct header comment.
e4ccc01 : Fix compile warnings on 32-bit platforms, hopefully without breaking 64-bit platforms. (a.k.a The Portability Game)
e0707a6 : Handle DW_CFA_register.
cfe1046 : Re-enable vex bb chasing. In fact this accidentally got reenabled in r3582; this commit formalises that.
e5e8b56 : Get rid of some functions made redundant by recent isel reorganisation.
3bc8a59 : Don't complain endlessly about missing folding rule for Iop_64HLto128.
520e349 : rm debug printing
21c6d0f : Initial cleanups based on target-specific defines.
ee0bcbf : Move the replacement code for the amd64 vsyscalls into the trampoline page so that it is copied into the client space. This avoid warnings from memcheck because it doesn't think that code inside valgrind is valid.
bc7df20 : Add macro definitions that make it possible to do cpu/os/both ifdeffery in a sane way where it's absolutely unavoidable. When building the core, eg on amd64-linux, the following preprocessor symbols are defined:
3a1c7db : Sort the CFI summary table and do lookups in it using binary search.
bf60375 : Create and use summary address range limits for the CFI records in each SegInfo. This reduces by about a factor of 8 the amount of work needed to find each such record.
3a7cb97 : CFI: if summarisation fails, don't add the result to our collection of CfiSI records.
8eb4132 : Fix various other CFI-frame-unwind bits and pieces.
325ec87 : * handle DW_CFA_offset_extended_sf * make --trace-cfi=yes work, to assist in debugging this
2fd3890 : Get DWARF CFI handling going on amd64 systems. This also required getting handling of augmentation strings right.
ce058b0 : New flag --trace-cfi=yes|no [no], which is for debugging the CFI reader.
3516553 : Get the CFI-based frame-unwinder to the point where it works at least for small examples on x86. Still messy, slow, amd64 specifics not done, and non-null cie.augmentations are not handled.
5c638c2 : Beginnings of a DWARF CFI-based frame-unwinder. Does not yet do anything. This is needed to get stack snapshots on amd64 code compiled with -O, and could also be used for stack snapshots on x86 code compiled with -fomit-frame-pointer if it also has CFI info.
21f7ff4 : Define N_PRIMARY_MAP to actually generate a 64-bit constant on 64-bit platforms, otherwise the address-masking operations to establish alignment and primary-mappability are wrong on 64-bit platforms.
d485d69 : Even more pissing with inline asm around to placate gcc-3.4 -fpic. We can't trash %ebx without gcc getting unhappy, so trash %edi instead.
d4d203b : local_sys_write_stderr: tell gcc what registers the asm trashes. Otherwise it doesn't save %ebx across the routine, which is fatal as %ebx is a callee-save register, it seems.
05fe85e : Reinstate the leak checker; it works at least on x86.
86ec28b : Handle CmpNEZ16.
176ad2f : Handle various more primops, and reorganise iselCondCode_wrk in line with similar reorg on x86 side.
b522077 : Emit 'negq'.

291a7e8 : Add even more 64-bit integer primops (sigh)
d9dbc19 : Handle various new 64-bit integer primops.
c612186 : Make the debug log module work on amd64.
311400b : Rework the inline assembly implementations of write and getpid for x86 to work in PIE builds.
54b2286 : Try a different kludge to get around strlen not being intercepted early enough.
37c31cc : * Modify the instrumenter to use the new primops introduced in vex rev 1144.

0033ddc : Add a few new primops which allow for more concise expression of the instrumentation Memcheck generates:
550f898 : Add support for the fadvise system calls.
cd98633 : Support the 64 bit comparison instructions which vex is now using.
0354035 : Add various %rflag-helper specialisation cases and fast paths. This more or less doubles performance of the baseline simulation on integer code.
0af46ab : Handle more cases, and a bit of tuning.
9854007 : Add 64-bit comparisons.
943fa54 : Increase number of integer registers in use from 3 to 8.
7efe7be : A bunch of redirections for SuSE 9.2 on amd64.
9be7c98 : Use %lu for all length values in debug messages or you will sometimes get nonense on 64 bit platforms.
601371a : amd64 build fixes.
23c6a29 : For the time being, disable chasing across basic block boundaries. This fools the redirector to the extent that that strlen et al do not get reliably intercepted, and hence makes memcheck report some false errors. Fixing the redirector properly really entails getting rid of the circularity between the two memory allocators, but that is more than I have time to sort out right now.
6ffee52 : Use __FUNCTION__ correctly.
55f9d1a : Create a new module: ASpaceMgr, the address space manager. This contains what was previously vg_memory.c and also vg_procselfmaps.c, which is really just a helper for the address space manager.
8c61589 : More debug printing
d85feff : More printing fine-tuning
1fbc1a5 : Print debugging info at various places in the startup sequence.
a5ebfa9 : Print a bit more prettily.
1cf558c : Add a new module: the debug-logger. For a while now, we've used the same logging mechanism to emit both end-user messages and debugging- valgrind-itself messages. This commit creates a new mechanism for the latter purpose.
5efa55f : Relax the requirement that a pub_tool_<modulename>.h file must exist even if it defines nothing. That's a bit silly.
8a7fdd2 : Make amd64-linux build again after m_sigframe hackery.
985fabb : Create a new module, "sigframe", responsible for creating/destroying signal frames. This commit looks worse than it is -- really just a load of moving-code-around.
267100d : Rename the first three modules as per naming scheme.
cc9549a : Add statement-of-intent re top level module structure.
663a1bd : Add initialisation-order sanity checks.
fa8202f : Update comment about stack management, and remove some unused functions.
a752970 : A leftover from the days of our own libpthread; now irrelevant.
a64f8ad : Handle a couple more memcheck-generated primops. With this, I can run konqueror on memcheck on amd64.
ee0e6a3 : Inline function that's only used once.
9b3328d : Add intercepts for operator new(unsigned long) and operator new[](unsigned long). The 32-bit ones take unsigned int args, not unsigned longs, and so the existing name-set did not capture them.
1e015d8 : Handle some artefacts resulting from memchecking of x87 floating-point code (I64-typed PutI/GetI).
96a922e : Add 64-bit values to the bogus-literal detector.
f9d8161 : Add 64-bit fast case handlers for loads/stores. On amd64, MC_(helperc_LOADV8) compiles down to just 12 instructions for the fast-path, which is pretty darn good.
045a405 : Allow memcheck to take account of VGA_STACK_REDZONE_SIZE -- that is, account for the fact that on amd64 (really, on amd64-linux) the area up to 128 bytes below the stack pointer is accessible. This meant moving the definitions of VGA_STACK_REDZONE_SIZE to tool-visible places.
11bcc4e : Handle 8-byte value-check failures using a special fast-case fn (like 0,1,4 sized) rather than the generic one. Remove size 2 since that never seems to get used.
478fe70 : More code-generation cases.
69a1332 : Add a few cases arising from testing on amd64.
102d263 : Update.
79d8a4b : Comment-only change.
c859fbf : Tidy up: remove lots of old code, rearrange order of functions somewhat.
f3d57dd : mc_LOADVn_slow: When loading from invalid addresses, mark loaded data as defined.
23eb2fd : Mostly finish fixing fast-path cases. Also enhance sanity checking.
5d28efc : Finish off fast cases for {LOAD,STORE}V{4,2,1} and do an inspection of it. Do fast cases for make_aligned_word32_{noaccess,writable}.
7f7e7df : Add note.
c1a2cda : * Crank up the memcheck event-counting system, and enhance it to name the events, rather than just number them, which makes it a lot easier to use
101e572 : Comment-only change
ca870bf : rm'd.
8ac9bc9 : Add an identity, Or8(x,0) --> x.
42322b5 : Fix some more insn selection cases required by Memcheck.
6cf40ff : Fix a bunch of 64-bit cases required amd64. Stop to ponder whether there is a better way to handle the 'pessimising cast' family of operations in such a way that Vex's back-end instruction selectors can generate better code than they do now, with less verbosity and general confusingness in the insn selectors.
45d94cc : Initial rehash of Memcheck's shadow-space management to support both 32- and 64-bit targets, little- and big-endian. It does more or less work on x86 as-is, although is unusably slow since I have knocked out all the fast-path cases and am concentrating on getting the baseline functionality correct. The fast cases will go back in in due course.
9ea0901 : Add another redirect that we need. This has no effect at present because the redirect syms are set up only after the initial read of /proc/self/maps and by then ld-linux.so.2 is already aboard. Fixing this properly requires fixing the address space management stuff properly.
d0469f7 : Disable Addrcheck builds whilst I'm doing bull-in-a-china-shop stuff with Memcheck.
5ce5fd6 : Update comment re PutI/GetI (comment-only change).
d2b1711 : Renamed vg_errcontext.c as errormgr.c, and carved off the relevant parts of core.h and tool.h into pub_core_errormgr.h and pub_tool_errormgr.h. All just to improve general modularity.
d0d6473 : Fix two typos.
2c96ea5 : Some notes from memcheck size/endian hackery
c112139 : Record useful info from Jeremy.
50ae1a7 : Added new assert macros vg_assert2 and tl_assert2 which allow you to print a string explaining more detail if the assertion fails (eg. the value of the bogus variable) using printf-style format arguments.
c7a71b3 : Update expected output.
2feecc6 : Add exhaustive tests for pslldq/psrldq.
ba89f4c : Complete implementation of pslldq/psrldq. Also some whitespace changes.
703eec5 : Reword error messages in a not-quite-so-terse way.
5d2ca93 : Even more syscalls.
537cab0 : Handle bsr{w,l,q} and allow bsfq.
571d289 : Fix comment.
dc2ca89 : Fix a nasty assembler bug, in the handling of Set64, arising from confusion over whether we were looking at a complete integer register number or just the lower 3 bits of it. Rename functions pertaining to messing with integer register numbers in an attempt to stop this happening in future.
8edfde7 : Reinstate tests for bsf{w,l} and bsr{w,l}.
f53b735 : More AMD64 instructions: sfence, movnti, bsf{w,l,q}
9f8a395 : Comment-only changes
ad50db0 : As per r1121, avoid WaW stalls writing the guest state for movss mem->reg.
85619c4 : iselIntExpr64(const): save a precious register in the case where the two halves have the same value.
5bf1fd4 : When generating IR for movsd mem->reg, don't first write the entire guest reg with zeroes and then overwrite the lower half. This forces the back end to generate code which creates huge write-after-write stalls in the memory system of P4s due to the different sized writes. This apparently small change reduces the run-time of one sse2-intensive floating point program from 145 seconds to 90 seconds (--tool=none).
61825e0 : Add a pattern for 64UtoV128(LDle:I64(addr)), so as to generate a single movsd. This fixes a common, poorly handed case in generating sse2 code.
0e9d7e4 : Remove --sloppy-malloc from man page.
f8bb9e7 : Get rid of the --sloppy-malloc= flag and the functionality it controlled (rounding user malloc requests up to a multiple of 4). Subsequent changes to memcheck made it more or less pointless, it is a time waster in the malloc/free path, and nobody ever used it AFAIK.
33ef39c : Removed bogus (UInt) casts from the amd64 signal frame builder and some unecessary casts and code from the x86 signal frame builders.
990e90c : Renamed and retyped the fields relating to valgrind's stack in os_state_t to make their role clearer and their behaviour more consistent with the fields describing the client's stack. Also made the code in x86-linux/syscalls.c and amd64-linux/syscalls.c more word-size-independent, which is not strictly necessary but makes the code similarities between the two files more obvious.
a3b7e3a : Whenever the flags thunk is set, fill in all the fields, even NDEP which isn't usually used. This makes redundant-PUT elimination work better, fixing a rather subtle optimisation bug. For at least one floating-point case this gives a significant speedup. Consider a bb like this:
0ddbf79 : #include <rude_words.h>. The recent change of denotation of no-op IR statements from NULL to IRStmt_NoOp screwed up the how-much-to-unroll heuristics in iropt, resulting in iropt being significantly less enthusiastic about unrolling than it was before the change. Gaaah! This commit should fix it.
2e1da50 : Removed references to client_stack_base which no longer exists.
016712a : Remove the x86-specific is_valid_data_size() test. Also, make any dataSize greater than MIN_LINE_SIZE equal to MIN_LINE_SIZE. This makes the x86/fpu-28-108 regression test pass.
90eecea : 64-bit cleanness -- use UWord instead of UInt.
50ba34e : minor cleanup with the stack-related fields in ThreadState: - removed "stack_base" which wasn't used in any meaningful way - added "client_" prefix to make it clear they concern the client's stack - renamed "stack_size" as "client_stack_szB" to make the units clear
fc14e45 : Deal with apparently non-cfront compliant new[]/delete[] manglings generated by the Portland Group's C++ compiler.
a718d5d : Reinstate ADC Iv, eAX.
10e1cfb : gen_intercepts.pl doesn't exist any more.
412ad6e : Update expected outputs.
97724e5 : In vg_memory.c, allow the stack-change threshold to be specified by a command-line flag (--max-stackframe=number), rather than hardwiring it to 2000000. This is helpful for dealing with unruly Fortran programs which want to allocate large arrays on the stack.
074edc6 : More amd64 system calls - emacs will now run under valgrind.
9ee81f5 : A major overhaul of how malloc/free intercepts are done. The general idea is the same -- write functions with special names encoding sonames and fn names, and have the redir mechanism notice them. However the way the functions are generated is significantly changed:

88a6924 : Remember to clear C2 after fsincos, as that actually makes it work right with reasonable-sized inputs. This confirms fsincos as the golden lemon of x87 floating point instructions, since Vex has by now chomped through vast amounts of floating point code on x86 and this is the first time this bug has come to light.
d26f242 : Rework the vsyscall redirections to work in pie code - the old form seemed to completely confuse the compiler and it was generating nonsense code to get the address of the replacement routines.

fb154a5 : Increase maximum translation size. This can happen when translating long sequences of x86 insns with IR optimisation disabled, so the tag-checking crap doesn't get knocked out like it usually does.

f89f8fa : Get rid of the use of VG_(instr_ptr_offset) since we know what that is at system-build time: OFFSET_amd64_RIP. This saves an instruction on the fast path, and reduces the number of PIE-difficulties by one.

03f1e58 : The two patches attached resolve the exit-hang (of OOo) bug for me. The first fixes getppid(), and the second fixes the next bug which is revealed once getppid() does what LinuxThreads wants; LinuxThreads uses SIGKILL to kill off stray threads, but if we send naked SIGKILLs to Valgrind threads, they'll die without cleaning up or informing anyone of their death, which means that they're waited on forever.

d54babf : Track Vex API change in rev 1062: pass both the guest and host word sizes to the instrumentatation functions. Make most of the tools abort if they are not the same; we can't handle that case yet.
918c8f3 : A small API change: pass both the guest and host word sizes to the instrumentatation functions.
21dc345 : Track Vex API (semantics) changes in rev 1061: introduction of IRStmt_NoOp.
d2445f6 : Add a new IR statement kind: IRStmt_NoOp, to denote a no-operation. These are generated by the IR optimiser. The use of no-ops replaces the old practice of allowing a BB to contain NULL pointers in its statement array as a way of denoting no-ops. NULL stmts are now no longer allowed under any circumstances, and the IR sanity checker will reject any BB containing them.
36917e9 : Fix copy-n-paste-o spotted by Ceri.
1cb50b2 : Move VG_(get_EIP)() out of vg_execontext.c, where it doesn't belong, into vg_main.c, where it doesn't also really belong but at least it's now next to VG_(get_stack_pointer)() which is very similar.

2b0ca46 : We no longer need a complete spare copy of V hanging off the Vex tree.
29faa50 : Make existing tools aware of IR instruction marks. (They ignore them, though).
f168931 : Add a new kind of IR stmt: "instruction marks" (IRStmt_IMark), so as to support profiling. It is the responsibility of front ends (toIR.c) to generate these. For each instruction, the first IR stmt emitted should be an IMark, stating the guest address and length of the guest instruction represented by the IR that follows. All IR stmts following the IMark but before the next IMark are then assumed to 'belong to' the guest insn described by the first IMark. IMarks do not denote executable code and can be ignored at any point in the proceedings; they are an optional addition which help profiling-annotators to navigate the IR stmt stream.
c279b3f : Revert to doing x86->x86 (utterly trivial change)
ec6df2f : Fixed front-end srawi carry flag calc
1f126c5 : Add guest_TISTART and guest_TILEN fields to all guest state structs, since eventually users of the library will refer to them, and unless they exist in all guest states, compilation failure will result.
ba30c1b : Add an equally-valid looking alternative .stderr.exp for this test.
ce7ec7d : Add another possible .stderr output for memcheck/tests/writev.
9bd43d5 : Remove pth_once from memcheck/tests. It already exists in corecheck/tests and there is no point in duplicating it. Given that it was intended to check the behaviour of our now-defunct pthread implementation there's not much point in keeping it at all.
882af5f : Reinstate VG_(find_root_memory). This makes the leak detector work again.
215776c : Get rid of VG_(client_free) as it was never used. Rename its counterpart VG_(client_alloc) to VG_(get_memory_from_mmap_for_client). Man, this low level memory management is an undisciplined mess.
1008bfc : Update expected outputs to include missing stack frames that old UCode machinery caused to be missed due to not keeping %EBP up to date.
4cca75c : Add %EBP/%RBP to the set of registers for which redundant-PUT elimination is not done. This is needed so that Valgrind can construct correct stack traces on x86/amd64. Curiously enough old UCode valgrind didn't do this correctly, but because it doesn't optimise as aggressively as Vex, we didn't notice this. Overall result is that Vex-based valgrind now produces more accurate stack traces, at least on x86, than valgrind-2.4.X will.
b79fb37 : small fix to rlwnm_cb loop
a168590 : Don't try to stuff 16 bit values into 12 bit variables.
f4d483b : Replace an 8-line macro with a 2-line function that is also easier to understand.

b71816c : Don't read symbol tables for .so's that constitute part of Valgrind itself. Doing so -- in this case for libc.so.6 -- confuses the redirection machinery and so messes up redirections to mac_replace_strmem.c, which in turn causes memcheck to report spurious errors.

76754cf : Commit half-baked attempts to get memcheck and addrcheck to build.
2ac9524 : For the CLIENT_CALLn client requests, we must pass in the ThreadId as the first argument to the function. This seemingly got lost in the CVS+SVN merge, which meant that any function called with these client requests was getting totally mixed-up arguments. Since TL_(malloc)() and friends are called this way, this was affecting all tools that replace malloc(), ie. Memcheck, Addrcheck, Helgrind, Massif.
e5f5769 : Fix minor problems in filters. This helps a couple of massif tests to pass.
