7fae3e0 : Fix --trace-malloc=yes, by using client-side VALGRIND_INTERNAL_PRINTF to print the allocation traces rather than trying to directly use VG_(printf).
39de4b4 : Patch from Robert Walsh <rjwalsh@durables.org>. Adds some new client requests to allow client code to print messages through Valgrind's logging mechanism. The new requests are: VALGRIND_PRINTF - do a normal printf (prefixed with **PID**) VALGRIND_PRINTF_BACKTRACE - do a printf with stack trace VALGRIND_INTERNAL_PRINTF - printf, but for internal use (prefixed with ==PID==) VALGRIND_INTERNAL_PRINTF_BACKTRACE - as above, with backtrace
ece14bd : fixes .cfi configure problem. apparently compiling is not enough to invoke the gnu as in all cases.
2e6bc00 : there have been reports that "stat" is not portable enough.
23cb4a0 : for some reason I need that to make it compile on suse 9 MERGE TO STABLE
e6de706 : make it really silent
f2db92d : Increased the skin major version number, to reflect the changed return values of functions like VG_(open), and also to cover any future changes between now and the HEAD becoming an official release.
50da0f3 : Fix cachegrind to deal with VG_(open)() returning any negative number on error, not just -1.
f6b1f7e : Previously, if the command given to Valgrind didn't exist, the 'stat -c' suid/sgid test failed, and the startup script aborted with an ugly message. I've changed it so that it first checks that the program exists in the user's path (as determined by 'which'), and aborts if not.
d3de730 : Added a regtest that uses pthreads -- there weren't any.
89f9a32 : Add a --assume-2.4=yes|no CLO. This overrides the normal check to see if the kernel has enough capabilities to run in 2.6 mode (ie, futex, the right kind of clone, correct signal handling properties), and always uses 2.4 mode. This will often not work on a 2.6 or RH9 2.4 kernel, but it does help avoid a bug in the SuSE 8.2 (and possibly 9) kernels, which look like they support enough to run in 2.6 mode, but get it wrong. TODO: make the startup script/configure actually use this option.
e1c06d8 : Update some stuff related to the syscalls change: - restart syscalls which return ERESETARTSYS - make code to restart a syscall common - keep a process-wide pending signal set to store as-yet undelivered signals (only used in 2.4 mode; TODO: siginfo, queues) - make execve work a bit better - it is impossible to recover from execve failing, so we try to check that it will before running the syscall itself (also fixes bug with SuSE 8.2 kernel)
bf4621d : no longer sourceforge (also known as test commit)
e343649 : Add SQRTSS: square root of scalar float
632b8a1 : Implement UNPCKLPS and UNPCKHPS and improve UNPCKLPD.
17059e0 : Return an error rather than panicing when given a bad socketcall
77d30a2 : SSE/SSE2 fixes needed to run the entire test suite of the GNU Scientific Library (gsl-1.4) compiled with Intel Icc 7.1 20030307Z '-g -O -xW'. I think this gives pretty good coverage of SSE/SSE2 floating point instructions, or at least the subset emitted by Icc. So far tested on memcheck and nulgrind; addrcheck and cachesim still testing.
a5f05ff : There's a bug in memory ownership inheritance, which inherit.c shows up. Make it obvious.

7ef2881 : Allow VGOFF_() symbols to be global, so that skins that refer to VGOFF_(helper_*) work again. That was a perplexing little problem to fix.

d1b5b1d : Implement repe scas.
f3c3f1a : When creating a logfile name, add a sequence number to the name in case a logfile for that pid already exists. This may happen for programs started during system boot which will tend to get the same pid each boot.
a065a9c : Fix a bug in the duplicate string squasher, which was a bit over-eager to decide two strings are duplicates.
cb1d1c0 : Adds VG_(describe_addr)() for generating symbolic descriptions of a memory address, based on which variables are in scope at the time and their types.
5efa4fd : This creates a new UInstr for multiply. This is mainly so that memcheck can treat it like add and generate partially-defined results of multiply with partially defined arguments. It may also speed things up a bit, if they use lots of multiplies.
c5918d9 : We expect new output with the syscalls changes.
2ccec9f : Mention that -fno-inline is a helpful build flag when you're debugging.
b746437 : Document the state machine implemented in vg_proxylwp.c.
855d93d : A complete reworking of Valgrind's handling of system calls and signals, with the aim of making it more robust, more correct and perhaps faster.
8399f6a : Fixed "pop (%esp)", which must increment %esp before using it to calculate the memory address. Thanks to Erik Corry.
5428450 : Added (trivially) support for "push %ss". Minimally tested, along with "pop %ss".
9e4c1f9 : Added (trivally) support for "pop %ss". Untested.
ff28df9 : Added a couple of small #ifdefs so that Valgrind works with Erik Anderson's uClibc (micro libc, a small alternative to glibc).
5686735 : Delete some "inline" directives on functions that gcc-3.3.1 declined to inline. This is needed to get a warning-free compilation on 3.3.1. It seems we had "inline" on some pretty huge functions in places. Also it appears gcc-3.3.1 won't inline a function call in a tail call position, reasonably enough. I assume in that case it prefers to create a tailcall to the callee, rather than inlining it.
737a375 : Implement DIVPS/DIVPD (Tom Hughes <thh@cyberscience.com>)
5e657c3 : Implement pthread_spinlock_* (Tim Potter, tpot@samba.org)
32a17d1 : Whoops, forgot to commit changes to Makefile.am when I added the 'new_nothrow' test.
da536bb : include sys/time.h when we have it.
5cebf57 : Added interceptions for:
97b7b26 : Rudimentary, kludgy, incomplete and probably just plain wrong support for vendor_id "CentaurHauls", which is the VIA string (reflecting its design heritage). Currently pretend to be something like a VIA Nehemiah.
247f32f : Handle SSE5.
d799418 : Moved the MALLOCLIKE and FREELIKE client requests out of memcheck.h, and into valgrind.h. Although these requests are not implemented by the core, they can be implemented by skins that track heap blocks, eg. Memcheck, Annelid, Massif. This is in preparation for committing Massif to the repository.
6e69ecd : Fixed up the client request info in the docs, which required splitting the core requests from the Memcheck requests and putting the descriptions in the appropriate parts of the docs.
ed61971 : Improved the ESP-update pass -- it's method for finding the ESP-deltas was very fragile, and it was lucky that it worked at all. Replaced it with a much more robust method. Thanks to Dirk Mueller for pointing it out.
972a759 : speed optimisation: assuming that a tempreg not related to %esp before is PUTed into %ESP, we do *know* that this tempreg points to %ESP afterwards, so track it.
f26b216 : export emit_movzbl_regmem_reg as the other variants are exported too and its useful for skins
79aad84 : inc/dec %ESP support MERGE TO STABLE
d0eab5f : The name-mangled versions of __builtin_new() and __builtin_vec_new() now don't just call the unmangled versions, but do the appropriate stuff themselves directly (this was necessary for Massif). This means that stack traces for them have one fewer function. And I was able to gather up several very similar functions into a macro, reducing the amount of code, which was nice. Had to update one regtest's expected output accordingly.
69c0687 : Export to skins a function, VG_(HT_count_nodes)(), which was always intended to be visible to them, but I had forgotten to export.
e36543a : comment change only
06072ec : Removed sort_hash_array(). Changed VG_(HT_to_sorted_array)() to VG_(HT_to_array)(). Leak checker now sorts the given array itself, using VG_(ssort)().
d3b0c5f : Added a generic VG_(ssort)() function, like stdlib.h's qsort(). It's specialised for the size == 1/2/4 cases.
34ac027 : Teach Helgrind to cope with negative args to malloc(). Also slightly economise calloc().
607adfc : Added a new flag ',' to printf() format specifications. When specified in a number, will print it with commas delimiting it. Very useful when printing large numbers.
e7442cf : Made VG_(read_millisecond_timer)() available to skins. Also made it cope with being called from SK_(pre_clo_init)(), before its startup code has been run (just returns 0).
99ccf08 : Added VG_(getcwd_alloc)(), which is much easier to use than VG_(getcwd)(). (getcwd() is really a pretty stupid syscall)
da2e36d : Tiny formatting changes
95bc386 : Disallowed size==1 for WIDEN.
b2b8f10 : Don't panic on MMX UInstrs. In effect, makes it work for MMX, as well as SSE/SSE2.
8988f93 : Implement MOVQ -- move 8 bytes of XMM reg or mem to XMM reg.
da762d4 : Change things so that default.supp is only deleted with "make distclean", rather than "make clean", which is the behaviour recommended by the automake docs for files built at configure-time.
e864e2f : Add a couple more CPUID-auto-detect cases for Intel CPUs to Cachegrind, thanks to Josef Weidendorfer.
207c41e : Fix broken regtest.
dfc9b8c : Fix minor cut+paste error.
b106c42 : revert accidental debug code I committed last time.
f45a4eb : Fixed the static-link check at startup -- it was broken for scripts. Refine FAQ #5 accordingly.
59fb25c : Increase size of block-tracking hash table(s) from 997 to 4999.
7c874c7 : Add a suppression for stack underrun bug(s) in the c++ support library distributed with Intel Icc 7.0. (/opt/intel/compiler70/ia32/lib/libcxa.so.3)
b18d253 : implement IN and OUT opcodes.
b2d4432 : Remove extraneous tabs from Memcheck --trace-codegen output.
89409f8 : Remove two pieces of identical code used by Memcheck and Addrcheck, and put them in a shared place. (They used to be different, when Addrcheck didn't distinguish between reads and writes, but now they're the same.)
7443bb5 : Add support for "movl imm32, %esp". Needed for 'grinding vg_startup.S :)
eb60b94 : Fix a couple of bugs in the sigalstack wrapper (Nb: found when I was (apparently) self-hosting :)
5d945de : implement a couple more instructions. I've mailed this patch to Julian and Nick but got no reply. I guess they're okay with it. I tested them quite a lot so it should be fine.
b1db123 : be more specific which allocation failed
b6d9b54 : implement all SSE(2) ucodes. now I can run mplayer in valgrind :)
dc8d5e5 : At startup, now tests if program is statically linked. Bails with a useful message if so. If anyone thinks this will break anything, please yell.
fa1016e : Cleaned up reading of debug info a bit.
667c98f : typo
e9cab14 : Addrcheck was broken, because it wasn't recognising "Overlap" suppressions. Fixed now.
7fd598c : Using start_eip instead of eip for disassembly failure messages.
2f306e0 : add suppression about common X11 protocol and ICE errors. Please scream if you don't like this.. Personally I've never seen a valid warning and all of them were spurious.
8b5d8eb : remove default.supp during clean
df9ae42 : compiler warning fixes
3222e0a : fix compiler warnings
8ad1a40 : fix compiler warning
37d06f2 : Suppress a couple more messages when -q applies.
0355dff : Add patch from Stephan Kulow to solve the following:
6c84655 : Added some skin-visible functions that give skins a bit more control over how stack snapshots are taken and printed; they can be used in preference to VG_(get_ExeContext)() and VG_(pp_ExeContext)(). These are used by Massif, my heap profiling skin.
d84bde7 : Made the realpath overlap ones apply for Addrcheck too.
b94b81e : Fix problem with adjtimex.
86dc2bc : With -v option, client program's argv[] now printed at startup. Should be useful when trying to interpret users' problems. Each argv is printed on a separate line, to make it extra clear where each one starts and ends.
c2699f6 : Made Addrcheck distinguish between invalid reads and invalid writes (previously was just saying "invalid memory access").
f962a76 : Forgot to add these files for the writev regression test.
6e8250c : patch for adjtimex syscall by Bob Van Manen <BVanManen@Scene7.com> appares to compile for me
aca67c5 : Fixed readv() and writev() so they won't fall over if they are given a negative count. Added a regression test for it.
0d14a56 : Trivial assertion fix -- the SSE3 instructions can be of size 8.
7360f8e : Fixed brk(); it was almost completely broken.
b6cae9f : Fixed overlap errors so the hacky strdup'ing of strings isn't necessary; now passing in the relevant parameters via an 'extra' struct, as is proper.
b29d4cb : docs typo
fa509e2 : Minor fix: errors on MMX_MemRd instructions were erroneously being called writes.

af79551 : --> 20030725
4700f04 : Increase VG_N_FORKHANDLERSTACK from 2 to 4. For reasons known only to itself, pth_atfork1 and 2 fail on R H 7.3 for a size-2 stack, but only with certain skins. Don't ask me.
945f39f : Update for 20030725.
45b672d : VG_(mash_LD_PRELOAD_and_LD_LIBRARY_PATH): remove leading spaces and colon created by this mechanism.
a602261 : Fix the strdup-of-OverlapErr-string problem better. Move the strdup to MAC_(record_overlap_error), wherein we know that s is a string.
7ebf7c3 : construct_error(): strdup the supplied s (string) param which gives extra info about some kinds of errors. It was being allocated on the stack by complain2/3 in mac_malloc_wrappers.c.
78adbf4 : Moved vg_kerneliface.h from coregrind/ to include/, where it was needed for external skin compilation to work.
398044f : Changed the behaviour of realloc() in Memcheck, Addrcheck and Helgrind.
7271864 : A big commit size-wise, but small concept-wise: removed the ThreadState type from skin's view, replacing all instances with ThreadId. Much cleaner. Had to change the way VG_(get_ExeContext)() worked a little. Changed the core/skin major interface because this breaks the old version. Also fixed a few minor related things here and there.
c6b0fe5 : Use init_ExeContext_storage instead of relying (unintentionally) on properties of 'static'. Also, de-globalise this function. Some days I really yearn for a proper module system in C. Come back Haskell, all is forgiven :-)
c2f5bb0 : Just clarified VG_(mash_LD_PRELOAD_and_LD_LIBRARY_PATH)'s workings a bit.
ac2eb79 : Fix a problem in VG_(mash_LD_PRELOAD_and_LD_LIBRARY_PATH)(): when removing the added paths, it was taking out the colon between the removed entry and the following, which meant the following was interpreted as having a big chunk of whitespace at the start, which broke some things.
e8b5c05 : Changed behaviour of VALGRIND_COUNT_LEAKS slightly. Previously, the numbers it returned (bytes leaked, dubious, etc) were incremented for every leak check performed. So if you called VALGRIND_DO_LEAK_CHECK twice in a row, the totals would be updated twice by the same amount. This was a bit silly. So now COUNT_LEAKS just returns the numbers of bytes leaked found from the previous leak check. I even updated the docs, and changed the regression test so old version fail but the new version passes (by doing two DO_LEAK_CHECKS in a row).
db918dd : Truncate the cachegrind.out.<pid> file, if it already exists. It wasn't doing this, which meant that if a shorter file of the same name was written, the old contents past the new end would remain, which would be bad. Had (probably) never happened because the <pid> suffix makes it very unlikely for filenames to be reused.
2151180 : Add to the list of new stuff in 20030716, some things I forgot.
a7b627d : wibble
66fe05a : Added overlap checking to Addrcheck, mostly just moving things around. In particular, renamed mc_replace_strmem.c as mac_replace_strmem.c; the 'mac' prefix indicates it's shared between Memcheck and Addrcheck.
ca1ded3 : Installing vg_skin.h and dependent .h files, on Josef's request, as it makes separate skins easier to install.
84d669f : Fix stupid compile error; I iz stupid.
ce46c2a : Fix: I thought VG_(malloc)() always zeroed memory. It does at first (because it's mmapped in from /dev/zero), but when recycled may not.
6a23053 : This commit fixed some bugs in error and suppression handling. Basically, I had forgotten that some errors (PThread errors) are found by the core, rather than skins and so the skin shouldn't be involved in handling them. This commit fixes the problem.
0dd9cf1 : Added instructions on checking out from SourceForge CVS to the README file.
e188abf : Close fds to avoid fd leakage.
dda830a : Fix bugs in overlap detection. Tom Hughes <thh@cyberscience.com>
777aff5 : fix realpath for Mandrake 9.1

9d916ed : Changes for snapshot 20030715.
f3406d0 : VG_(setup_code_redirect_table): do errno etc entry-point redirection for glibc-2.3.1 too.
47984f3 : Run -q
2e353da : Intercept waitpid() so as to make it non-blocking. Yet another ghastly hack. Roll on proper clonethread-based handling of blocking syscalls.
58bef2e : Add test for correct errno handling in threaded programs.
6024b21 : Add patch from Sami Liedes <sliedes@cc.hut.fi> making GDB use more flexible: --gdb-path=/path/to/gdb allows running some alternate GDB --input-fd=<n> allows reading input from some fd other than stdin I even updated the docs :-)
1eefb15 : Push version tag along, to cvs-head-2003-07-13.
c8bf5fe : Refine the PLT-bypassing-bypassing machinery so it works on Red Hat 9. This means we are now are zero regression test failures on RH9 too. Yay.
ecf8e10 : In vg_memory.c, startup_segment_callback, fix initialisation ordering problem which caused the leak checker to misbehave following recent PLT-bypass workaround.
f9025f7 : add_MAC_Chunk: mark shadow block as off-limits to the client so that the leak checker doesn't see the pointer to the real block. As detailed in the comment in this function, this must be masking a deeper memory management bug.
f1accbc : Whitespace-only change.
f9e1be2 : Run this test -q
c91a4ff : A new implementation of pthread_once() which I believe should comply properly with POSIX, and not get assertion failures when the same thread makes nested calls to pthread_once with different once_control pointers.
8a77ffb : A bit of cleaning up now that symbol table reading is no longer optional.
7b579f7 : Give corecheck a SK_(update_extra) so it doesn't panic on corecheck/tests/res_search.
25c7c3a : Add a new mechanism for intercepting calls, which doesn't depend on the vagaries of the dynamic linker. In particular this has been devised so as to work around errno/h_errno/resolver-state misbehaviour caused by excessive PLT bypassing in glibc-2.3.2: we need to intercept calls to __errno_location(), __h_errno_location() and __res_state(), in threaded programs, but we can't always do that because some calls made internally within glibc-2.3.2 bypass the PLT.
7294b71 : Add iffdeffery to allow testing the call to the DNS resolver in either the main thread, or in some other thread (the failure case).
33f4323 : Allow for 1 and 2 digit pids
0b666d8 : Dodge around more glibc variants.
4855c05 : Fix a whole lot more regression tests on Red Hat 7.3.
b72d973 : Undo mistaken rev 1.54.
7e93819 : Make more tests glibc-2.X robust.
708355b : Try and make different gcc versions agree on source locations. Sigh.
befdfbd : Make some more tests more robust against glibc differences.
51a9fe1 : A regression test for the new VALGRIND_{GET,SET}_VBITS macros.
55515ff : Make these work on Red Hat 7.3 (by giving -q)
f6bb071 : Run the test with -q so that it works both on glibc-2.2 and 2.3. The problem if -q is not used is that the lines "malloc/free: 1 allocs, 0 frees, 8 bytes allocated." have different counts depending on the glibc version.
68e281a : Make it compile with older compilers.
e201b40 : make check more portable, patch by Matthew Emmerton
989dad9 : Increase default number of supported threads from 50 to 100.
57a8f5f : load_one_suppressions_file(): Make sure to finish reading up-to-and-including the '}' when the number of callers is >= VG_N_SUPP_CALLERS. (Jeffrey Stedfast)
9ac747a : Restarting valgrind-listener quickly can produce: cannot bind port : Address already in use Fix it by enabling SO_REUSEADDR for the listening socket.
f099551 : Fix up weak binding for pthread_mutexattr_setpshared.
7685cae : Implement pthread_mutexattr_setpshared (Nick did this).
a51cc09 : Handle XCHG eAX,eBP.
e54b69d : string_match_wrk(): increase max recursion depth to 500.
d1393e5 : VGR_(select): be robust against negative timeout values (treat as zero).
3058e04 : The Pentium 4 recycles the CS segment override prefix (0x2E) to mean 'predict not taken' when it appears before a conditional branch. Valgrind 1.9.6 doesn't know how to handle this. The appended patch makes it ignore the prefix in this case, which should be safe.
af48a60 : Add patch from Nick to get proper backtraces in MC_(get_or_set_vbits_for_client).
ee07084 : Add memcheck client requests VALGRIND_GET_VBITS / VALGRIND_SET_VBITS for fetching/setting metadata so that it can be sent between unconnected address spaces (or whatever).

01f192e : Operator change. No difference in behaviour, but avoids a warning with Perl 5.8.0.
7e1b3b2 : wibble
4395356 : Added (trivially) "XCHG eAX,eSP" instruction.
9a07c22 : Doubled VG_N_WAITING_FDS from 10 to 20. Joshua Moore-Oliva <josh@chatgris.com> hit his head on it a while ago.
a2c92ed : Fixed cpuid regtest, which was broken by the switch to using the machine's real CPUID.
319ddec : comment only
2392dd6 : make sure that the cpuid of the simulated CPUID doesn't pretend to support 3dnow!
2aaa2ca : Move two variable declarations to the start of their enclosing blocks.
9dd209f : A few more SSEs.
745561e : Make the CPUID helper really do cpuid, so that what is returned depends on the host CPU. We no longer claim to be Werner Trobin's P54C or any more recent variant thereof :-)
2db567e : A few more SSE float (scalar,packed) insns. Something is not right; the Ogg encoder vectorised for PIII (SSE, -xK) crashes now.
1e86b8b : - Add a few more SSE instructions - Fix a bug in MOVD reg-xmmreg / xmmreg-reg which was causing programs to misbehave
095c3bc : Add some more SSE/SSE2 floating point instructions.
e9212b3 : AC_PROG_EGREP wasn't too portable after all. Better fixing it the lame but safe way
abf8bf8 : - Continue to clear up SSE insn emitters following recent cleanups re G vs E register fields in encoding - Add SSE3e_RegWr and use it to implement a case in MOVD.
4fbe6e9 : Rename the SSE and MMX uinstrs which read/write integer registers, in a way consistent with the position of the register field in the instruction. In Intel encoding parlance, the G register is in bits 5,4,3 and the E register is bits 2,1,0, and so we adopt this scheme consistently. Considering how much confusion this has caused me in this recent bout of SSE hacking, consistent renaming can only be a good thing. It makes it a lot easier to figure out if parts of the SSE handling machinery are correct, or not.
bc148f2 : Fill in a whole bunch of boring-ass SSE SIMD-integer insns.
e3891fa : Yet more SSE insns.
6bc4055 : - Comment out SSE uinstrs which have not so far been used.
e64b684 : Remove debug printing that sneaked in.
1863abc : Teach AddrCheck about some SSE uinstrs.
5d58cb4 : Do SSE insns PSRLDQ, PSLLDQ
7c4b604 : Get rid of spurious declaration for fooble.
a453fb0 : More SSE instructions.
ea691a1 : Add yet more SSE/SSE2 instructions. The party never stops here at Valgrind HQ :-)
2ca39a1 : - saneUInstr: Allow SSE4 to have CCf (writes ZCP flags). - vg_improve: add debugging hooks (#if0'd out)
8f33ba6 : Fix code generation errors for the SSE3g_ family. This fixes various segfaults running SSEd code.
839299f : When exiting with VgSrc_BbsDone (switching back to real CPU because block execution count exceeded, debugging only), restore the signal state before switching back rather than after. I no longer understand why it had to be done afterwards. This simplifies vg_startup.S a bit.

42e23f2 : This commit allows Valgrind to be run in-place from the source tree, without requiring "make install". This is good for two reasons:

61821c0 : Increase VG_N_CLEANUPSTACK to 16.
9df7883 : Fix interception of pthread_atfork with glibc-2.3.2.
97ad552 : Unchain translations when doing VALGRIND_DISCARD_TRANSLATIONS. Otherwise the tt/tc are left in an inconsistent state afterwards. (Adam Gundy <arg@cyberscience.com>)
1f9f393 : wibble
4c79121 : Moved the CLIENT_tstCALL[0123] requests out of valgrind.h into vg_skin.h, because there was no point exposing them to clients, as they don't know the ThreadState type.
5e0db1a : wibble
34419c1 : Made memcpy()-et-al-overlap errors fully fledged errors, suppressible, recordable, etc. Thanks to Tom Hughes <thh@cyberscience.com> for the patch.
0c5fac8 : Added regression tests for recent bug fix involving accept(), recvfrom() and getsockopt() being allowed to received a NULL buffer.
6ae0d3f : Minor fix for lookup_dcookie
8e72528 : Fixed some syscalls a little bit:
6eba4ef : Added "_W" suffix to stack sizes to indicate they are in words.
12a5714 : Removed magic numbers for VG_(stack) size and VG_(sigstack) size, made into #defined constants. I hope I got all the right places. I also hope that they can be different sizes; experiments seem to indicate so. Also if I reduce the size of the main stack at all below its current 10000 I get problems, but that was happening before anyway, I think.
13f0293 : Fixed a bug in Cachegrind -- if the profiled program changes working directory, the output file wouldn't get written. No longer creating the file at startup and then writing it at the end; just writing it at the end. Also recording the start directory at the start so that the output ends up in it even if the program does change directory.
0c7a5b5 : 1. No longer printing the "MMX-only" or "SSE-capable" string at startup ("if (0)"'d it out).
b91ae7f : Extend the state components in VG_(m_state_static) and VG_(baseBlock) to include the SSE/SSE2 architectural state. Automagically detect at startup, in vg_startup.S, whether or not this is a SSE-enabled CPU and act accordingly. All subsequent FPU/SSE state transfers between the simulated and real machine are then done either with fsave/frstor (as before) or fxsave/fxrstor (the SSE equivalents).
dc38f33 : Send bug reports to Jeremy F, not me (njn).
c68dfbb : Couple of minor fixes: - don't keel over if run on an empty file - abort if the "summary:" line is missing; previously it gave a warning and tried to keep going but then other things broke.
96330bd : Add \n in failure message.
4c2dbb5 : Don't trash %eflags before snapshotting the state of the machine at startup. I don't know if this is actually of interest, since surely the flags are not live at the point where the section's .init function is called, but still, it's a form of state pollution.
17e92db : Add __NR_prctl.
366ee1e : report_and_quit: Tell people to look at the FAQ.txt for advice.
44b6043 : Don't call VG_(mash_LD_PRELOAD_and_LD_LIBRARY_PATH) if all we're doing is exiting normally. There's no point, and it causes breakage when programs which write their environment variables, finish normally.
03272ff : Add FAQ entry re apparent space leaks in the STL.
8c4e6b1 : Support kernels >= 2.5.68 (Anders Gustafsson <andersg@0x63.nu>)
dd5c88e : Add __NR_lookup_dcookie, whatever that might be.
9b81a42 : Merge patch from Josef Weidendorfer <Josef.Weidendorfer@gmx.de>:
262b5be : Add possibly-bogus implementations for __libc_current_sigrtmin, __libc_current_sigrtmax and __libc_allocate_rtsig.
eff8b31 : Fix compilation on glibc-2.1.X.
11f0bb4 : Fix threading problems on glibc-2.3.2 or later. Note this is *not* NPTL support.
b6483f8 : wibble
9a90c7b : Fixed Fixed bug in strncpy() and strncat() -- they were giving the right answers, but could read the (n+1)th char, which could possibly be inaccessible. Thanks to Adam Gundy <arg@cyberscience.com> for spotting it.
c656e97 : Added a return value (0) for the LOGMESSAGE request, since it's now visible to skins.
02a36f7 : Added syscall creat(), courtesy of Tom Hughes <thh@cyberscience.com>.
1ff5977 : correct expected stdout. prepare must NOT run twice!
5b88111 : be a bit more libc tolerant
677e061 : fix sigaltstack regression test to be more glibc-version tolerant
71fe3e6 : Changed things so that the regression test script (vg_regtest) is no longer installed, as it was silly since the reg tests themselves aren't installed. Updated the "make regtest" target to use the uninstalled version in tests/.
49e630d : Record the correct address of the initial thread's stack, as determined by the initial scan of /proc/self/maps, so that we correctly identify addresses in it. This fix is thanks to Dirk Mueller.
e5521a5 : Change the version "number" to something less confusing, since we are not (yet) making releases from this branch.
e709de4 : wibbles
9fb16f5 : Now counting tests and stdout failures and stderr failures separately and correctly.
f77e4f8 : the error is in line 13, not in line 15
bb93698 : - fix regression tests counting - unset $VALGRIND_OPTS (fixes 6 testsuite failures)
c60b3a1 : always run check before regtest
5187f43 : wibble 2
c5db585 : wibble
36a53ad : Majorly update and expand, adding workarounds for more or less all failures with known workarounds.
8a6b6c0 : Implemented malloc_usable_size(), which was used in a program written by Frederic Delley <fdelley@cisco.com>.
ec72b7d : According to Greg Hosler <hosler@lugs.org.sg>, these entries need to be added, otherwise rpm on RH9 will complain that these files are in the payload area, but not saved to the rpm.
7d9f94d : Added "Int exitcode" argument to SK_(fini)(), because it could be useful for skins.
4e59bd9 : Re-added the FAQ that was lost a while back, possibly when I did the original core/skin split. Added a couple more questions+answers.
1140b24 : Fixed minor boo-boo
7e61481 : In my big malloc-out-of-core changes of last week, I broke Helgrind by forgetting to change one of the skin functions. It ran fine until it tried to generate an error message, whereupon it complained about a missing skin function. (We should really have more than one regression test for Helgrind...)
057c65f : Renamed VG_NON_SIMD_CALL1 (and friends) as VALGRIND_NON_SIMD_CALL1 to be consistent with the names of the other client requests.
47363ab : Added two client requests: VALGRIND_COUNT_ERRORS and VALGRIND_COUNT_LEAKS. The first returns the number of errors found so far, and is a core request. The second returns the number of bytes found reachable/dubious/leaked/suppressed by all leak checks so far, for Memcheck and Addrcheck.
17b8535 : Better way to specify where gdb is -- now GDB_PATH is defined in config.h, which is global, rather than passing it in with -D to the file that needed it.
94ece2f : be autoconf 2.13 compatible
c42d8bc : reapply automake fixes. make check will now generate the binaries which are only required for regression testing.
6cb58cf : fix make distcheck by properly implementing the NPTL configure check.
9315df3 : The location of gdb is now determined by the 'configure' script, instead of being hard-wired at /usr/bin/gdb.
45d7763 : wibble
0e1b514 : Updated copyright notices for 2003. Only 4 months late.
b4aee05 : Namespace police
3e88418 : ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- overview ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Previously Valgrind had its own versions of malloc() et al that replaced glibc's. This is necessary for various reasons for Memcheck, but isn't needed, and was actually detrimental, to some other skins. I never managed to treat this satisfactorily w.r.t the core/skin split.
218eba7 : wibble
3e87f7e : Minor HTML fixes in docs, thanks to Arnaud Desitter.
55b98e9 : Added a Makefile target for running the regression tests.
46930da : Added regression test from Dominic Mazzoni for FPU lazy eflags update bug that was fixed in coregrind/vg_from_ucode.c v1.42.
e0205ff : Fixed minor printf bogons.
d8ced86 : Removed support for the 1.0.X series from the regression test suite -- this was present from before the core/skin split, which is now dead. Means the script is slightly simpler, and we can dispense with lots of expected foo.stderr.hd files.
43c799e : This commit moves some skin-specific stuff out of core, and generally neatens other things up.
2e10a68 : Add and use a configure test to determine if this is an NPTL based system. Hopefully this will allow it to build out of the box and (sort-of) work on RH9.
9b007f6 : ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- overview ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- This commit introduces an optimisation that speeds up Memcheck by roughly -3 -- 28%, and Addrcheck by 1 -- 36%, at least for the SPEC2000 benchmarks on my 1400MHz Athlon.
57f6b35 : Un-break the head -- the LD_ASSUME_KERNEL thing breaks the entire universe apart from RH9. This (and thus RH9 out-of-the-box support) is now waiting for a reliable configure test for NPTL-ness.
d5815ec : A minimal set of changes to make it work on Red Hat 9, at least in the interim. All hats off to Graydon Hoare for this, plus to whoever devised the LD_ASSUME_KERNEL trapdoor.
d1c9e43 : Implement MMX movd where the src is an mmxreg and the dst is an ireg or memory.
d797101 : Rationalise ucode generation for 4-byte moves into the MMX unit (movd).
5488880 : Support __NR_munlockall (syscall 151).
420b928 : Add a fix for this
240838d : Update update-date.
65f1c3f : Document renaming of valgrind.h to memcheck.h.
aac2c68 : fix this test for me. You can't rely on having exactly 3 nameservers configured in your system, can you?
87c85ee : the following small patch adds support for the (ancient and horrible) XLAT instruction. Microsoft in their infinite wisdom use it in their OLE dispatch code... (from Adam Gundy <arg@cyberscience.com>)
6b46fa8 : Fix a couple of missing MMX instructions. As far as I know, the only missing MMX insns now are those which move a value from an MMX reg to an integer reg, and these seem pretty rare. Easy enough to do if anyone falls across them.
819a8f7 : Updated the `cpuid' regression test for the new MMX-enabled behaviour.
901a4a9 : Teach memcheck skin how to deal with MMX instrumentation. Valgrind should now be fairly usable with MMX code.
3949d10 : Teach cachegrind about MMX uopcodes. Nick, can you check this? Thx -- J
ca86001 : More MMX stuff, including a bunch of prefetch insns.
ac21f44 : Update response to 'cpuid' to claim MMXness. Revised magic number supplied by JeremyF.
6b627da : More C++ syntax leakage fixes.
1ef2b1d : Fix C++ syntax leakage.
f5ca28c : Fix a bug to do with lazy eflags updating and FPU insns.
3d7c9c8 : Implement support for the MMX instruction set. The scheme used is the same as that for FPU instructions. That is, regard the MMX state (which is the same as the FPU state) opaquely, and every time we need to do a MMX instruction, move the simulated MMX state into the real CPU, do the instruction, and move it back. JeremyF's optimisation to minimise FPU saves/restores applies automatically here.
50aca9e : Documentation changes only.
3a751df : Suppressions for SuSE 8.2.
6452214 : Fix up the documentation to be just about OK for version 2.0.
285f77f : Comment change only: remove discussion of --client-perms flag and clarify performance consequences of client requests.
e12a45f : Duh. Make the system buildable again following recent commit of include/valgrind.h rev 1.10.
838654f : startup_segment_callback: Get rid of completely pointless check re ASSUMED_EXE_BASE. This is now pointless, and causes problems for people using Clearcase, since it seems their shared objects may not follow the convention that they end in .so.
34a257c : Various fixes to the client-perms include files to stop gccs yelping at high warning levels. Partially due to Andreas Jaeger and Hans-Peter Nilsson.
6591dc2 : A little cpp magic to cause compilation to fail if valgrind.h is included directly into sources (it should not be, and was causing people problems).
9d28c95 : Fix stupid typo in last commit.
0c15c33 : Fixed very minor bug with profiling. With cachegrind, if you specified --profile=yes without having built it for profiling (by #including vg_profile.c) it gave a "pushcc" panic, instead of a nice explanation.
a2952db : vg_profile.c, which is #included by skins that want to profile, was using some core only functions (vg_assert and VG_(core_panic)), which screwed things up. Replaced them with the skin versions. I don't know how this ever worked.
31f6cb5 : Require automake >= 1.5, as suggested by Dirk Mueller.
67aa818 : Change a bunch of AM_CFLAGS, AM_CXXFLAGS to CFLAGS, CXXFLAGS. The AM_ versions totally break compilation on RH6.2.
9060ecd : Added a stderr filter for new_override, that removes the exact numbers for malloc, because different glibc versions seem to allocate different amounts of memory.
7db3f38 : Make CXXFLAGS be the same as AM_CXXFLAGS, so the correct options are used to build the regression tests. I don't know if this is really the correct way to fix this problem. I don't understand why AM_CXXFLAGS aren't used by default for C++, seeing as how AM_CFLAGS evidently are used for C sources.
cbc82b4 : don't delete it too early
f5ef185 : fix make distcheck with newer automake
7d5b852 : Added a regression test that checks if command line arguments with spaces work.
cc731c0 : Undo rev 1.78, which I committed by accident. Duh.
ff7c1ab : o I fixed a small bug: the code in coregrind/vg_syscalls.c seems to assume that all sockaddrs are non-NULL and non-zero in length. This isn't always true, and when I ran a program that used a NULL sockaddr through Valgrind it segfaulted. I believe that the change that I made fixes this bug in general, but I might be overlooking something.
fa4690b : Change the recently added VG_(memcmp) to use UChars instead of Chars.
5dcde04 : Fixes handling of parameters with spaces in, and misc other magic hacks from Nick.
8407554 : Support for glibc-2.3.X. (from Stephan Kulow)
6d68e79 : [Julian, you might like to check these changes]
1045b0a : Added two new events: pre_deliver_signal and post_deliver_signal.
fdc28af : Added two new events: pre_deliver_signal and post_deliver_signal.
6fefa1b : Added a useful skin instrumentation function.
fedb736 : Increased maximum number of non-compact helpers.
04421d0 : Initial rough hack to spot the stack segment at startup by looking for a rwx mapping which contains the startup %esp.
669610b : Fix comment bug.
49b5d17 : Make poll() return (errno==EINTR) if the poll is interrupted by a signal.
f3fb92d : Hopefully deal with system 252 (__NR_exit_group) correctly.
e4e2405 : ---> 1.9.4
8fdbeed : Support kernels > 2.5.43 (David Kimdon <dwhedon@debian.org>)
17c7977 : Apply the following:
53fe458 : Further cleanups re new method for finding the stack segment at startup.
1c1b116 : Initial rough hack to spot the stack segment at startup by looking for a rwx mapping which contains the startup %esp. This should be more robust than the previous mechanism, which checked a small number of known places and gave up if none matched. This change is motivated by Gentoo Linux's high security mode, in which the stack location is chosen randomly for each new process.
c80c524 : Changed comments only: added a couple of missing syscall numbers.
b3f7c09 : Committed Jeremy F's patch 86:
f4ce3d3 : Fixed a minor bug -- the condition for determining whether VG_(handle_esp_assignment)() was needed by a skin (and thus whether to register it in the baseBlock) was different to that used when determining whether to call it in code generation... so it could be (attempted to be) called having not been registered.
6d57f7d : Fix really stupid cut + paste error.
66486e3 : Ugh, fixed it properly this time.
1a251a9 : Fixed comment typo.
211b6ad : Made VGOFF_(helper_idiv_64_32) and all the similar helper offsets visible to skins, so they can determine which helper is being called for CALLM instructions.
03a8953 : Minor documentation update about 'details'.
120281f : Made the setting of VG_(details).avg_translation_sizeB optional, defaulting to 100 bytes (added VG_DEFAULT_TRANS_SIZEB). Took the now-unnecessary settings out of Nulgrind and CoreCheck. Also made .avg_translation_sizeB a UInt (from an Int), to avoid possibility of negatives.
b93d178 : Added some functions for skins to access shadow registers: VG_(get_shadow_archreg), VG_(set_shadow_archreg), VG_(shadow_archreg_address). Curiously, the only way skins could previously access them was with VG_(shadow_reg_offset), which wasn't very flexible.
24f3579 : Added a comment.
563f96f : Renamed VG_(nameCondcode)() as VG_(name_UCondcode)() to make it consistent with similar functions, and made it visible to skins (useful).
5b3b0f3 : Fixed minor error in --trace-codegen=1xxxx output that meant 'shrdl' was being printed as 'shldl'.
fa0ad42 : Made more informative the error message that is shown when liveness problems occur... this is helpful when writing skins, because it's easy for problems with SK_(instrument)() to screw it up.
b877d49 : Added VG_(get_obj)().
ae17bec : Two minor changes:
8defbd2 : Small changes to expected output, due to recent changes in leak-check reporting.
c2c128b : I forgot to get rid of these when deleting the client stack perms stuff.
e088b83 : Add syscall 185 (__NR_capset). From Gerald Carter <jerry@samba.org>.
4edb65b : Only complain three times about unhandled ioctls, then shut up. Stops it complaining endlessly when running kscd.
59438c0 : Increase default bb limit from 1e+12 to 1e+15. The former limit could easily be reached in ~12 hours flat out computation on a fast machine with a simple skin. It happened to me.
bf310d9 : When ignoring memcheck-style client requests for block permissions changes, print a message the first 3 times so the user at least knows these requests are getting ignored. If I was less lazy I would make these requests -- at least those pertaining to memory addressibility -- be done properly. But I'm too lazy.
a81709d : Remove the mechanism which allowed clients to set block permissions on their stacks and have those blocks automatically cleared when the stack retreats past them. This never really worked, certainly didn't work in a multithreaded setting, and slowed everything down due to having to do even more stuff at %esp changes.
a75cd5a : Recognise Leak suppressions.
0973662 : synth_jcond_lit: fix bug in the sequences generated for LE/NLE. These assumed that ROR sets the P and Z flags and in fact it sets neither. Add an extra OR insn to really set those flags.
f0f12aa : Minor cleanup and verification of the lazy-eflag optimisation stuff. As of now it is correct, following several hours study.
706240d : Fix type errors in args to VG_(new_emit). No practical effect, since (Int)False == (Int)FlagsEmpty, but still.
ab2e123 : Implement pthread_getconcurrency, in the same way as LinuxThreads does it.
4bdd996 : Fix longstanding bug in make_thread_jump_to_cancelhdlr, which caused pthread_join to a cancelled thread not return PTHREAD_CANCELED as it should. This was due to a mix up with stack offsets.
4a19e2f : Don't panic on encountering a LeakSupp.
99aac97 : Implement suppressions for leak checks, which is a fairly frequently asked-for feature.
2f68595 : Don't assume Perl lives in /usr/bin; do a proper test for it.
32f5b3f : --> 1.9.3 (not ready yet, but change it anyway)
488dc28 : VG_(print_malloc_stats): change a %d to a %u.
6ccdd71 : vg_scan_all_valid_memory: Don't prod any page unless we're sure we need to. Poking pages unnecessarily can cause a page fault which under some rare circumstances can cause the kernel to extend the stack segment all the way down to the poked page, which is seriously bad.
279236e : Implement ADC Ib, AL.
48987df : Fix bug in MOV Iv,Ev when Ev is a reg. Noticed by Magnus Christensson <mch@virtutech.se>. The bug lasted this long because there is an alternative shorter encoding for the same insn which is usually used in preference.
ef0227c : Suppressions for R H 8.
dc7a98f : Remove spurious \n in message.
6e008cb : Change the behaviour of VG_(get_fnname) back to what it was, viz, not adding offsets ("+N") to the end of function names. Make a new function VG_(get_fnname_w_offset) with that behaviour and use it for %y in VG_(printf) et al.
a2c5a73 : #if 0 out unused functions.
3a63da6 : This test should actually elicit a (false) warning from memcheck, so the .stderr.exp should reflect that.
ce9d0f1 : Also update this for new code manager.
43a4482 : Fix regression failure caused by different messages from new code management stuff.
26e5da6 : Also diff the U (undefined) symbols.
e11d6c8 : Message cosmetics.
e1a39f4 : Change default state of the private-stacks optimisation to off, to be on the conservative side.
1f08689 : Remove comment line referring to old LRU stuff.
8e8f4b3 : whitespace change
5164748 : Get rid of the --check-addrVs flag and everything to do with it. It no longer makes much sense now we have a seperate addrcheck skin.

2c21624 : Merge patch from JeremyF:
a6e9fb9 : VG_(handle_esp_assignment): merge two conditional jumps into one on common path.

bd6473c : Tighten up assertion in VG_(target_forward).
a2113f9 : Merge patch from JeremyF:
75f0493 : Merge patch from JeremyF. This is a fixed version of the original 69-simple-jlo, which takes account of the fact that the P flag is set only from the lowest 8 bits of the result, a problem causing the original version of this patch not to work right.
0744b6c : Merge (from 1_0_BRANCH) rev 1.16.2.4 of the old vg_cachesim.c:
ac3414b : Back out rev 1.27 since this seems to be causing mozilla-1.2.1 to loop on memcheck on R H 6.2. Don't know why.
c232b21 : VG_(saneUInstr): relax CCf so as to allow insns which read ZCP -- the floating point conditional moves.
72baa7a : Make it build on R H 6.2 (with egcs-2.91.66).
3954207 : synth_jcond_lit: Handle simd cases for CondO / CondNO.
99cc5fd : Merge patch from JeremyF:
648b315 : NULLify the destructor field when a thread key is deleted. This allegedly fixes the following (haven't tested it myself):
b34e4db : Implement (nop, but that's OK according to POSIX) pthread_set_concurrency.
5706bfa : Implement (as a nop) pthread_rwlockattr_destroy.
fb5e527 : Clarify 65-fix-ldt (comment-only change).
dadc8d0 : Fix for the following (line number for 1.0.X series):
3237b94 : Get rid of the flag --fast-jcc; it's wired-on by default. Assumes that pushf/popf is catastrophically expensive on most target CPUs, which is certainly true for P3 and Athlon and I assume (but not checked) P4.
b4db402 : Merge patch from JeremyF:
d8033d9 : Merge patch from JeremyF:
ca340b3 : Merge patch from JeremyF:
06d3f8c : Re-add the NP case in synth_jcond_lit.
fa492d4 : Merge patches from JeremyF, to do lazy eflags updating:
d3e6a03 : Added the new 'detail' details_avg_translation_sizeB which was missing. It now works again.
6976b30 : VG_(switch_to_real_CPU): Apparently we can't reload the %cs register in untrusted mode. Strange. I thought I fixed this a couple of months back.
b5ff83e : Change the way INCEIP is done. Instead of emitting add insns, keep track of the current %EIP value and write it to memory at an INCEIP. Uses JeremyF's idea of only writing the lowest 8 bits if the upper 24 are unchanged since the previous write. [might this cause probls to do with write combining on high-performance CPUs? To be checked out.]
fd7747b : Merge patch (bug fix) from Jeremy F:
78210aa : Take into account TCEntry and alignment overheads when calculating TC sector sizes. Also, recalibrate all skins against mozilla-1.0.1.
83f1186 : Merge patch from JeremyF:
2370f3b : Merge patch from JeremyF:
e0cfe2a : Comment out unused function.
12a0e04 : Merge patch from Jeremy F:
22854b9 : Merge in a somewhat modified patch version of Jeremy Fitzhardinge's translation chaining patch.
1b7d802 : Merge patch from JeremyF (with a little added paranoia, for this one could potentially cause hard-to-find code generation bugs):
c0d8f68 : Complete integration of the new code management (sectored FIFO) story.
6c3769f : Complete overhaul of the storage of translations to properly support translation chaining. The old LRU system has gone, since it required marking each translation each time it was used -- simulating a reference bit. This is unacceptably expensive.
11c20f6 : Fixed up for core/skin interface change.
1d6c4bc : Moved setting of err->where outside the if/else; it was redundant because the same test is done with VG_(get_ExeContext2)().
ce1d7a8 : A small tool to help documentation writers. Copies docs out of an installation tree (`pwd`/Inst) back to the build tree since it is a lot easier to edit them in the installation tree. Use with care!
7cc53a8 : Removed some impossible code (thanks to the way it's called), added an assertion to ensure it remains impossible.
12f4c8a : Fixed broken regression tests:
e15728c : Fixed regression tests "broken" by one of Jeremy F's patches -- a bogus PThread error no longer needs to be suppressed.
9850e16 : Added copyright notice header and footer. No code changed.
5c004e4 : Overview: - Factored out a lot of commonality between AddrCheck and MemCheck. Basic idea is that common code goes into a single file in MemCheck, and AddrCheck peeks in and "borrows" it.
f555ac7 : Restructure the documentation to try and make it hang together better. Majorly improved. Still a lot to do, but the structure is better.
a1b3c45 : Add (bogus) support for ioctls CDROM_DRIVE_STATUS and CDROM_CLEAR_OPTIONS.
09cbb22 : (whitespace change only) -- break some long lines
68948f7 : A bit more flushing of stdout, so that "valgrind-listener | tee logfile" isn't so mysterious.

683c6ee : Changed Makefiles so that the following files are installed:
6ff0fe9 : At Jeremy F's suggestion, avoided some gratuitous rule duplication.
01fe69e : Compiling vg_intercept.c with -fno-omit-frame-pointer to improve error messages, as suggested by Jeremy Fitzhardinge.
6219d67 : sort_malloc_shadows: check a loop bound in establishing initial shellsort step size.
749124b : Fix error due to use of = as comparison, rather than ==, in profiling.
a9a2dcf : Add documentation back in, in its new form. Still all very rough and totally borked, but pretty much all the duplication is gone, and there is a good start on a common core section in coregrind/coregrind_core.html. At least I know where I'm going with all this now.
831d401 : Delete all the old documentation ...
c4446f6 : This isn't performance-critical; remove some optimisation flags.
7a6e746 : Added Makefile.am for auxprogs/.
ad19c69 : Clean up; add command-line spec of port # and request to exit when number of connections falls to zero. Also, handle SIGINT, and print time at start/exit.
27f1a38 : Added a basic core/skin interface versioning system. Each skin must use the macro VG_DETERMINE_INTERFACE_VERSION exactly once. If the X.Y core and skin versions don't have a matching X (indicating binary incompatibility), Valgrind will abort execution immediately at startup.
4335409 : Clean up; deal with tedious error handling etc.
4f094a7 : Rename VG_CLO_DEFAULT_LOGSOCKET to VG_CLO_DEFAULT_LOGPORT.
7d3d1e6 : Fix a buffering problem, so the output can sensibly be piped through /usr/bin/tee.
5ed7a39 : Add a simple listener program, which captures output from --logsocket=. Works, but needs refinement, + connection to the build system.
69a72a5 : Add a new client request, VG_USERREQ__LOGMESSAGE, and use this to route all commentary from our libpthread.so through to the valgrind core and hence to the selected logging sink.
570f890 : Robustification of logging to a socket. If the listener process dies or for whatever reason hangs up the connection, don't let valgrind get SIGPIPE; instead just switch back to spewing messages on stderr.
73cf3bc : Implement logging to a network socket. So it's now possible to do valgrind ... --logsocket=192.168.0.1:1500 or whatever, to send all output to that address/port combination.
bf89f31 : Fixed minor problem in regtest script.
e0bd5e4 : Fixed minor problem in regtest script.
4cf0569 : Implement --logfile=<file>, which causes all the log output to be written to "<file>.pid<pid>". Useful for tracing trees of processes.
65f1370 : Increase M_LOCKSET_TABLE to 5000, for Mozilla.

e49d8e7 : Files updated, added and removed in order to turn the ERASER branch into HEAD
bcd3ed3 : Fix the permissions of the installed files, as suggested by Matthias Andree.
1780dae : Undid the removal of INCEIPs during Cachegrind instrumentation. Although it helped performance, it could cause problems.
5a74eb8 : vg_from_ucode.c: - Improves the code generation for arithmetic instructions. Some arith instructions (ADC, SBB, RCR, RCL, some FPU) read EFLAGS -- integer ops for the carry flag, and FPU for ZCP (sometimes). But the rest don't.
22fea73 : Test case for resolver bug fixed by vg_libpthread.c rev 1.91. Thanks to Waldo Bastian for chasing this one into a corner.
b0ff103 : Simulate resolver-specific state as per the real libpthread.so, wherein the root thread (tid 1) always uses _res as exported from libc.so as its state. This fixes the name lookup problems in KAtlantik.
d506338 : Cache simulation requires strict INCEIP updating so that the boundaries between individual x86 instructions can be found when instrumenting UCode. However, EIP is not needed during execution, because the x86 instr addresses are copied into the cost-centres. So now they INCEIPs are removed during the instrumentation step once their task is done.
89969af : Trying to support the new C++ ABI of gcc 3.x
6431be7 : This commit introduces two new UInstructions: CCALL_1_0, CCALL_2_0.
8b2b7f0 : Wibbles for 1.0.0.
ade9d0d : Only run __libc_freeres() when valgrinding. It may do invalid free()s which cause the low-level memory manager to crash. When valgrinding that's all protected, but not when cachegrinding etc.
3a359fe : Final caveats for 1.0.0.
c50cf8d : --> 1.0.0 (yay!)
12ffdac : Print more helpful message on JIT failure to handle insns starting with 0x0F.
7545264 : Suppressions for R H Limbo (7.3.92)
4dfae15 : Implement __NR_getxattr.
ce61d05 : Track ELF frame changes as appearing in Red Hat Limbo (7.3.92).
1462c8b : Compile fixes for Red Hat Limbo (7.3.92).
8aef119 : Some jokers apparently like setting the CPU's AC (Alignment Check) flag for god-knows-why reasons. This causes VG_{READ,WRITE}_MISALIGNED_WORD to give bus errors. Redefine them to do the obvious byte-by-byte loads/ stores. Fortunately they are not performance critical.
fbb6cda : Assume PUTF modifies %EFLAGS in a completely arbitrary manner, and so be completely pessimistic if it is encountered during the redundant-flag- save/restore-elimination pass. This fixes the following mysterious failure:
35a916c : Support for x86 insn fldenv.
cbc79a9 : Skip directly to 1.0pre6 to avoid confusing me.
b0de29e : Add a suppression to deal with calling __libc_freeres().
6a5bd5e : Document probs with gcc-3.1 false positives.
1fe7b00 : At request of Ulrich Drepper, call __libc_freeres() after final __NR_exit so as to free memory allocated by glibc. This reduces the leaks reported in glibc, but causes a stack of read/write-after-free errors which have to be suppressed :-(
a256220 : possible fix for valgrinding problem on longer running kernels (2.4.18-SuSE, update 17 days)
b55fc4e : Suppress errors in __rawmemchr when called from anywhere at all.
8c664a9 : Mention kernel probs with R H "Limbo" public beta (hacked 2.4.18).
b0e8e2e : Document some limitations.
e91dce2 : ---> 1.0pre5
b1a77a4 : get_caches(): ensure caches are initialised on targets where get_caches_from_CPUID fails.
fe18eb8 : Copy pthread_rwlockattr_setpshared verbatim from LinuxThreads.
e532826 : Add __NR_quotactl. Allow NULL 3rd arg in __NR_sendfile. ("Didier")
da5402c : Include valgrind.spec and valgrind.spec.in in tarballs. Also add a line to the description in the .spec.in. (Shlomi Fish)
7cba715 : (Tim Rowley, verbatim)
2a8141a : Implement fnstenv (store FPU environment, but not regs AIUI) (Jeff Epler)
c26b448 : Print additional useful information immediately prior to VG_(panic)("VG_(mash_LD_PRELOAD_and_LD_LIBRARY_PATH) failed\n");
872051c : vg_signals.c: vg_oursignalhandler(): don't longjmp() on fatal signal if the scheduler's jmp_buf is not valid. This might avoid at least some of the following: vg_scheduler.c:479 (run_thread_for_a_while): Assertion `trc == 0' failed.
ec635b6 : Make sigsuspend() work well enough to keep zsh hackers happy.
18a62ff : Make VG_USERREQ__PTHREAD_YIELD actually yield the thread. This used to work but was broken in a subtle way by the cleanup of rev 1.70.
77f0fc1 : Check for signals to be delivered after every syscall. This avoids some obscure deadlock cases. (Neil Conway).
21be1e3 : Add comments about syscall wrapper problems.
ee8487d : ---> 1.0pre4
83abe43 : Add helpful info for package builders.
365a851 : Final documentation updates for 1.0.
bc7d878 : Implement --weird-hacks=truncate-writes to limit the size of write syscalls to 4096, to possibly avoid deadlocks under very rare circumstances. Is fully documented and commented.
89f20fd : cleanup_after_thread_exited: also clean up the waiting_fds table on thread disappearance. This fixes an assertion failure to do with thread nukage on fork(): vg_scheduler.c:936 (poll_for_ready_fds): Assertion `vgPlain_is_valid_tid(tid)' failed.
e8fb72e : Make --stop-after= work again.
7f03733 : ---> 1.0pre3
2cb0034 : Finally get around to implementing pthread_atfork.
986b0f8 : Removed line about Cachegrind being experimental.
a1269e4 : Partial implementation of mallinfo() (Ilpo Ruotsalainen)
5c509a1 : parse_cache_opt: Move free() of opt past last use.
6314442 : Forgot to VG_(free) a VG_(strdup)'d string.
d583e2c : Make __pthread_clock_gettime and __pthread_clock_settime appear for GLIBC_2.2.3. I dunno what this means, if anything, but someone reports it helps.
05bb2c9 : select() and poll(): change order of events in main timing loop so that very short selects/polls don't just cause a timeout with no real test.
d1c1cf2 : wait_for_fd_to_be_readable_or_erring: return immediately if fd is nonblocking anyway.
0c2f0d7 : vg_push_signal_frame: make the siginfo and ucontext fields readable too.
b1bcd26 : A libXpm suppression.
728a527 : Fix subtle bug in the interaction between pthread_create and thread_wrapper, exposed by scheduling changes caused by commit vg_scheduler.c rev 1.70. We cannot simply pass the __attr pointer to the child, since it could point to stuff on the parent's stack, which might not exist by the time the child looked at it. Prior to scheduler.c rev 1.70 the child would have been scheduled as soon as created, so the access was made before the parent could clear the stuff from its stack. From rev 1.70 and after the parent continues after creating the child, causing invalid stack accesses when the child finally runs.
124ca2a : Rationalise client-request handling a bit, by merging the two switches into one. This can change the scheduling a bit since the policy of running the same thread after the request if it is possible now applies to _all_ requests.
7fb5921 : --> 1.0pre2
ed2b8b1 : Add test case for sigpending().
1d6b3a2 : Make recv block only the calling thread, not the entire process.
be23ae7 : Add __NR_truncate64.
4018392 : Clear up historical artefacts.
efbfcdf : Implement sigpending(). All absolutely horrible. Sigh.
9a2224b : Implement pause().
d72a7d3 : Get rid of ancient stuff.
47e4e31 : Do pthread_rwlockattr_init.
6ea2938 : Add __NR_fdatasync. Also fix some formatting.
436c2db : Do siglongjmp, although without running cleanup handlers in the section of stack which it skips over.
8ce25cd : Further mess with the X config checks, so as to get a reasonably comprehensive set of X suppressions more robustly.
d84606d : - Check DWARF2 reader against spec. Add some clarifications and fix a minor error, but basically no significant changes.
8208ae8 : Increase thread limits a bit.
a3be12f : Add pthread_attr_setschedpolicy / pthread_attr_getschedpolicy.

9b9e10a : ---> 1.0pre1 Yay!
246d466 : Patrick Ohly's --alignment= patch, to increase alignment of malloc'd blocks if needed.
64a6a52 : ---> 20020613
2e43290 : Rename event-horizon to error-limit; the former may have trendy black-hole associations, but the latter actually cues one to what it might achieve.
a2541a9 : First round of manual update for 1.0.
088f118 : Be more robust to the situation where a signal arrives, and there is a handler, but in the interval between the signal arriving and it being delivered to the client, the handler is removed.
2e20763 : Make recvfrom() block only the calling thread, not the whole system ( same trick as used for accept() ).
72f98ff : Add --event-horizon=yes|no [yes] so that the limit on errors shown can be disabled if desired.
a83005f : Remove inclusion of <linux/module.h> and <asm/atomic.h> since that seems to lead to a portability swamp. As a result, remove autoconf check for <asm/atomic.h>. Replace all this junk with VKI_SIZEOF_STRUCT_MODULE (== 96) since that's all I ever wanted to know in the first place.
3a7b325 : Remove bogus assertion.
09c55fd : Allow detected CPU clock rates down to 50 MHz -- slower than the slowest Pentium, which is the oldest processor supported.
b7ad5a9 : Namespace police woz here
07133bf : Inconsequential cleanups to recent cachesim hacking.
05b7dfd : Whoops, forgot to add this last time.
9b3366a : vg_annotate.in: - fixed a bug that was breaking the --threshold option.
526e3fd : A few minor improvements.
8fb5a29 : Updated Cachegrind section for the CPUID-addition/vg_cachegen-removal.
7cf0bd3 : Removed the need for the user to generate a cache simulation -- now do automatic cache configuration detection using the CPUID instruction. This can be overridden from the command-line if necessary.
e306ffe : Converted some stab-reading assertions into warnings.
924bc00 : More RH73 suppressions.
aa4c2df : ---> 20020606
9bf05a8 : Add pthread suppressions.
57f12d3 : Fix typo in VALGRIND_MAKE_WRITABLE.
59da27a : Cancellation wrapper for recvmsg.
645030e : When a thread in a nanosleep() wait is interrupted by a non-restartable signal, cause the nanoslep to return with EINTR. Then, in the user-space nonblocking select() implementation, notice this and correspondingly return with EINTR. This appears to fix the MySQL hang-at-exit problem.
04b9106 : Only terminate stack traces when the %ebp trail goes cold, and not just because some addresses cannot be mapped to anything. Needed to give sensible stack traces on Red Hat 7.3.
e904795 : Minor mods to stop make the leak detector behave properly for the following kind of stupid test program int main (void) { char* a = malloc(100); return 0; } which many people seem fond of trying for some reason. In general the leak detector works fine.
b79ad34 : Small improvement to stabs reader to avoid warnings of this form:
4294fd4 : Cache simulator now handles basic block discards correctly. When VG_(cachesim_discard_notify) is called, the cost centre array for the basic block is removed from the table, and its counts are aggregated into a single "discard" cost centre, and the cost centre array is free'd.
95114da : Added compile-time option to print instruction addresses for each line in cachegrind.out. Increases file size by a fair bit, but useful for debugging stabs errors <sigh>
7107e5e : Tiny documentation wibbles
a601817 : A pthread error suppression.
7dd310d : ---> 20020604
5a3798b : Check addressibility of client-space addresses passed to pthread_* fns, which are to be written by valgrind.
4dced35 : A new kind of error: PThread errors. Used to report detected misuse in the pthread_* API.
3d7c8d6 : - report the size requested size in pthread_attr_setstacksize() when the size is bigger then the hardcoded value in valgrind. This makes it easier to find out which value to use for VG_PTHREAD_STACK_SIZE.
e509f4f : More assertion-failure avoidance in the stabs reader.
b5045ef : malloc_aligned: allow 262144
b83b6a7 : Whitespace only.
0e357db : Fix bug in signal handling in threads shown by Peter Gober: A signal *specifically directed* to one thread cannot be used to fulfill a sigwait() request by some other thread, reasonably enough.

ccef2e6 : As per POSIX, nuke all threads other than me - just before __NR_exec() - just after __NR_fork() when I am the child This makes OpenOffice 1.0 not have mutex-related assertion failures

8f253ff : Implement semaphore functions.

a651e4e : Modify cachegrind.in to track recent changes in valgrind.in
0ff1578 : Add getpmsg/putpmsg (Rick Watson)
3e1eb1f : Fix fork/exec stuff so it works again. We have to mangle LD_LIBRARY_PATH as well as LD_PRELOAD, so as to make our libpthread.so go out of scope when a child which we don't want to trace, is exec'd. Otherwise the child can wind up being connected to our libpthread.so but not to valgrind.so, which is an unworkable combination; you have to be connected to both or neither.
d9c2d6d : The ELF table created by old kernels (2.4.3 ish) is different from that created by newer 2.4 kernels. Try and handle that. (Untested).

18d7513 : Remove existing non-working support for self-modifying code, and instead add a simple compromise, in which the client can notify valgrind that certain code address ranges are invalid and should be retranslated. This is done using the VALGRIND_DISCARD_TRANSLATIONS macro in valgrind.h.
87650eb : ---> 20020515
3a951cf : More new-signal-hacks fixes.
018f762 : In accordance with "build one to throw away, you will anyway (tm)", throw away the old signals simulation and more or less start again from scratch. vg_signals.c is nearly a complete rewrite. In fact this is now the third generation of the signals simulation.
b94e77a : Fix incredibly stupid bug.
bff8876 : Expanded --sort option to take threshold args with the event names. Lets you do things like "show functions covering 99% of all D2mr events *and* 99% of all D2mw events" - before you could only choose the threshold for one.
03be163 : Use $(srcdir) to specify the location of the linker script
811d141 : Add another threads+signals test case along with the fix to make it work.
b48e500 : Add support for pthread_sigmask() and sigwait(). All absolutely horrible, especially the latter.
8d365b5 : Fix spelling mistake: wierd*hacks --> weird*hacks Also add a testcase.
3984b85 : In order to catch timeout events on fds which are readable and which have been ioctl(TCSETA)'d with a VTIMEout, we appear to need to ask if the fd is writable, for some reason. Ask me not why. Since this is strange and potentially troublesome we only do it if the user asks specially, by specifying --wierd-hacks=ioctl-VTIME.

a1679dd : Kernel 2.4 / glibc 2.2.X build fixes for recent startup changes.
3817091 : New and hopefully more reliable method for finding argc/argv/envp at startup, by looking for the ELF frame created on the process' stack at startup. This avoids having to deal with problems caused by glibc magic offsets.
68b2dd9 : Modify the startup mechanism so that any call into valgrind's libpthread.so will start up valgrind if it is not already running. This more or less sidesteps the problem that sometimes valgrind.so isn't init'd first by the dynamic linker.

db10f8a : --> 20020508
a0f921a : Only show the giant-basic-block message at verbosity >= 2.
b581a13 : Improvements to the error-collecting machinery:
126a41f : Actually call VG_(first_and_last_secondaries_look_plausible) and make assertions about the return value, rather than asserting the non-NULL-ness of the function's address :) Classic beginner's mistake, compounded by C's crappy (non-existent) type system, which allows me to silently confuse Bool with Pointer-to-Function. What a great programming language. Come back Haskell, all is forgiven.
4f51f9a : Generate better ucode for back-to-back sequences of register pushes and pops, as appear at function prologues/epilogues. Specifically, update %ESP just once for the whole sequence. This reduces by about 20% the number of calls to handle_esp_assignment (for kate in KDE 3.0, -O), which is a good thing since that is quite expensive.
7efaa11 : vg_symtab2.c: - No longer aborting when encountering a N_SOL symbol after the 65535th line in a file, just printing a warning/apology that annotations/messages might be wrong.
671ff54 : Minor profiling improvements. Add a couple of cost centers.

e0ee071 : vg_symtab2.c: - Can now handle file sizes > 65536 lines, despite the stabs format only storing line numbers in a short. Do this heuristically, by looking for line number sequences that go from 65000-odd to 0-odd within the same file.

97c4ae5 : ---> 20020502
215e7f0 : Jack up the size of the translation cache from 16 MB to 40 MB (!). This is needed to give reasonable behaviour for the insanity of a Mozilla debug build, apparently even worse than the insanity of a KDE 3 debug build. Change some limit calculations to use double rather than int, so as to avoid overflows.
8016240 : Improve my implementations of strcmp() and memcpy() since Nick's profiler indicates that KDE apps spend 20% of their simulated insns in these two functions alone.
d722c20 : fix for auto-annotating C++ method names (they have :'s in it)

98e91bc : Don't want to see these guys with just -v. There get to be bazillions of them after a while.
bf290b9 : Increase default thread stack size to 64k and institute crude overflow checks in scheduler_sanity().
0c3b53f : Reinstate use of VG_(do_sanity_checks), although at a lower frequency than before. Turns out they were wasting 25-50% of total execution time in valgrinds of the 200203XX vintage. Apologies, KDE hackers!

9aae674 : vg_symtab2.c: Discovered sometimes a SLINE stabs entry is the last one (which broke an assertion). In such a case, we must guess the line's instruction address range -- I've guessed 4, arbitrarily.

602392b : Right-justifying event names instead of left-justifying; easier to read when large numbers are involved and the columns are wide.

05f1aa1 : vg_improve() -- the ucode optimiser: consistently apply the no-deferred-updates of %ESP rule, regardless of end use of the ucode. This seems more consistent, and was exposed following examination of code causing an assertion failure in the cache profiler. Added an assertion to check this too, and was surprised I hadn't had an assertion there in the first place.

650ac00 : Fix really stupid error in computation of timeout point in nonblocking poll(). After this change, Mozilla-0.9.2.1 and Galeon 0.11.3 finally behave reasonably on my box.
aec22c0 : Fix a subtle (?) bug in sched_do_syscall to with read/write calls for which the client has already got the fd in nonblocking mode. In such cases, do not wait for an IO completion -- since the client presumably handles that somehow.

5716dbb : Fix many holes and bugs in an attempt to get my libpthread.so to export the same set of symbols as the real one, which I now realise is crucial for it to work at all.
853f55d : Fix various bugs getting in the way of licq starting up.
3b13f0e : Try and give at least some minimal binding for all functions exported by the real libpthread.so. In the process fix a bunch of stuff, including adding thread-specific h_errno and resolver state storage. This fixes licq crashing at startup.

d1e8649 : Back out rev 1.10. It can't possibly be the right fix.
7ccc5c2 : VG_(oursignalhandler): when catching a fatal signal, don't longjmp back to the scheduler if the signal is already pending. There's something very suspicious about all this, though.
cfdf27c : Get rid of incomprehensible special-case treatment of SIGABRT. Might have made sense once but it doesn't any more.

f2537be : VG_(maybe_add_context): also stop collecting errors when the total number (in contrast to the total number of _different_) of them gets too high.
c76be29 : VG_(malloc_aligned): accept req_alignB == 4.
be32e45 : Wrappers for open64/lseek64.
c96f931 : Once VG_(maybe_add_context) starts ignoring errors, ignore them right up front, in the VG_(record_*_error) functions. This is an attempt to avoid excessive performance problems with programs which have excessive numbers of errors.
14e0342 : - Fast-track pthread_mutex_trylock(), even though programs which use it extensively are probably badly designed -- they are polling.

3059442 : Add test for stupid malloc etc args.
5c3ea67 : Detect, print warning, and "correctly" handle implausible requests such as malloc(negative-argument). You'd be amazed at the stupidity of some of the programs people run on valgrind.
1685184 : - Use CFLAGS in demangle/Makefile.am - Get rid of -Werror; it breaks to many people's builds. It can be passed in with make variable WERROR if needed.
f228af1 : --> 20020424.
796d6a2 : Add wrapper for sendto().
6e435c0 : Add __NR_madvise.
72d5848 : More glibc-2.1.X compiler fixes (Lionel Ulmer).
d8091eb : minor tweaks to constants
d7fd4d2 : Fast-track pthread_mutex_{lock,unlock} in the scheduler. This reduces their cost by about a factor of 20, which fixes the performance probs observed with Opera.
56fc53d : Fix total b0rkage of signal handling caused by stupidly giving the same value to VG_USERREQ__READ_MILLISECOND_TIMER and VG_USERREQ__SIGNAL_RETURNS. Duh.
5f07b66 : Various upgrades, with the effect that mozilla now runs, although it has tremendous performance problems.

e6a2524 : GDB-attach cleanups. Have our own system() so we don't have to use glibc's, and tell the user if starting GDB failed for some reason.
783f0f5 : %@]$*$* Intel and their %@]$*$* stupid braindead assembler mnemonics!
