e585907 : fix compilation
3580542 : Make the GDB-attach stuff thread-aware, and work (at least partially) when running multithreaded. Can still cause crashes (assertion failures) when GDB exits. I think it that's due to my use of libc's system() call; should roll my own.
f854f47 : Add a nonblocking poll() -- same trick as nonblocking select(). Add pthread_cond_destroy().
969129d : Add JCond-32 NP (long jump when parity odd) and CMOV NP too.
02535bc : Minor tweaks to the nonblocking select() implementation.
30671ff : Add pthread_mutex_trylock, and add various other hacks to try and make Mozilla work.
0555387 : Add comments explaining checks made by scheduler_sanity().
cb4d3d8 : Sigh. Remove -Werror because it causes the ./configure test for working const qualifier to fail. This causes config.h to #define const to nothing, which causes the whole compilation to fail.
0738a59 : Add pthread_condattr_destroy.
2553b8c : Snapshot date -> 20020420.
3b5d886 : Add fairly complete, and apparently working, support for condition variables.
aabd5ad : VG_(record_free_error) / VG_(record_freemismatch_error) are called by the scheduler, not by generated code. So pass in the relevant ThreadState*; don't get it from VG_(get_current_tid)().
6072c36 : Continue trying to extract myself from the pthread_mutex_* swamp.
604ec3c : Simply and rationalise pthread_mutex implementation, in preparation for implementation of condition variables.
1e8cdc9 : Yay! Opera (6.0TP2) now works.
408ccf1 : Compile flags += -Werror. I'm tired of looking carefully for warnings.
8d32be7 : Oops! The floating-point conditional-move instructions read %EIP, so we'd better annotate them as such!
f8f819e : Sanity check mutex implementation, and add support for recursive mutexes.
9d1b5d3 : Get rid of bogus vg_assert(VG_(bbs_done) < 1000000); intended to test previous commit. Duh.
15a43e1 : Show backtraces for all threads in vg_assert, VG_(panic) and VG_(unimplemented). In future this will not be enabled by default due to the danger of recursion of assertion failures.
45b4b37 : Change --trace-pthread= flag to accept none|some|all, for finer level of pthread event tracing. And allow this info to be passed across to the client, where vg_libpthread.c uses it to also control verbosity.
ea8bfd8 : ignore
6af4b5d : Add more pthread wrappers in a failed attempt to get Opera 6.0TP2 to run. Now it creates some threads but segfaults. Also add wrapper for syscall __NR_mremap; it is way wrong, but finding a decent description of what mremap() really does is nearly impossible.
9650c99 : Handle VG_USERREQ__PTHREAD_GET_THREADID and VG_USERREQ__RUNNING_ON_VALGRIND cheaply, with the trivial-client-request mechanism. The latter is called once per pthread call, even simple ones like pthread_mutex_[un]lock.
79be106 : Get rid of the muraroa.demon.co.uk references since that account is soon to disappear.
827d95b : Update the message on clone() failure to reflect new pthreads work.
fce1c8e : Make --demangle=no work as advertised.
c9add3b : Don't refer to IPC_64 if it doesn't exist. Was breaking builds on older systems.
c7529c3 : Get rid of the --client-perms= flag. Valgrind now depends critically on the client-request subsystem, and disabling it is no longer a sensible thing to do.
eb37947 : Don't skip the top frame when picking up ExeContexts for malloc etc. This restores the pre-pthread-merge behaviour.
7cf4875 : Fix -Wall complaints.
0ece28b : Relent, and properly implement bt/bts/btc/btr for literal bit-offsets. bt_literal.c is a somewhat halfhearted test case for it.
22bafd9 : Get rid of the old bt/bts/btr/btc implementation.
a5abdaa : Add fairly comprehensive test case for bt/bts/btc/btc, mem and reg targets, although size-L (4-byte) only. In any event the jitter doesn't handle the size 2 case and has never been asked too, AFAIK.
7f2a8bf : Correctly implement x86 bt/btc/bts/btr insn. Previous impl was wrong:
2f242b3 : malloc() and friends have moved to vg_clientfuncs.c, so move the -fno-omit-frame-pointer flag there too. Otherwise they are invisible in backtraces.
47160d6 : fix initial installation problem
48ccca5 : some workarounds for newer automake
b0a955e : use install-exec-hook to create the .so.0 symlink.
fed4dd0 : Fix problems to do with make dist/make distcheck not finding the source file vg_libpthread.so.0.c. Now:
2a3d28c : Turn off debug printing by default.
5e5fa51 : Add dummy stubs for pthread_key_create, pthread_key_delete, pthread_setspecific, pthread_getspecific. They don't do anything right now and may well crash programs which use them.
9a199dc : * external namespace check * VG_(printf) format strings check
8c82451 : Plumb the right %EIP and %EBP values through to VG_(get_ExeContext) now that we have the additional complication of multiple threads.
75fe189 : Minor cleanups: * when a thread exits, mark its stack as noaccess * print VgTs_Sleeping status correctly
77e466c : Take notice of SA_RESTART flags on signals, so as to deal (at least partially properly) with blocking system calls interrupted by signals.
70c7536 : Add wrapper for lseek().
e462e20 : poll_for_read_fds(): don't waste time calling select() if there are no waiting fds.
08a4c3f : Ultra-hacking implementation of non-blocking select() using blocking select and non-blocking nanosleep(). Barf. Does seem to work tho.
bc5b99f : Write return address for threads in assembly so we can reliably grab their return values.
54cacf0 : Cleanup of the dispatch mechanism. Now syscall returns and the final request to shutdown valgrind are done with the client request mechanism too. This is much better than having to check all call/return addresses.
d985979 : simple_mutex program from the OReilly pthreads book.
8937c81 : Clean up debug printing for scheduler / pthreads. Two new flags, --trace-sched=no|yes and --trace-pthread=no|yes, if you really want to see tons of gory details.
be54e1f : added rules to generate libpthread.so
cf2b14a : Oops! An important file I forgot to add (is part of the pthread_ mega-merge).
2e93c50 : Mega-merge of my last 2 weeks hacking. This basically does the groundwork for pthread_* support. Major changes:
e663cb9 : New files to support pthreads.
def1bad : cosmetic fixes
7b8c9e7 : Add spurious comment.
00ccc35 : From the OReilly book, page 15. Uses _create and _join.
59528b2 : cosmetic fixes
69896d5 : updated the info about the default.supp file.
3b77789 : splitted the suppression files so that default.supp can be created by picking from the library specific supp files.
497e52a : Please change my e-mail address to amu@alum.mit.edu; monk is just a finger server that knows how to deal with my account. (Perhaps I should clarify my .sig?)
bbc9419 : Someone claimed that this gives reads below %esp when compiled with g++ 3.0.4; I can't repro it. But am collecting anyway.
418d3a3 : version --> 20020329
73f1f07 : wrappers for ioctl TIOCSCTTY and for syscall __NR_nice.
0ca2a6b : (VG_(do__NR_sigaction)): Don't allow setting of handlers for SIGKILL or SIGSTOP. This fixes valgrind: vg_signals.c:723 (vgPlain_do__NR_sigaction): Assertion `our_old_handler == ((void *)0)' failed.
19fe3d0 : Add wrapper for ioctl TIOCGPGRP (Alexandre Duret-Lutz <duret_g@epita.fr>)
5b9e350 : Significantly improved SYSV IPC call handling. Unfortunately some of this stuff doesn't use safe_dereference when it should.
11818b2 : Add a couple of bogons people sent.
45a5630 : added support for maintainer mode.
b0ed467 : added support for maintainer mode
1be1985 : Applied patch from Simon Hausmann <hausmann@kde.org> to enable automake1.5 compilation, except for the use of $(EXEEXT) which generates annoying warnings.
ac68028 : Change VG_N_EPOCHS to 20000 to avoid resolution loss for long-running loops.
97ced73 : Add experimental omission of V-bits for address values, using --check-addrVs=no. The default behaviour, =yes, is the original behaviour. So far this is undocumented.
c76b795 : added a bzdist target
4a7456e : Detect FPU instructions which set %EFLAGS and mark the resulting UInstrs accordingly. Fixes a bug in the simulated CPU in which the results of f{u}comi{p} FPU insns were ignored, potentially leading to wrong program behaviour. This will only have happened to people using P6/P7/K7 class CPUs.
5c2d9ce : compile wibble
3e2c3b8 : Remove mention of vg_version.h.
a88ebf6 : Use autoconf tests for glibc version in argc/argv/envp search.
3b2736a : Fix plumbing of version number from config.h to vg_main.c
c40438f : version --> 20020324
3125694 : Add test case for the fucomip probable-bug.
c7c6aed : Print suggested fix to avoid this panic: VG_ASSUMED_EXE_BASE doesn't match reality
fe8a166 : Implement DAA as well as DAS. Byrial Jensen <byrial@image.dk>
8a5089d : #ifdef SNDCTL_DSP_GETCHANNELMASK and SNDCTL_DSP_BIND_CHANNEL; not available on all Linuxes, it seems.
da6d1ec : Add suppression from Joe Buck <Joe.Buck@synopsys.com>
177380e : Markup wibbles.
a7dc795 : Change message "Use of uninitialized CPU condition code" to "Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)", since that will be more meaningful to most programmers. Also change the suppression-kind to Cond in .supp files. The old Value0 descriptor means the same and is still accepted. Suggested by Joe Buck <Joe.Buck@synopsys.com>.
d7f0766 : Add syscall setresgid32
7ed2615 : (merge from 20020320) Final comments.
2f0de32 : (merge from 20020320) Syscalls/ioctls added between 0317 and 0320.
b3c2687 : (merge from 20020320) (commented out): sleep(10) at startup to give enough time to attach GDB.
3a72df0 : (merge from 20020320) Modify codegen_SAHF so the instrumenter doesn't generate spurious value errors if parts of %eax other than %ah are undefined.
4d0ab1f : (merge from 20020320) Implement x86 das instruction.
0873c94 : (merge from 20020320) Allow suppressions with only a single level of backtrace, for suppressing against libraries compiled with -fomit-frame-pointer.
